Title: b'Microsoft Legal Internship'
Summary: b'As a Legal Intern at Microsoft, you will work within our Corporate, External & Legal Affairs department in Redmond, Washington.'
Details:
b"Microsoft is going through a transformational change to become the leading Cloud first, Mobile first company. Microsoft aspires to help our customers achieve their own digital transformation. Every day, we work to help our customers leverage the power of Microsoft\xe2\x80\x99s solutions and services, to support our mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more.
Microsoft\xe2\x80\x99s legal team champions our company's integrity and works to earn and maintain public trust. As an attorney, government affairs specialist or legal business professional, you will find the best of both worlds here: we have the quality-of-life advantages of in-house counsel paired with a stimulating work environment that spans litigation, intellectual property, transactions, licensing, and global migration. Get ready to overcome challenges, forge solutions and provide direct counsel to the cutting edge of the world\xe2\x80\x99s most dynamic industry.
Responsibilities
As a Legal Intern at Microsoft, you will work within our Corporate, External & Legal Affairs department in Redmond, Washington. You will have a broad range of responsibilities from across the department, which may include researching legal issues impacting business strategy, drafting transactional documents, attending client meetings and product reviews, and collaborating with internal teams on cross-group projects.
Qualifications
Qualifications:
Applicants must be first-year law students in good standing for the degree of J.D. from an ABA accredited law school.
Excellent analytical ability and legal drafting skills.
Excellent oral and written communications skills and the ability to communicate effectively across a large number of diverse internal groups, teams and divisions.
A demonstrated ability to work efficiently, meet deadlines, and manage multi-dimensional projects in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to research and learn new concepts and legal issues quickly to facilitate problem solving.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work."

Title: b'Global Health Security Internship'
Summary: b'Through this internship, the selected candidate(s) will provide coordination and communications support to the GHS Initiative.\nFamiliarity with French a plus.'
Details:
b"The Global Health Security team is seeking two virtual interns to support the US-based teams in Seattle, WA and Washington, D.C.

Please submit cover letter and writing sample with application


PATH is a global organization that works to accelerate health equity by bringing together public institutions, businesses, social enterprises, and investors to solve the world\xe2\x80\x99s most pressing health challenges. With expertise in science, health, economics, technology, advocacy, and dozens of other specialties, PATH develops and scales solutions\xe2\x80\x94including vaccines, drugs, devices, diagnostics, and innovative approaches to strengthening health systems worldwide


PATH\xe2\x80\x99s Global Health Security team leads several projects and initiatives that serve the Global Health Security Agenda (GHSA) and aim to strengthen global capacity to prevent, detect, and respond to infectious disease threats. These include the five-year, Centers for Disease Control (CDC)-funded Global Health Security projects; the USAID Infectious Disease Detection and Surveillance (IDDS) project; and several Fleming Fund projects aimed at combatting and preventing the spread of antimicrobial resistance. The Global Health Security team is seeking two virtual interns to support the US-based teams in Seattle, WA and Washington, D.C. The Seattle based intern will support the CDC Global Health Security and Fleming Fund projects and the D.C. based intern will support the IDDS project.


Through this internship, the selected candidate(s) will provide coordination and communications support to the GHS Initiative. Activities will include supporting document and knowledge management, updating project management tools and trackers, developing PowerPoint presentations, editing communications materials, and providing status updates of project deliverables to the team. The intern will be expected to support and facilitate efficient and clear communication across global teams of experts and provide support to new and ongoing projects. The intern may have the opportunity to widen this scope subject to project activities and personal interests.


Responsibilities:

The intern will be involved in hands-on work related to project coordination and communications.
The intern will build ability to multi-task and work professionally with various colleagues and mentors within PATH, developing project coordination, management, and organizational skills.
The intern will deepen their knowledge and understanding of the fundamentals of public health, surveillance, and epidemiology.
The intern will gain and utilize experience in proposal writing and report preparation.
Support project coordination and management.
Update capacity statements and other communications materials.
Assist in the coordination of business development opportunities and external affairs, as needed.
Assist the Senior Program Assistant with developing and refining donor project reports.
Participate in regular project calls with country offices.
Assist in finalizing project deliverables including editorial reviews.

Required Skills

Required Experience

Current student enrolled in an accredited university.
Strong project coordination and management skills, with excellent organizational skills and a high level of attention to detail.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Knowledge of and interest in global health, international development, and project management.
Knowledge of Microsoft Office software, including Excel, Outlook, and OneNote.
Ability to adapt within a fast-paced environment.
International work or study experience a plus.
Familiarity with French a plus.

PATH does not provide a stipend to interns who are California residents.
All PATH internships are eligible for school credit. Please refer to your university's process for credit eligibility.

Must have legal authorization to work in the United States.


PATH is dedicated to diversity and is an equal opportunity employer.


PATH is an equal opportunity employer. Every qualified applicant will be considered for employment. PATH does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or orientation, genetic information, age, national origin, marital status, disability status, political ideology, military or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.


*PATH has become aware of scams involving false job offers.*


Please advise:


 PATH will never ask for a fee during any stage of the recruitment process.


All active jobs are advertised directly on our career's page.
Official PATH emails will always arrive from an @path.org or @silkroad.com email address.


Please report any suspicious communications to careersitehelp@path.org"

Title: b'PR Assistant Intern'
Summary: b'Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s Worldwide Communications (WWC) team invites undergraduate professionals to join us for a paid 10-12-week full-time internship in 2021 (virtual or\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Currently enrolled in a BA/BS degree program.
Graduating between December 2021 to August 2023
Previous work, internship, and/or other leadership experience in a professional/academic environment in communication(s), public relations, and/or writing.

Come build the future with us.

Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s Worldwide Communications (WWC) team invites undergraduate professionals to join us for a paid 10-12-week full-time internship in 2021 (virtual or location-based). We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for current sophomore and junior students who possess an interest in writing, communications, and social media. We invite candidates to apply who are curious and excited to learn more about what it\xe2\x80\x99s like to work at Amazon.

Throughout the summer, you will work across our communications organization, learning the ins-and-outs of public relations, refining your writing skills, learning from Amazon leaders, and working with a mentor. You will also offer your own insight into how Amazon should think about communicating, all while applying innovative and global thinking. You will spend time with teams from our social media, Amazon Studios, Corporate, Devices, and/or Retail divisions, attending events (even if virtual), diving into their innovative products and services, and working on their communications approaches. The internship will culminate in a summer-long project that you\xe2\x80\x99ll present to WWC leaders.

Successful candidates will bring diverse perspectives and varied experiences (whether from school, life, or past jobs). We value peculiarity and curiosity (see our Leadership Principles), and hope you\xe2\x80\x99re interested in joining us.

About Worldwide Communications
Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s WWC is comprised of hundreds of communications professionals, based globally. We are responsible for better informing customers, media, employees, and policymakers about Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s unique culture of innovation and customer centricity, cutting-edge products and services, workplace and employee programs, environmental and sustainability initiatives, and more. WWC aims to continuously strengthen Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s reputation and trust with customers by educating the world about Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s products and services, and how we support employees, small businesses, partners, content creators, developers, the economy, the environment, and communities where we operate.


Highly effective oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills with demonstrated ability to effectively and comfortably interact with colleagues of diverse backgrounds and varying levels of seniority.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability to create and effectively deliver factual, relevant, and clear messaging, research, etc.
Motivated self-starter who can work well autonomously.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.'

Title: b'Summer Undergraduate Intern'
Summary: b'Must currently be a full-time student at an accredited college or university in the United States (To be eligible, graduating seniors must demonstrate they have\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details: b'ISB Summer UndergraduateResearch Experiences ProgramThe ISB Summer Undergraduate Research Experiences Program offers undergraduates with a diversity of backgrounds, career goals and experiences the opportunity to experience research side by side with experts in systems biology.ISB is an internationally renowned non-profit research institute dedicated to the study and application of systems biology. Founded in 2000 in Seattle, Washington, ISB\xc2\xb4s goal is to unravel biological complexity by deciphering vast amounts of data in order to gain valuable insights and achieve breakthroughs across scientific disciplines.To support learning, student interns will:Be paired with a mentor based on their interests. Students with a demonstrated interest in fields such as biology, chemistry, computer science, information science, applied mathematics, and/or engineering are all good fits for the types of research projects available.Participate in a research project developed by the student intern\xe2\x80\x99s mentorBe included in all events at ISB, including lab meetings and retreatsParticipate in ongoing professional development including attendance at workshops, seminars, & team tasksComplete a poster with the support of their mentor and other ISB staff to be shared at an ISB-wide mini-symposiumBe included (where applicable) on the development of publications that result from their research projectLogistics of research experiences at ISB:The program selects a broad range of students, from current freshmen through to seniors with a diversity of backgrounds, career goals and experiencesStudent interns will work 30-40 hours per weekDependent upon project and pandemic regulations, participants may be full or part time at the ISB facility in Seattle or be asked to work remotelyStudent interns with financial need, will receive financial assistanceStudents interns will be at ISB for 10 consecutive weeks that must include the seven week period between June 21, 2021 to August 6, 2021.ISB does not provide housing but students qualify for summer intern housing at UWRequirements:Must be authorized to work in the USMust currently be a full-time student at an accredited college or university in the United States (To be eligible, graduating seniors must demonstrate they have been accepted to graduate school immediately following their internship at ISB)Must have a current minimum GPA of 3.0A completed applicationISB Careers page application (click "Start Your Application" below).Google Form application (a sample of the Google Form application is available here to help to prepare your responses).Only online applications will be consideredTimelineJanuary 15 - Application process opens.February 22 - Application process closes at 5 pm PST.January 31-March 29 - Phone interviews and informal offersWeek of April 5 - Formal offer letters sent to selected applicantsPlease direct questions to Jen Eklund, jen.eklund@isbscience.org with Summer Undergraduate Research Experiences question in the subject line.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time'

Title: b'Intern-Cancer Biology'
Summary: b'This position will work with members of the laboratory of Dr.\nTaran Gujral in the Division of Human Biology to embark on an exciting journey to tackle two of\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details: b"The Gujral lab at the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center has an opening for Volunteer internship that would be perfect for a senior student in biological sciences. This position will work with members of the laboratory of Dr. Taran Gujral in the Division of Human Biology to embark on an exciting journey to tackle two of the most burning issues in cancer treatment, metastasis and drug resistance, through an approach which combines cutting edge high-throughput methods and focused biology studies in cell lines and various mouse models. Students will gain hands-on experience in using state-of-the art technologies in proteomics and genomics.Position would begin with 2-week trial period where the student will complete lab tasks to ensure an adequate time commitment is feasible and a copacetic atmosphere is maintained. If everything works out, there will be a training period (varies dependent on individual) before moving on to your own project. Projects could vary from tumor micro-environment to immuno-oncology to tumor metabolism and drug resistance. A student could participate in many of the aspects of the work in the lab and would be expected to learn how to develop a research question, design experiments to answer the question, perform experiments, interpret the results and design additional experiments based on the results. Depending on their specific interests, the student could learn about different cancer models including PDX, orthotopic, chemical-induced and xenograft, and many other current methodologies such as reverse phase lysate microarrays, high throughput live cell microscopy-based assays, immunofluorescence microscopy, western blot analysis, RNAseq, quantitative PCR and use of various data analysis software. In addition, students will also have the opportunity to present their research during lab meetings and scientific conferences and to write, submit, and publish scientific papers. Expected time commitment of 10-20 hrs/week for at least one semester. Undergrad credit for research is a possibility. Prior lab experience in biological sciences is preferred. The intern will report directly to Dr. Gujral but is expected to integrate and function as team member at Gujral lab and Human Biology.Should you have interest to join us to discover new targets and develop new drugs to find solutions for cancer metastasis and drug resistance, please send resume or C.V to tgujral AT fredhutch.orgJob Types: Part-time, InternshipSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:High school or equivalent (Preferred)Work Location:One locationThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneousAdaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in directionDetail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger pictureAchievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might failInnovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativityHigh stress tolerance -- thrives in a high-pressure environmentThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Innovative -- innovative and risk-takingDetail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedCompany's website:https://research.fredhutch.org/gujral/en.htmlWork Remotely:No"

Title: b'Infrastructure Project Management Intern'
Summary: b'The Project Manager Intern work closely with cross functional teams to ensure successful delivery of portfolio work.\nRetail IT environments and systems.'
Details:
b"We are looking for a Project Management Intern to contribute to REI's success by managing aspects of one or more of our infrastructure portfolio initiatives. This includes planning, scheduling, coordinating activities and dependencies across various teams along with providing communication and visibility on progress and potential blockers. The Project Manager Intern work closely with cross functional teams to ensure successful delivery of portfolio work.
Throughout the course of your internship experience, you will work alongside supportive team members who will help you elevate and grow in a fun, high-energy environment. We view the intern role as an equal opportunity to learn from the intern we will bring on. We know you will have great ideas and we want to give you a platform to share and apply those ideas.

Examples of our Intern projects may include:
REI Store build outs
What does it take to get an REI store opened? Be part of our New Store Program team and learn what it takes to stand up all the technologies to support and run and REI store. Aside from IT teams, you will work with multiple non-IT groups such as Construction, Fixtures, Retail Operations, Procurement and more.
Device Lifecycle management
Learn about supply chains and end to end management of keeping business environments maintained with relevant hardware. Work with various IT groups and Retail Operations to plan, procure and refresh end of life equipment in our retail stores.
Process improvement
Lean, Six Sigma, TQM or other methodologies can be used to improve aspects of various delivery lifecycles and processes used to get work done. Bring an execution improvement mindset and make a lasting positive impact on the Co-op and environment.

REI Introduction and Exposure to:
Retail IT environments and systems
Infrastructure required to keep businesses going
Challenging project assignments
Project and process management activities
Cross-divisional intern activities
Mentorship

Bring your passion and expertise

Job functions include:

Project planning, facilitation, communication, and leading efforts
Collaborating across teams and stakeholders
Continuous improvement mindset and recommendations for process improvements
Qualifications and expectations:
Currently majoring in CS or CSE undergrad
Coursework completed in some following areas: CS Principals, Software Engineering, Project Management, Information Systems, Vendor Management
Candidates should have a strong aptitude in analytics, teamwork and problem solving

Title: b'Intern, Equities'
Summary: b'Document and reflect on the internship experience.\nRussell Investments\xe2\x80\x99 Summer Equities Intern Program is designed to prepare candidates for a full-time role in\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"Business Unit:
Investment Division

Job Description:
When you intern at Russell, you\xe2\x80\x99re a full member of the team. Our internships are a rewarding learning experience as they allow students to get a head start on their career, learn from lead ers in the industry and work in a stimulating and challenging environment while being well compensated. Russell Investments\xe2\x80\x99 Summer Equities Intern Program is designed to prepare candidates for a full-time role in the investment management industry. The intern will have an opportunity to work with a variety of associates within the Equities team in the Investment Division.
The responsibilities of the individual in this position include:
You will support the Portfolio Managers (PMs) and Portfolio Analysts (PAs) with many aspects of investment management, portfolio implementation, portfolio analysis, investment process and reporting functions.
Duties include the following:
Generating quarterly reports on stock portfolios that will be used by the Equity team to identify and understand sources of risk and return
Producing ad-hoc information regarding stock portfolio characteristics, economic data, or individual securities on an as needed basis
Working with the investment team to build and improve overall investment process and investment outcomes
Liaising with portfolio operations and various custodian banks on reconciliation issues and account set up need
Running and interpreting analytical software; preparing monthly and ad hoc reports and analysis
Running performance attribution, preparing pre/post trade analytics, transaction cost measurement
Working with internal technology teams to improve and support the team's infrastructure and related systems
Document and reflect on the internship experience. We would like to maximize the value add of these internships both to our team and to our interns.
Suggestions for improvement and efforts to set the stage for each subsequent intern are welcomed and appreciated
The successful candidate will have extensive demonstrable skills and experiences including the following:
Finance, Economics, Mathematics or related major finishing his/her sophomore or junior year of college in May/June 20 2 1
Ability to work full-time ( 40 hours per week ) during summer
Candidate should possess a team-oriented mindset and must be comfortable accepting assignments from a variety of people
Must possess the flexibility and willingness to perform various ad-hoc assignments
Detail oriented with an eye for quality
Willing to ask for help when needed
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Completion of an investments class or practical investing experience
Programming language proficiency strongly preferred (such as python, c sharp, r, etc )
Intermediate Excel capabilities (Pivot Tables, VBA, statistical analysis) strongly preferred
Proficient with Excel, PowerPoint, and Word, and ability to learn other software applications
Equal Employment Opportunity
Russell Investments is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all associates and employment applicants regardless of race, religion, ancestry, creed, color, gender (including gender identity which refers to a person's actual or perceived sex, and includes self-image, appearance, behavior or expression, whether or not different from that traditionally associated with a person's biological sex), age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, military status, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, past or present unemployment status , or any other characteristic protected by law."

Summary: b'Recruiting for the 2021 internship program takes place from September 2020 through March 2021.\nThis is a 12-week paid learning experience with the team of\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Bring your passion, your ideas and your potential.
Are you ready for a challenge that could launch your career? T-Mobile is revolutionizing the wireless industry for millions of customers nationwide. Working here means rolling up your sleeves and redefining the status quo with a team that has your back every step of the way!
You\xe2\x80\x99re encouraged to be an Intern with our Marketing Team!
Ready to work with one of the most exciting brands in the world? This is a 12-week paid learning experience with the team of creative achievers who builds our brand around outstanding products and services that make a significant impact on consumers' busy lives.
Our team includes Brand Communications, Advertising, Future State Enablement, Customer Management, Device and Rate Plan Management, Media, Sponsorship and Events, Digital Insights and Solutions plus Product Management, Experience and Delivery, and Analytics. We\xe2\x80\x99re primarily based at our headquarters campus in Bellevue, WA, but we\xe2\x80\x99re also located in various regional business offices across the country.
Working as an Intern on our Marketing Team means everything from developing marketing strategies, device launches, advertising campaigns and managing signature moves; to device lifecycle programs, along with handling specific product lines and sponsorship and marketing efforts across sports and entertainment events.
You\xe2\x80\x99ll contribute your creativity and phenomenal ideas, working alongside innovative colleagues and mentors who will push you to be your very best. We\xe2\x80\x99ll give you hands-on projects and the chance to create an immediate impact. Here are some of the roles you could have as an Intern with our Marketing Team\xe2\x80\xa6
Associate Product Manager
Associate Segment Marketing Manager
Business & Consumer Insights
Business Portfolio Optimization
Digital Design & Strategy
Emerging Offers & Segments
Loyalty Marketing Manager
Market Trend Analyst
Media Content Production
Partnership Manager
Sponsorships & Events
Strategic Pricing and Marketing Analyst
You\xe2\x80\x99re currently enrolled in college and pursuing a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s, Master\xe2\x80\x99s, or MBA degree with an Advertising, Business, Communications, Finance, Marketing, or Sales focus.
You\xe2\x80\x99re a self-starter with a passion for learning who is not afraid to ask questions.
Things change and move pretty fast on this team and your ability to quickly adapt, change direction and think on your feet without missing a beat is essential.
You share our Un-carrier\xc2\xae spirit. This is about breaking rules, paving our own path and making things better for our customers \xe2\x80\x93 and each other.
Being an Intern
Our Internship Program takes place over the summer running 12 weeks from May to September. As an Intern, you\xe2\x80\x99ll receive competitive pay, relocation benefits, an extraordinary learning experience, and the support of a team that believes in your potential. You\xe2\x80\x99ll also have plenty of opportunities to meet and network with other interns, fellow team members, and top leaders from all business functions across the company as you make connections that will last your career. Want to learn more?
A big part of our culture is about adopting our Magenta spirit. And we\xe2\x80\x99ll ask you to do the same. Check out #BeMagenta to see how we work together to take care of our customers and each other every day.
Recruiting Timeline
Recruiting for the 2021 internship program takes place from September 2020 through March 2021. We\xe2\x80\x99ll be virtually visiting campuses across the country and virtually attending national recruiting conferences in September through November. We\xe2\x80\x99ll be connecting with candidates and begin screening in January. If we believe you\xe2\x80\x99re a good fit for one of our roles, we\xe2\x80\x99ll contact you directly to discuss next steps. Interviews will start to take place in late January and all internships will be filled by the end of March.
Application Process
Select the job category that best matches your interests, education and experience and click to apply. We\xe2\x80\x99ll then review your application. If we believe you\xe2\x80\x99re a good fit for one of our roles, we\xe2\x80\x99ll contact you directly to discuss next steps.

At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States
High School Diploma or GED

Currently enrolled in a college or university or post-graduation of 12 months

Title: b'Software - Video Games Engineering Internship (Fall 2021)'
Summary: b'Many students will be limited to part-time depending on their academic standing.\nOur year-round program places the best students in positions that they will\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Disclaimer: This position is expected to start around August or September 2021 and continue through the entire Fall term (i.e. through December/January) or into early Spring 2022 if available. We ask for a minimum of 12 weeks, full-time, for most internships. Please consider before submitting an application.
International Students: If your work authorization is through CPT, please consult your school before applying. You must be able to work 40 hours per week. Many students will be limited to part-time depending on their academic standing.
Internship Programs at Tesla
The Internship Recruiting Team is driven by the passion to recognize emerging talent. Our year-round program places the best students in positions that they will grow both technically and personally through their experience working closely with their Manager, Mentor, and team. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Tesla by given them projects that are critical to their team\xe2\x80\x99s success.
Instead of going on coffee runs and making copies, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be seated at the table making critical decisions that will influence not only your team, but the overall achievement of Tesla\xe2\x80\x99s mission.
The Role
Tesla strives to make its cars the most fun possible; bringing video game experiences to the car helps increase that fun. In this incredibly rare opportunity to help build a video games platform, we are looking for a highly motivated software engineer to help enable the best video game content to be available in-car. Come put that industry experience to great use and help us build this platform.
Our goal is to set the bar for what video games in a car can be; much of this is uncharted territory having never been done before. We want to work with people who are excited by this goal and have the talent to deliver on it.
Location
Bellevue, WA
Remote
Responsibilities
Design, architect, implement and debug game platform interfaces and systems
Rapid prototyping and ownership of fun in-car customer experiences
Work with a cross-functional team of hardware engineers, application/UI software engineers, QA/validation, and designers
Communicate with game development and publishing partners
Requirements
Currently working towards a BS, MS, or advanced degree in a relevant engineering program such as Software Engineering or Computer Science.
Must be proficient in C++
Excellent grasp of fundamental computer science concepts
Experience writing and shipping customer-facing code
Willingness & curiosity to learn new technologies in any area of the stack: UI, Rendering, Core, Protocol, Server
Experience shipping products in the video game industry
High standards for code quality, maintainability, and performance'

Title: b'2021 Summer Internships'
Summary: b'MedInsight also offers standalone products that provide preconfigured or custom reporting and data configurations that can address specific business needs.'
Details:
b'Job Details
Description
About Milliman & MedInsight

Milliman is one of the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest independent professional services firms. Founded in 1947, the firm provides consulting services to clients in four practice areas: healthcare, life insurance and financial services, employee benefits and pensions, and property and casualty insurance. Today, Milliman has more than 3,500 employees, $1 billion in annual revenue, and more than 60 offices worldwide.

Milliman MedInsight is one of the healthcare industry\xe2\x80\x99s most highly regarded platforms for data warehousing and healthcare analytics, with a purpose of empowering easy, data-driven decision-making on important healthcare questions.
MedInsight solutions have been adopted by over 300 health plans, employers, at-risk providers and ACOs, state governments, community health coalitions, and third-party administrators. MedInsight also offers standalone products that provide preconfigured or custom reporting and data configurations that can address specific business needs.

What We Are Looking For

We are looking for interns that are creative, passionate, enthusiastic and most importantly eager to learn. We are seeking to fill multiple summer internship positions in the following functions:

Product Management
Sales and Marketing
Healthcare Data Analytics
Education Services
Human Resources and People Programs
Program/Project Management

Preferred Skills and Experience

Curious, attentive to detail, and desirous of applying training to practical, complex, and real-world issues;
Proficiency in Microsoft Office products, particularly Excel;
Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize tasks with little supervision;
Demonstrates strong interest in healthcare market and relevant policy issues;
Healthcare concepts and data experience;
Healthcare informatics, analytics, and reporting knowledge;
Strong problem solving and analytical skills;
Ability to work independently and within a team environment; and
Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Educational Requirements

While applicants from all majors will be considered, preference will be given to students pursuing degrees in the following areas:

Business
Economics
Physical Sciences
Public Health
Finance/Accounting
Marketing/Communications
English
Human Resources

Undergraduates only please. Interested candidates should submit resume and cover letter indicating area of interest.

We are currently working mostly remote due to COVID restrictions, but the MedInsight home office is based in Seattle, WA.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor\xe2\x80\x99s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)'

Title: b'Summer 2021 Internship - Software Engineering'
Summary: b'We are unable to accommodate internships outside of this time frame.\nAvailable for a 12 week internship between May and September of 2021.'
Details:
b'Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!
Are you passionate about software development and testing? Would you like a chance to apply what you have learned on a critical project? F5 Networks is offering the opportunity to join one of our engineering teams as a software engineering intern. You\xe2\x80\x99ll collaborate with leading software engineers to undertake a challenging project that will provide the opportunity for you to learn about new technologies, develop or enhance your skills, and make significant contributions to F5.

Code, test and document solutions for creating F5 products.
Troubleshoot and debug challenging technical problems.
Research, investigate and define new areas of technology to enhance our product line.
Collaborate with team members, technical leads and internal/external clients to produce excellence.
Document software designs via functional specifications and other design documents
Collaborate with team members and technical leads
Applicants should be/possess:
A current student enrolled in a technical discipline at a four year institution in the US. Preferred majors are Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Applied and Computational Math Sciences or related disciplines.
Completed a Data Structures course in a modern, object-oriented programming language or possess equivalent knowledge.
Approaching their Junior year or beyond at the time of the internship (ie. one summer left before graduation). Exceptional Sophomore or Freshmen may be considered.
Available for a 12 week internship between May and September of 2021. We are unable to accommodate internships outside of this time frame.
Internships are an excellent way to get to know F5. Internships at F5 may lead to full-time employment opportunities, so if you are looking to be a member of an amazing, exciting company, you have come to the right place!
The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.
Please note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5.com) or auto email notification from Yello/Workday (ending with f5.com or @myworkday.com ) .

Title: b'Internship Inquiry - Be A Wongtern'
Summary: b'Our intern needs are determined based on workload, and on our ability to provide a dedicated supervisor to spend time mentoring each intern.'
Details:
b'DUE TO THE CURRENT SITUATION WITH COVID-19, OUR INTERNSHIP PROGRAM IS CURRENTLY ON HOLD. WE WILL NOT BE OFFERING 2020 INTERNSHIPS, AND WILL MONITOR AND RE-EVALUATE FOR 2021.
UPDATES WILL BE POSTED HERE AS SOON AS THEY ARE AVAILABLE. WE APPRECIATE YOUR PATIENCE DURING THIS TIME.
WONGDOODY RECRUITING TEAM

Company Description

WONGDOODY is a human experience agency with offices in Seattle, Los Angeles and New York. Since our founding in 1993, we have won hundreds of global awards for creativity and marketing effectiveness, while building a culture that consistently makes WONGDOODY one of the "Best Places to Work" according to Ad Age, the Puget Sound Business Journal, and the Los Angeles Business Journal. We recognize that our people and our culture are paramount to our success. It is a very exciting time here at WONGDOODY. We're opening doors to a host of new client opportunities and capabilities, while ensuring that our current clients never outgrow the scope and scale of what we can deliver. And this paves the way for agency growth and expansion into new markets.

We are a team of fun, fearless, ego-less, values-driven and collaborative problem-solvers distributed across the coasts with one goal in mind \xe2\x80\x93 human experience. Human experiences are the touch points that make brands and technology matter to customers. We use strategy, creativity and data to develop engaging experiences that transform businesses. And those experiences are backed by the global technological strength of Infosys.

If you'd like to be part of our outstanding team, helping to grow WONGDOODY as well as your own career, please read on and check us out more at www.wongdoody.com.

Job Description

Do you have what it takes to be a Wongtern?

We review Wongtern submissions continuously throughout the year, all applications will be reviewed and considered for the next available term based on the upcoming needs of each office.

We typically offer internships \xe2\x80\x94 Wongternships, that is \xe2\x80\x94 in a variety of roles for each office. This includes advertising, social content creation, digital product design, consumer experiences, and strategic planning services. Our intern needs are determined based on workload, and on our ability to provide a dedicated supervisor to spend time mentoring each intern. Intern candidates must be at least juniors in college to be considered. Your cover letter must include the following information:
Why you are interested in WONGDOODY and the advertising role or roles in which you are most interested in gaining experience.Three to five bullet points detailing what you want to achieve during your Wongternship.Your availability to work on a full-time basis (what months are you available?) And WHICH OFFICE you wish to intern for.

For candidates chosen for an interview, we'll get back to you to let you know about next steps. From time to time, we will also post specific internship openings in the job listings on our career page, so please check back.

Additional information

TO APPLY: For full consideration please upload both a resume and cover letter.


WONGDOODY is a proud Equal Employment Opportunity employer where we are committed to creating an equitable, diverse and inclusive workspace regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We are intentional about creating a space which not only celebrates and embraces, but also reflects the diversity of the world we live in. Candidates from diverse backgrounds strongly encouraged to apply.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.'

Summary: b'Working remotely with newsrooms based in Seattle or New York, you will start reporting and writing immediately.\nResearching, reporting and writing news stories.'
Details: b"What\xe2\x80\x99s the Opportunity: Royal Media is seeking editorial interns to join its airfreight, automotive finance and fintech teams. Working remotely with newsrooms based in Seattle or New York, you will start reporting and writing immediately. We cover a range of specialized and fascinating beats. Each is great for developing clips and further honing your journalism skills.Work requirements are flexible. You can work infrequently or regularly, but you must be an enthusiastic and quick learner with the drive to succeed, and the desire to make the most of your internship.Our business centers on three dynamic sectors: air cargo, automotive finance and fintech or banking technology. Each is innovating in wildly compelling ways. We engage in \xe2\x80\x9cpersonal\xe2\x80\x9d journalism, in that we operate in extremely close proximity to our markets and our communities.Who We Are: Royal Media is a focused business media company that produces content and market intelligence that is on par with The New York Times and Bloombergs of the world. Our mission is to deliver deep market knowledge to dynamic industries through online news sites, e-newsletters, conferences and custom media, and to do so with great passion and expertise. We were founded in 1995 and one of the hallmarks of our company -- in addition to an exceptional team of reporters, editors and content professionals -- is that we are constantly iterating on the business media model in exciting and novel ways. But at the DNA level, we aim to produce superlative, intelligent, engaging content to our clients, and that means we do not just spit back facts, but seek to understand how market conditions are \xe2\x80\x94 and will \xe2\x80\x94 evolve. Royal has won several awards for its work.You'll Gain Experience: Researching, reporting and writing news storiesCreating multimedia contentEngaging audiences through social mediaYou\xe2\x80\x99ll Need to Have: An interest in pursuing a career in journalismA willingness for hands-on editorial workAn ability to understand complex business industries and/or technologyDoes This Sound Like You?If so, apply today.To apply, please apply with a brief cover letter explaining what you would hope to gain from the internship. Please also attach any applicable clips or a writing sample along with your resum\xc3\xa9. Royal is an equal opportunity employer, M/F/D/V.Job Types: Part-time, InternshipPay: Up to $15.00 per hourEducation:High school or equivalent (Preferred)Experience:Writing Skills: 1 year (Required)Journalism: 1 year (Required)"

Title: b'Innovation and Design Engineer Internship - Summer 2021 (US)'
Summary: b'Currently enrolled in a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s or Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Industrial Engineering, or other\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Currently enrolled in a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s or Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Industrial Engineering, or other equivalent quantitative discipline with a conferral date after September 2021
Knowledge of IE fundamentals (e.g., basic spatial layouts of processing lines, process paths, etc.)
Experience using one or more of the following technologies (e.g., AutoCAD, Rhino, Revit, SolidWorks, CREO, SketchUp, KeyShot, etc.) to deliver high quality models and designs
Knowledge of converting sub-system functional requirements into engineering requirements and component designs

Do you aspire to be a world class innovation and design engineer, and learn from experts in the field? Do you want to be a part of a fast-paced environment and contribute to one of the most visited sites on the Internet?

If this describes you, consider joining us as an intern in the summer of 2021. Amazon is looking for an innovation and design engineer intern to join one of our many lines of business. Amazon interns have the opportunity to work alongside the industry\xe2\x80\x99s brightest engineers who innovate every day on behalf of our customers. You will be matched to a manager and a mentor. Our interns will have the opportunity to impact the evolution of Amazon technology as well as lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your design and code will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in security.

In addition to working on an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in fun activities with other interns throughout the summer. No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your summer and learn in a real world setting.

Come build the future with us.

NOTE: By applying to this position, your application will be considered for all locations we hire for in the United States including but not limited to: Seattle/Bellevue, WA; Nashville, TN; Austin, TX; Greater Bay Area, CA; DC Metro Area; Detroit, MI; Greater Boston Area, MA; Greater Los Angeles Area, CA; Greater New York Area; Irvine, CA; Madison, WI; Minneapolis, MN; Phoenix, AZ; Portland, OR; San Diego, CA.

Amazon internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks with start dates in May and June 2021. Applicants should have at a minimum one quarter/semester remaining after their internship concludes.

Responsibilities:As an innovation and design engineer, you will/may:

Design, develop, test and deliver solutions (e.g., workflow/process path layout, space utilization/efficiency, ergonomics, etc.).
Use appropriate technologies (e.g., AutoCAD, Rhino, Revit, SolidWorks, CREO, SketchUp, KeyShot, etc.) to deliver high quality, operationally excellent models and design (e.g., safety, high quality, and performance) that meet the needs of the customer.
Identify and communicate any issues associated with the design, development, implementation, and optimization of fulfillment-center technologies or design solution.
Invent, develop, and refine solutions to ensure they are meeting customer, business, operational, technology, and team goals.
Understand business impact of designs and show good judgement when making design suggestions, ensuring they meet performance and scaling targets.
Experience with material handling and processing
Proficient communication of technical details verbally and in writing

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Title: b'2021 Human Resources Internships'
Summary: b'Recruiting for the 2021 internship program takes place from September 2020 through March 2021.\nYou\xe2\x80\x99re currently enrolled in college and pursuing a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s,\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Real projects. Real impact.
Are you ready for a challenge that could launch your career? T-Mobile is revolutionizing the wireless industry for millions of customers nationwide. Working here means rolling up your sleeves and redefining the status quo with a team that has your back every step of the way!
You\xe2\x80\x99re encouraged to be an Intern with our Human Resources Team!
This is a 12-week paid learning experience with our team responsible for supporting all of our 80 thousand employees. From compensation, payroll, benefits and career development to employee discounts, rewards and recognition or recruiting the best-of-the-best, we\xe2\x80\x99ve got our employees covered.
Whether it\xe2\x80\x99s from our headquarters campus in Bellevue, WA or from one of our regional business offices across the country, we work hard to keep our employees happy and motivated members of Team Magenta. We help take care of the things that matter most to our employees and their families, so they can do what T-Mobile does best: focus on our customers.
Working as an Intern on our Human Resources Team means everything from crunching numbers around compensation research and benchmarking, building out our employer brand and working with our employee network groups to supporting key HR initiatives and training design and implementation.
You\xe2\x80\x99ll contribute your creativity and extraordinary ideas, working alongside innovative colleagues and mentors who will push you to be your very best. We\xe2\x80\x99ll give you hands-on projects and the chance to create an immediate impact. Here are some of the roles you could have as an Intern with our Human Resources Team\xe2\x80\xa6
Compensation Analyst
Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Coordinator
Associate Employer Brand Manager
HR Generalist
Recruiting Strategist
Employee Resolution Specialist
Learning & Development
Workforce Planning Analyst
You\xe2\x80\x99re currently enrolled in college and pursuing a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s, Master\xe2\x80\x99s, or MBA degree with a Business, Communications, Human Resources, or Industrial Relations focus.
You\xe2\x80\x99re a self-starter with a passion for learning who is not afraid to ask questions.
Things change and move pretty fast on this team and your ability to quickly adapt, change direction and think on your feet without missing a beat is essential.
You share our Un-carrier\xc2\xae spirit. This is about breaking rules, paving our own path and making things better for our customers \xe2\x80\x93 and each other.
Being an Intern
Our Internship Program takes place over the summer running 12 weeks from May to September. As an Intern, you\xe2\x80\x99ll receive competitive pay, relocation benefits, an outstanding learning experience, and the support of a team that believes in your potential. You\xe2\x80\x99ll also have plenty of opportunities to meet and network with other interns, fellow team members, and top leaders from all business functions across the company as you make connections that will last your career. Want to learn more?
A huge part of our culture is about embracing our Magenta spirit. And we\xe2\x80\x99ll ask you to do the same. Check out #BeMagenta to see how we work together to take care of our customers and each other every day.
Recruiting Timeline
Recruiting for the 2021 internship program takes place from September 2020 through March 2021. We\xe2\x80\x99ll be virtually visiting campuses across the country and virtually attending national recruiting conferences in September through November. We\xe2\x80\x99ll be connecting with candidates and begin screening in January. If we believe you\xe2\x80\x99re a good fit for one of our roles, we\xe2\x80\x99ll contact you directly to discuss next steps. Interviews will start to take place in late January and all internships will be filled by the end of March.
Application Process
Select the job category that best matches your interests, education and experience and click to apply. We\xe2\x80\x99ll then review your application. If we believe you\xe2\x80\x99re a good fit for one of our roles, we\xe2\x80\x99ll contact you directly to discuss next steps.
Minimum Qualifications
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States
High School Diploma or GED
Pre-employment background screen
Currently enrolled in a college or university or post-graduation of 12 months

Title: b'General Marketing Full time positions 2021'
Summary: b"Currently working towards a bachelor's degree in marketing, advertising, or related field with an expected conferral date between December 2020 and August 2021."
Details:
b"Basic Qualifications
Currently working towards a bachelor's degree in marketing, advertising, or related field with an expected conferral date between December 2020 and August 2021
Work, internship, or other leadership experience in a professional environment
Computer skills, including Microsoft Office (e.g., Excel, Word)

The Marketing Specialist will be involved with planning, executing and measuring the performance of marketing campaigns for Amazon businesses. The successful candidate will play an integral role in building and engaging our customer base via demand and lead generation campaigns; and, in creating effective strategies that will promote the long-term growth of Amazon. You will develop and drive marketing content onto the web to reach our target markets to drive product demand via multiple channels including social and email. You will analyze web traffic and other metrics and report on performance to management teams.

The Marketing Specialist will be innovative, team oriented, an effective communicator, have a desire to participate in change and appreciate a dynamic environment with rapidly changing priorities. We are seeking someone with a demonstrated history of successful project ownership and using customer data to identify and prioritize opportunities. An understanding of, and passion for, technology is highly desired.


Develop marketing strategies for projects, including website, email and social media
Work closely with marketing and sales teams on program development and implementation
Create and execute demand and lead generation programs
Analyze data to determine campaign efficiency
Ensure creative marketing materials undergo regular review and adhere to brand guidelines
Develop and communicate marketing plans, campaign results and project recommendations to leadership
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in a marketing role
Proficiency with analytic tools
Ability to work well in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
Excellent analytical, communication and presentation skills

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Title: b'Property Management Intern'
Summary: b'Become familiar with Company applications and operational techniques through completing required in-house training programs.'
Details:
b'The purpose of this role is to provide an opportunity for students planning to begin a career in the real estate industry. University students will gain practical experience in all phases of on-site residential property management. The internship is a rotational program where interns learn and perform critical job duties of various site-level positions.
JOB DESCRIPTION
Become familiar with Company applications and operational techniques through completing required in-house training programs.
Work with the on-site team to get a sense of their duties and responsibilities in an effort to gain knowledge of day to day processes, procedures, etc.
Work closely with team in the creation of specific information that leverages internal systems and performance data for the benefit of internal or external clients.
May work closely with senior team members to complete various, financial, administrative, and other reports and analysis as assigned or as necessary.
May work on special projects that require building relationships and partnering with other groups to reach goals.
May work with and contribute to outreach and promotion efforts utilizing website and social media outlets.
May create documentation outlining processes, procedures, programs, testing/review results, etc.
May conduct research on and prepare an assessment of a conceptual idea within the department.'

Title: b'Data Science Intern'
Summary: b'Design and build a machine learning model to score customers based on their likelihood of purchasing specific types of products (e.g. brand preferences, price\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'REI is looking for a Data Science Intern to contribute to REI\xe2\x80\x99s success by developing, designing, adapting, prototyping and implementing in code, supervised and unsupervised machine learning and advanced statistical algorithms. Throughout the course of your internship experience, you will own and drive a challenging and relevant project to use Machine Learning to solve real world business challenges. Under the supervision of your Manager, and as a key member of the Business Intelligence & Analytics department, you will gain insights into the key functions of your team as it relates to REI\xe2\x80\x99s broader Analytics strategy and vision.

Examples of our Data Science Intern projects may include:
Customer Propensity Model
Design and build a machine learning model to score customers based on their likelihood of purchasing specific types of products (e.g. brand preferences, price point, etc.) or engaging with specific types of content (e.g. start a conversation with other members on our community).
Image Classification
Use a neural net to create new product attributes based on existing product images. For example, develop a model that can determine the pattern of a fabric (striped, plaid, solid, etc.) or a model that can determine fit (skinny, comfort, baggy).
Search Contextualization
Use natural language processing along with online behaviors to interpret customer search queries. For example, if a user enters a search term of \xe2\x80\x9cpatagonia\xe2\x80\x9d should the results include Patagonia-brand apparel, trips to Patagonia in South America or both?

REI Introduction and Exposure to:
Seattle Area
Challenging and relevant project assignments
Data Wrangling, Machine Learning & Data Science to solve business problems and drive incremental customer engagement and revenue in a Retail organization.
Leadership team members
Cross-divisional intern activities
Mentorship

Bring your passion and expertise
Job functions include:
Evaluates and recommends approaches to various data analytics problems.
Analyzes and evaluates data sets for both insight into the data and usability for machine learning applications.
Conditions data for analysis and works with large scale structured and unstructured data.
Creates data pipelines and works with large scale, distributed compute and storage platforms.
Completes programming and implements efficiencies, performs testing and debugging.
Completes documentation and procedures for installation and maintenance. Models and acts in accordance with REI\xe2\x80\x99s guiding values and mission
Qualifications and expectations:
Currently majoring in Computer Science, Mathematics or Analytics/Data Science graduate programs
Coursework completed in some or all of the following areas: Business Analysis, Statistics, Operations Research, SQL Programming, Data Mining, Python/R Programming
Candidates should have a strong aptitude in analytics and problem solving. Proficiency in SQL and Python/R preferred.

Title: b'Internship in Construction Management'
Summary: b'Our internships are competitive, full-time, fully paid but temporary positions through the typical spring, summer and fall months.'
Details:
b'Our internships and co-op opportunities allow you to gain real-world experience and tackle the same responsibilities as our full-time employees. Here, you\xe2\x80\x99ll learn directly from experts, expand your knowledge and make major contributions to a variety of challenging projects. Our hands-on approach to learning will prepare you for a successful career after you complete your education.
Anning-Johnson Companies Internship Program is intended to provide related work experience for students in their field of study with the potential of offering a full-time career following their graduation. Our internships are competitive, full-time, fully paid but temporary positions through the typical spring, summer and fall months. Part-time opportunities and cooperatives may also be available throughout the year.
Anning-Johnson Company is looking for enthusiastic individuals interested in assessing customer service expectations and ensuring delivery of projects by applying expertise in engineering and/or construction management as an Intern working with our Estimating and Project Management teams.
This position will provide a great opportunity for a long-term thinker to develop construction leadership expertise across a range of markets and clients, leverage technology to increase efficiency and effectiveness, participate in a broad range of project planning and coordination duties, and grow with the company. The role will offer opportunities to bring value by learning from project team members and sharing with the project team.
You will be assigned to a Sr Estimator or Project Manager. Everything you touch will have an impact on the bottom line on each project. Title: b'Vehicle Performance Stimulation Engineer - Summer 2021 Inter...'
Summary: b'The successful candidate will support a team of high-performing professionals who pride themselves in developing innovative processes, setting industry\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Kenworth Division of PACCAR is seeking energetic, independent Engineering Intern who is interested in creating, defining, and launching the next generation of industry-leading trucks to join our 2021 Engineering Internship Program in Kirkland, WA.
Company Information
PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacturing, and customer support of high-quality light-, medium-, and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF nameplates. PACCAR also designs and manufactures advanced diesel engines, provides financial services and information technology, and distributes truck parts related to its principal business.
Whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services, you can develop the career you desire with PACCAR. Get started!
Kenworth Truck Company: Kenworth Truck Company is the manufacturer of The World\xe2\x80\x99s Best\xc2\xae heavy- and medium-duty trucks. Kenworth is an industry leader in providing fuel-saving technology solutions that help increase fuel efficiency and reduce emissions. The company\xe2\x80\x99s dedication to the green fleet includes aerodynamic trucks, compressed and liquefied natural gas trucks, and medium-duty diesel-electric hybrids.
Requisition Summary
We are looking for a talented, bright, and driven candidate who has interest in the field of sustainable transportation. Vehicle Performance Stimulation Engineer Intern will be a part of Kenworth Vehicle Integration Engineering Team and will have an opportunity to gain hands-on experience and make a valuable contribution to overall achievement of the company mission. The successful candidate will support a team of high-performing professionals who pride themselves in developing innovative processes, setting industry standards for quality, and providing cost-effective designs. The Stimulation Engineer Intern will be responsible for creating simulation models for fuel/energy economy and drivability performance and will have the opportunity to work with big data related to vehicle performance.
The primary scope of work includes assisting in the analysis of component efficiency data, full vehicle simulation results, maintenance, and improvements to modeling tools for simulated vehicle control behavior. Other responsibilities may include defining control function requirements and assisting in validation of vehicle-level performance.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Identify, develop and incorporate advanced automotive technologies into PACCAR products.
Build, maintain, and utilize vehicle simulation models for fuel/energy economy and drivability performance evaluation in support of major projects.
Collect requirements by interacting with cross-functional teams to define functional requirements.
Work with global teams to deliver common, cost-efficient solutions PACCAR-wide.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS
Currently pursuing a degree in one of the following disciplines: Engineering (Electrical, Software, or Mechanical), Computer Science, or equivalent (sophomore status or higher)
Experience in Matlab/Simulink/Stateflow
Experience in system modeling and simulation
Skilled in big data, data management and integration tools, and Microsoft Office
Experience communicating complex ideas via dashboards
Understanding of design, development, and validation processes
Independent judgment and effective decision-making skills
Passion and interest in working on next-generation electrified vehicles

PREFFERRED QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS
Automotive background
Experience in controls development
Experience in requirements management
Experience modeling powertrain and auxiliary vehicle components
Experience in electrified components
Experience in model refactoring for structure and consistency in future projects for PACCAR
Experience in graphical user interface development experience (Matlab, Tableau) to communicate concepts in a simple but accurate manner
Familiarity with statistics for analyzing test data
Familiarity with version control software
Familiarity with MiL/SiL/HiL simulation
Familiarity with J1939 protocol
Familiarity with reliability analysis of components

PACCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability.'

Title: b'Information Security Intern'
Summary: b'Today\xe2\x80\x99s cybersecurity specialists spend an inordinate amount of time managing the inflow of information.\nEvents and alerts arrive from many disparate sources\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'The Fluke Information Security team has an exciting opportunity for a summer internship to help enable automated workflows and processes to better visualize, triage, and action cybersecurity events. The ideal candidate will have a passion for information security and how governance of risk enables, rather than stifles, innovation and rapid development in a lean and agile organization.

Today\xe2\x80\x99s cybersecurity specialists spend an inordinate amount of time managing the inflow of information. Events and alerts arrive from many disparate sources such as vulnerability scanners, SIEMs, Cloud Consoles, email, collaboration tools, SCA tools, SOC reports and consoles, and many more. The information security intern will be responsible for designing and developing a centralized dashboard to consolidate and triage various events, enabling a lean group to effectively respond to alerts prioritized by real risk to the business.

Responsibilities:

Own an end-to-end project such as designing and developing an information security dashboard
Utilize visual and daily management to provide visibility to project stake holders and manage team members
Conduct voice of the customer (VOC) to understand the requirements from key project stakeholders and customers
Participate in team meetings and process reviews as necessary
Currently pursuing a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Management of Information Systems, Cybersecurity, Computer Science, or similar
Knowledge of Power BI, development with APIs, and scripting
Familiarity with SIEMs, vulnerability scanners, Code Analysis tools, and Antimalware tools
Ability to think \xe2\x80\x98outside the box\xe2\x80\x99 to develop unique solutions to unique problems
Excellent communication skills, ability to engage with all levels within the organization

Fortive is a diversified industrial growth company comprised of global businesses that are recognized leaders in attractive markets. With more than $6 billion in annual revenues, Fortive\xe2\x80\x99s well-known brands hold leading positions in field instrumentation, transportation, sensing, product realization, automation and specialty, and franchise distribution.

Fortive is headquartered in Everett, Washington and employs a team of more than 24,000 research and development, manufacturing, sales, distribution, service and administrative employees in more than 40 countries around the world. Our team grows by tackling challenges that accelerate progress and further their careers. With a culture rooted in continuous improvement, the core of our company\xe2\x80\x99s operating model is the Fortive Business System. For more information please visit: www.fortive.com.

Fluke is leading the world in creating software, test tools and technology that will support customers today and in the future. We are a customer-obsessed market leader with a strong reputation for reliability, quality and safety.

A wholly owned subsidiary of Fortive Corporation (www.fortive.com), Fluke is a global corporation headquartered in the greater Seattle area. Driven by the successful Fortive Business System, Fluke offers the passion of a startup with the resources of a Fortune 500 company. We are focused on the growth of our individual employees, teams and the Fluke brand.'

Title: b'Operations Executive Office Intern'
Summary: b'Ability to work graciously and effectively with the public.\nUnderstanding of urban planning concepts and transportation policies and practices.'
Details:
b'Sound Transit has an exciting paid virtual internship available for the summer of 2021! This is a great opportunity for currently enrolled graduate students who want to observe and participate in real world application of their current field of study. This opportunity will allow the intern to gain valuable experience within the Executive Office division under our Operations department.

Sound Transit\xe2\x80\x99s Operations Department oversees modal services throughout the Puget Sound region \xe2\x80\x93 Link, Sounder, ST Express, and Tacoma Link \xe2\x80\x93 and encompasses a dynamic behind the scenes core infrastructure, including facilities, customer service, asset management and public safety. The Operations Intern will have an opportunity to be a part of the management team that oversees our modal service, facilities, and support services to learn how a large regional transit system is managed.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

The following duties ARE NOT intended to serve as a comprehensive list of all duties performed by all employees in this classification, only a representative summary of the primary duties and responsibilities. Incumbent(s) may not be required to perform all duties listed and may be required to perform additional, position-specific duties.

A graduate student with the following:

Independent self-starter and ability to work well in a team.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Ability to work graciously and effectively with the public.
Flexibility to work in a fast-paced environment on a multitude of projects.
Understanding of urban planning concepts and transportation policies and practices.
Proficient use of Microsoft office products \xe2\x80\x93 Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Familiarity with SharePoint.

Job Duties:

Organizing and coordinating a variety of projects initiated in Sound Transit\xe2\x80\x99s Operations Department.
Assisting the Chief of Staff with administrative, research and technical tasks.
Maintaining records and databases for a variety of projects.
Attending weekly manager and director meetings for project assignments.
Preparing materials and attending meetings to support transit initiatives.

Potential Projects:

Policy analysis of Operations plans and programs.
Development of cross-departmental policies and procedures.
Assist staff with performance measurement analysis and development within Operations.
Development of a partnership management program.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Applicants must be a current college student in good academic standing, enrolled in an accredited four year university, working towards a graduate degree in public administration, urban design and planning, or equivalent degree. Must have a strong interest in learning about and working in public transit.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS/ WORK ENVIRONMENT:

Work is performed in a standard office environment.
Subject to standing, walking, bending, reaching, stooping, and lifting of objects up to 25 pounds; may occasionally be exposed to dangerous machinery when visiting job sites during construction and when working in the field.
The Agency promotes a safe and healthy work environment and provides appropriate safety and equipment training for all personnel as required.


Sound Transit is an equal employment opportunity employer. No person is unlawfully excluded from employment action based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation and pregnancy), age, genetic information, disability, veteran status or other protected class.'

Title: b'Health Equity Internship - Strategy and Business Development'
Summary: b'Providence is calling a Health Equity Intern (0.5 FTE, Day Shift) to the Strategy and Business Development at PSCS Divisional Services in Tukwila, WA.'
Details:
b"Description:
Providence is calling a Health Equity Intern (0.5 FTE, Day Shift) to the Strategy and Business Development at PSCS Divisional Services in Tukwila, WA.
Reporting directly to the Chief Health Equity, this position will support program development, data gathering and assessment and community engagement strategies to advance health equity within Providence Home & Community Care (HCC). This position will work closely with HCC operational leaders that oversee PACE, Skilled Nursing Facilities, Senior Housing, Hospice and Palliative Care and Home Health. Additionally, this position will engage stakeholders within the community and caregivers who serve patients, program participants and residents. This role will utilize a health equity framework to assess HCC's current strategies to reach marginalized communities, assess historic and current racial barriers and develop new approaches to better serve and ease access of those most marginalized.
In this position you will:
Assesses and provides summaries, models and impact reports regarding community and program health disparities.
Provides analysis and perspective on patient data as related to health outcomes and disparities of care.
Identifies, proposes and scopes potential initiatives and approaches to improve health equity.
Analyzes and provides recommendations of strategies to reduce barriers and ease access from marginalized communities.
Engages stakeholders in sensing sessions to engage caregivers in strategy development.
Provides support to local markets, as requested, in their development of key workforce strategies and community development.

Required qualifications for this position include:
One of the following:
Current enrollment in a Bachelor's degree program in Public Health, Public Administration, Social Work or a related field
Bachelor's Degree in Public Health, Public Administration Social Work or a related field
Current enrollment in a graduate program in Public Health, Public Administration, Social Work or a related field
Preferred qualifications for this position include :
One (1) year experience with implementing DE&I Strategies
One (1) year experience in a healthcare setting

Providence Strategic and Management Services provides a variety of functional and system support services for all eight regions of Providence Health & Services from Alaska to California. We are focused on supporting our Mission by delivering a robust foundation of services and sharing of specialized expertise.

As expressions of God\xe2\x80\x99s healing love, witnessed through the ministry of Jesus, we are steadfast in serving all, especially those who are poor and vulnerable.

Multi-branches
