Position Summary

The Clinical Intern will provide a full range of direct and indirect services to children and their families presenting with a wide variety of emotional and behavioral disorders. Services include family therapy, individual child therapy, group treatment in a school setting, ongoing case management, assessment, treatment and discharge planning, and advocacy. Delivery of therapeutic services in the office, in foster or birth homes as well as in a community setting.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Responsible for completing initial intake as well as a comprehensive assessment and determination of DC-05/DSM V diagnosis, with an MHP and developmental testing.
Assists in developing strength based, goal-oriented treatment plans, which address the specific needs of the family and specific anticipated clinical outcomes. Will facilitate multidisciplinary meetings with parents, sources of referral and allied service providers to establish goals and continue to facilitate these meetings every 180 days to review treatment and progress toward goals.
Provides therapy in clients homes, schools, community settings and/or Childhaven therapeutic centers.
Provides direct treatment services, group therapy and group facilitation to assigned cases, including case management, crisis intervention, home visits, referral and advocacy, and therapy in a culturally sensitive and family focused, strength based manner. Provides discharge planning as well.
Maintains complete documentation of the child s case records in the designated EHR, including assessments, progress notes, individual treatment plan, discharge summaries and other internal paperwork as needed. Maintains consumer records in keeping with Agency, County and State guidelines.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities (continued)

Ensures compliance with applicable agency contracts and adheres to all Federal, State and Local confidentiality requirements and guidelines. Performs periodic reviews of documentation on regular basis when required by Supervisor or when need arises (self-audit).
Participates in scheduled supervision, clinical team meetings, quarterly psychiatrist consult meetings and other staff and administrative team meetings

Complies with all Childhaven policies and procedures
Other duties as assigned

Knowledge of early childhood development, ability to relate well with parents, adolescent/teens, and superb communication and organizational skills.
Ability to work independently or participate with the team.
Able to prioritize work to effectively manage requirements
Ability to make sound decisions in emergency situations

Good standing and participation in a Master s Degree program in Psychology, Counseling, Marriage and Family Therapy, Social Work or closely related field.
Ability to apply for and obtain, Agency Affiliated status with the Department of Health

Title: b'Human Resources (HR) Generalist - Intern 2021'
Summary: b'Work, internship, or other leadership experience in a professional environment.\nCurrently pursuing a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree with a conferral date between December\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"Currently pursuing a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree with a conferral date between December 2021 and August 2022.
Work, internship, or other leadership experience in a professional environment
Open for placement with one of Amazon's HR teams across North America.

Are you an undergraduate student looking for an internship opportunity in the summer of 2021? Are you looking for an opportunity to launch into Human Resources careers with limitless possibilities?

We know searching for an internship is as much about finding a company where you can picture yourself being successful as it is about finding the right full-time role. Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s HR Generalist internship is focused on people operations and preserving Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s peculiar culture in the way we attract, hire, and develop talented people. In this role, you will manage a project from beginning to end with one of Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s HR teams in North America. Projects will vary from working with compensation, HR managers and business partners, onboarding, training and development, talent acquisition, or international HR.

This internship is a project-based, educational opportunity intended to prepare students to enter Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s Global Human Resources organization. You will spend 12 weeks learning about Amazon's peculiar approach to hiring and developing the best professionals by working with experienced senior management and business partners, as well as cross-functional HR support teams. You will get a 360-degree view of Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s approach to HR, where you will see managerial strategy and concepts come alive in a fast-paced environment that showcases everything that goes on behind the scenes to ensure our teams have what's needed to develop and retain a high-powered workforce.

Do you thrive in a dynamic, fast paced environment? Would you like the challenge of delivering a continuously improving employee experience? Can you think broadly about creative solutions and work to implement process improvement across our HR teams worldwide? If the answer is yes, the HR Generalist internship may be right for you.
Come build the future with us.


Ability to show effective use of analytics and data
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to embrace the big picture and exercise judgment
Demonstrated ability to bring big ideas and influence across all levels of an organization
Strong bias for action
Ability to adapt well to fast-paced environments with high growth and ambiguity
Majors/concentrations in HR Management, Organizational Development, business administration, or related fields
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (e.g., Excel, Word)

Title: b'Software Engineer Intern'
Summary: b'This internship involves working with the Chapel Programming Language team to help develop Chapel via.\nCollege/University Graduate hires (within 12 months of\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"Software Engineer Intern

Job Description:

At Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), we bring together the brightest minds to create breakthrough technology solutions and advance the way people live and work. Our legacy inspires us as we forge ahead dedicated to helping our customers make their mark on the world.
Learning does not only happen through training. Relationships are among the most powerful ways for people to learn and grow, and this is part of our HPE culture. In addition to working alongside talented colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities. You\xe2\x80\x99ll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We also have a \xe2\x80\x9creverse mentoring\xe2\x80\x9d program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.
College/University Graduate hires (within 12 months of graduation per the company's definition) undergoing a specific training and development path within the EMEA Graduate Program.
Description:
This internship involves working with the Chapel Programming Language team to help develop Chapel via
improvements to its compiler, libraries, tools, and documentation with the goal of making parallel programming from laptops to Crays as accessible as programming in Python. For more information on Chapel, please refer to https://chapel-lang.org
More specifically, the Chapel Team is looking to hire enthusiastic summer interns with a passion for designing, implementing, testing, documenting, evangelizing, and optimizing parallel programming languages. The ideal candidate will be interested in doing work in the areas of compiler development, runtime, standard library support, tools, test-driven development, and/or performance debugging and optimization. Knowledge of C/C++ is highly desirable. We will consider undergraduates and masters students looking for a practical programming experiences in an R&D setting as well as Ph.D. students working in related research areas. In applying for the position, please describe your areas of interest in working on Chapel.
These internships run during the summer months for 3-4 months between academic sessions. This position is located in Seattle, WA.

Title: b'Prime Gaming Live Producer Intern'
Summary: b'Currently enrolled in graduate interactive entertainment design program.\nHave produced multiple live productions, preferably in the digital space.'
Details:
b"Currently enrolled in graduate interactive entertainment design program.
Have produced multiple live productions, preferably in the digital space
Undergraduate degree in Television and Video Production, Film, or Journalism

Have you ever wanted to be part of building a new entertainment business? Twitch is a new media, and Prime Gaming Live is at the forefront of that evolution. The creation of this programming is a new role, and we are creating the processes and mechanisms that will help the next generation of video producers concentrate on making great programs.
We believe the evolution that began with pre-Internet arcade communities a quarter at a time, growing to the live streams and eSports of today, will continue to a future in which fans are creators, players are celebrities, and games are a global cultural touchstone that cuts across age, gender and nationality. Games have the power to connect communities at a massive scale, and this role will delve into linking these communities together and delivering great customer experiences to players, viewers, streamers, and game publishers.
This summer, we are seeking interns who have a blend of creative, production and technical skills. You will learn our production methodology, collaborate on our programming design and presentation, and contribute new programming ideas.
This isn't your average Video Production Internship program. There is a high degree of exploration and ambiguity and we are looking for students to have substantial, specific creative and technical experience with live television and video productions.


1-3 years relevant industry experience

Do you aspire to be a world class front-end engineer, and learn from experts in the field? Are you passionate solving user interface and UX problems in a large scale environment? Do you want to be a part of a fast-paced organization and contribute to one of the most visited sites on the Internet?

If this describes you, consider joining us as an intern in the summer of 2021. Amazon is looking for a front-end engineer intern to join one of our many lines of business. Amazon interns have the opportunity to work alongside the industry\xe2\x80\x99s brightest engineers who innovate every day on behalf of our customers. You will be matched to a manager and a mentor. Our interns will have the opportunity to impact the evolution of Amazon technology as well as lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your design and code will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in security.

In addition to working on an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in fun activities with other interns throughout the summer. No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your summer and learn in a real world setting.

Come chart your own path at Amazon.

Amazon internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks with start dates in May and June 2021. Applicants should have at a minimum one quarter/semester remaining after their internship concludes.

Responsibilities:As a front-end engineer, you will/may:

Use technology to solve user interface and UX problems
Transform defined software and UX design into code and deliver it on schedule using languages, libraries, and rendering technologies (e.g. JavaScript, Node.js, HTML, CSS, Java, Objective C)
Retrieve data from existing sources, using appropriate technologies for your platform and use cases
Work backwards from the customer and collaborate with Product and Design to iterate on the best possible user experience
Experience with Node.js and one or more front-end frameworks (e.g. React, Angular, Bootstrap)
Experience creating reusable coded front-end components
Experience creating application UIs

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Title: b'2021 MBA Internships'
Summary: b'Recruiting for the 2021 internship program takes place from September 2020 through March 2021.\nYou\xe2\x80\x99re encouraged to be an MBA Intern!'
Details:
b'Learn. Achieve. Build a career.

Are you ready for a challenge that could launch your career? T-Mobile is revolutionizing the wireless industry for millions of customers nationwide. Working here means rolling up your sleeves and disrupting the status quo with a team that has your back every step of the way!

You\xe2\x80\x99re encouraged to be an MBA Intern!

This is a 12-week paid learning experience with a team that provides the critical resources and support needed to accelerate T-Mobile\xe2\x80\x99s growth. Based in Bellevue, WA at the headquarters campus and various locations across the county, our MBA Internship includes opportunities across the enterprise. We are looking to fill positions with hardworking, dynamic, talented MBA students in areas such as, Marketing, T-Mobile for Business, Corporate Strategy, Technology, and Finance.
Working as an MBA Intern at T-Mobile means everything from extracting and analyzing data, building enterprise strategies, work on customer retention and consumer insights, market trend analysis, technical program management and serving as an internal consultant to the business.

You\xe2\x80\x99ll contribute your creativity and phenomenal ideas, working alongside innovative colleagues and mentors who will push you to be your very best. We\xe2\x80\x99ll give you hands-on projects and the chance to create an immediate impact. Here are some of the roles you could have as an MBA Intern:
Project Manager
Business Analyst
Emerging Product Manager
Credit Risk Analyst
Content Partnership Creation
Executive Development
Enterprise Operations
You\xe2\x80\x99re currently enrolled in an MBA program (first or second year), and completed your Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, Finance, Technology, Computer Science, Engineering or IT.
You\xe2\x80\x99re a self-starter with a passion for learning who is not afraid to ask questions.
Things change and move pretty fast on our teams and your ability to quickly adapt, change direction and think on your feet without missing a beat is essential.
You share our Un-carrier\xc2\xae spirit. This is about breaking rules, paving our own path and making things better for our customers \xe2\x80\x93 and each other.
Being an Intern
Our Internship Program takes place over the summer running 12 weeks from May to September. As an Intern, you\xe2\x80\x99ll receive competitive pay, relocation benefits, an outstanding experience, and the support of a team that believes in your potential. You\xe2\x80\x99ll also have plenty of opportunities to meet and network with other interns, fellow team members, and top leaders from all business functions across the company as you make connections that will last your career. Want to learn more?

A big part of our culture is about embracing our Magenta spirit. And we\xe2\x80\x99ll ask you to do the same. Check out #BeMagenta to see how we work together to take care of our customers and each other every day.

Recruiting Timeline

Recruiting for the 2021 internship program takes place from September 2020 through March 2021. We\xe2\x80\x99ll be virtually visiting campuses across the country and virtually attending national recruiting conferences in September through November. We\xe2\x80\x99ll be connecting with candidates and begin screening in January. If we believe you\xe2\x80\x99re a good fit for one of our roles, we\xe2\x80\x99ll contact you directly to discuss next steps. Interviews will start to take place in late January and all internships will be filled by the end of March.

Application Process
Select the job category that best matches your interests, education and experience and click apply. We\xe2\x80\x99ll then review your application. If we believe you\xe2\x80\x99re a good fit for one of our roles, we\xe2\x80\x99ll contact you directly to discuss next steps.
As America\xe2\x80\x99s Un-carrier, T-Mobile USA, Inc. (NASDAQ: \xe2\x80\x9cTMUS\xe2\x80\x9d) is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. The company\xe2\x80\x99s advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile USA. Inc. provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile and Metro by T-Mobile. For more information, please visit http://www.t-mobile.com

Applicant Privacy Policy

We are committed to maintaining your trust by respecting and protecting your privacy. For more information about how T-Mobile processes the personal data of job applicants, please visit Applicant Privacy Policy.
Equal Employment Opportunity

We take equal opportunity seriously\xe2\x80\x94by choice.

T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, religious affiliation, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination, retaliation or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with how we do business and will not be tolerated."
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States
High School Diploma or GED
Pre-employment background screen
Currently enrolled in a college or university or post-graduation of 12 months'

Title: b'Product Manager (Summer 2021 Internship)'
Summary: b'We are looking for a Product Manager Intern to assist the team with strategy, roadmap, and feature definition for the Cloud Infrastructure Engineering Team.'
Details:
b"If you are a current Motorola Solutions employee, please click this link to apply through your Workday account.
Company Overview
At Motorola Solutions, we create technologies our customers refer to as their lifeline. Our technology platforms in communications, software, video and services help our customers work safely and more efficiently. Whether it\xe2\x80\x99s helping firefighters see through smoke, enabling police officers to see around street corners, or reliably keeping the lights on in homes and businesses around the world, our work supports those who put their lives on the line to keep us safe. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions, and help us usher in a new era in public safety and security.

Department Overview
The Cloud Infrastructure team is responsible for the development and operations of critical cloud infrastructure and platform services, in support of Motorola Solutions' public and hybrid cloud-based Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions for public safety customers. This team is part of Motorola Solutions\xe2\x80\x99 Software Enterprise division, which offers secure, reliable and efficient team communications, workflow and operational intelligence solutions for mission critical public safety and enterprise markets throughout the world. Our services leverage Cloud Computing infrastructure on Azure to build at scale.

Job Description
We are looking for a Product Manager Intern to assist the team with strategy, roadmap, and feature definition for the Cloud Infrastructure Engineering Team.


Responsibilities:
Analyze market and competitive conditions and lays out a product vision that is differentiated and delivers unique value based on customer demands.
Bridge gaps within the company between different functions, especially between development, sales and marketing, and support.
Coordinate overall release project and schedule, manage risks and resolves issues that affect release scope, schedule and quality
Gather customer and sales feedback and voice of customer
Create user stories and scenarios, direct and approve UI/UX activities, define acceptance criteria, KPIs and SLAs
Facilitate sales and channel training, assist pre-sales with custom project requests, demonstrate new pre-release features
Legal authorization to work in the U.S. indefinitely is required. Employer work permit sponsorship is not available for this position or full time roles in the future.

Basic Requirements
Currently pursuing a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, MBA or related field with a graduation date on or after December 1st, 2021.
Must be able to obtain background clearance as required by government customer

Travel Requirements
None

Relocation Provided
None

Position Type
Intern

Referral Payment Plan
No


EEO Statement
Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or, any other protected characteristic."

Title: b'Security Engineer Internship - Summer 2021 (US)'
Summary: b'Amazon internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks with start dates in May and June 2021.'
Details:
b'Currently enrolled in or will receive a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s or Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in math/statistics/engineering or other equivalent quantitative discipline with a conferral date after September 2021Experience with coding/scripting in one or more languages (e.g., Python, C, C++, Java, Ruby, or PowerShell)Coursework and/or projects in one or more of the following domains: web application development, penetration testing, mobile security, cryptography, public key infrastructure, forensic security, IP security, SSL/TLS, computer viruses and malware, network security, trusted security, trusted execution, threat intelligence, IoT security implications, or authentication

Are you excited by the opportunity to secure hundreds of thousands of hosts, hundreds of millions of lines of code, and billions of online transactions, all on one of the most visited sites on the internet? Are you passionate about solving problems in an online world where threats grow ever more sophisticated?

If this describes you, consider joining us as an intern in the summer of 2021. Amazon is looking for a security engineer intern to join one of our many lines of business. Amazon interns have the opportunity to work alongside the industry\xe2\x80\x99s brightest engineers who innovate every day on behalf of our customers. You will be matched to a manager and a mentor. You will have the opportunity to impact the evolution of Amazon technology as well as lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your design and code will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in security.

In addition to working on an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in fun activities with other interns throughout the summer. No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your summer and learn in a real world setting.

Come chart your own path at Amazon.

Note: By applying to this position, your application will be considered for all locations we hire for in the United States including but not limited to: Seattle/Bellevue, WA; Nashville, TN; Austin, TX; Greater Bay Area, CA; DC Metro Area; Denver, CO; Detroit, MI; Greater Boston Area, MA; Greater Denver Area, CO; Greater Los Angeles Area, CA; Greater New York Area; Irvine, CA; Madison, WI; Minneapolis, MN; Phoenix, AZ; Portland, OR; San Diego, CA.

Amazon internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks with start dates in May and June 2021. Applicants should have at a minimum one quarter/semester remaining after their internship concludes.

As a security engineer, you will/may:
Collaborate with experienced Amazonians to create and execute security controls, defenses, and countermeasures to intercept and prevent internal and/or external attacksDevelop, test, review, debug, or deploy code that supports security protocolsWork effectively with your team to identify security problems and improve the security aspects of their service(s)Assess risks that could affect the integrity, availability, or confidentiality of data, systems, or servicesResolve security events, incidents, or conduct security assessments using penetration tests, ethical hacking tools, or risk mitigation methodologies to evaluate vulnerabilitiesClassify, store, and handle data in accordance with policy or best practicesTroubleshoot, research the root cause of, and resolve security or risk issues with guidance

Master\xe2\x80\x99s in cybersecurity, information security, or related technical degreePrevious technical internship(s) in one or more of the following domains: web application development, penetration testing, mobile security, cryptography, public key infrastructure, forensic security, IP security, SSL/TLS, computer viruses and malware, network security, trusted security, trusted execution, threat intelligence, IoT security implications, authentication, etc.Experience with tools such as Wireshark, encryption software, Snort, Sguil, Suricata, Kibana, Metasploit, Nmap, OpenSSL, or SetkeyPursuing certifications (e.g., Certified Ethical Hacker [CEH]) and/or attending events (e.g., Capture the Flag [CTF])Ability to deal with ambiguity in a fast-paced environment

Title: b'Prime Gaming Live Producer Intern'
Summary: b'Currently enrolled in graduate interactive entertainment design program.\nHave produced multiple live productions, preferably in the digital space.'
Details:
b"Currently enrolled in graduate interactive entertainment design program.
Have produced multiple live productions, preferably in the digital space
Undergraduate degree in Television and Video Production, Film, or Journalism

Have you ever wanted to be part of building a new entertainment business? Twitch is a new media, and Prime Gaming Live is at the forefront of that evolution. The creation of this programming is a new role, and we are creating the processes and mechanisms that will help the next generation of video producers concentrate on making great programs.
We believe the evolution that began with pre-Internet arcade communities a quarter at a time, growing to the live streams and eSports of today, will continue to a future in which fans are creators, players are celebrities, and games are a global cultural touchstone that cuts across age, gender and nationality. Games have the power to connect communities at a massive scale, and this role will delve into linking these communities together and delivering great customer experiences to players, viewers, streamers, and game publishers.
This summer, we are seeking interns who have a blend of creative, production and technical skills. You will learn our production methodology, collaborate on our programming design and presentation, and contribute new programming ideas.
This isn't your average Video Production Internship program. There is a high degree of exploration and ambiguity and we are looking for students to have substantial, specific creative and technical experience with live television and video productions.


1-3 years relevant industry experience

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us."

Title: b'Early Talent Operations Coordinator'
Summary: b'The duration of this contract will be approximately 6 months with the possibility of extension.\nPrepare and send employment agreements for candidates based\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'The Early Talent Operations Coordinator will work within the Early Talent Team. This team manages our Early in Career roles and pipeline through our on-campus recruitment and non-traditional internship channels. This position requires constant interaction with staff at all levels, across all departments, and in other countries, in a fast-paced environment. We are looking for an operational-savvy expert who can make an impact by remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful, and efficient, with a high-level of integrity, confidentiality and attention to detail at all times. Remote candidates welcome!
This is a contract role and can be based out of most locations within the US. The duration of this contract will be approximately 6 months with the possibility of extension.
Responsibilities
Prepare and send employment agreements for candidates based around the world
Onboard new hires into our HRIS system (Workday)
Collaborate with internal onboarding partners (IT, People, Learning and Development, Facilities teams) to ensure a positive onboarding experience for all new hires
Generate a variety of reports for different tasks (e.g. to audit new hires in Workday, a weekly new hire report to share with onboarding teams, validate completion of background checks for new hires, etc.)
Work with and meet the needs of your partners across multiple time zones
Initiate and audit background checks
Routinely partner with Recruiters, Legal, HR business partners, Immigration, and Global Mobility to ensure that offers are drafted accurately and sent in a timely manner
Requirements
Track record of successfully supporting the completion of tasks and projects
You\xe2\x80\x99re a persistent problem solver with strong follow-through
Experienced in developing and improving processes
Possess strong written and verbal communication skills (more important than ever as we are all remote) with the ability to partner and influence across levels and functions
You have a critical eye and a knack for figuring things out
Organized, efficient and proven ability to prioritize effectively
Demonstrated ability to thrive working in a highly dynamic team environment
Advanced Microsoft Office skills (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
Nice to Haves: Bonus points!
Experience handling and working with an Applicant Tracking System (Jobvite, Taleo, etc.) or HRIS (Workday)
Experience with ATS (Jobvite preferred) and recruiting tools and systems
Knowledge of employment guidelines and practices
Education: Got it!
Minimum High School Diploma, GED or the equivalent required.

Title: b'Intern - Seattle'
Summary: b'Eligibility includes college juniors, seniors, and newly graduated.\nAccounting, Finance or Business majors preferred.'
Details:
b"Brighton Jones, one of the country\xe2\x80\x99s fastest growing wealth management firms, is looking for an outstanding summer intern to join our team. This role will be multi-faceted with the opportunity to work within our Finance and Accounting Team as well as with other Operations team members.

Our summer internship program offers daily responsibilities and challenging project experience in a professional and fun setting. You\xe2\x80\x99ll jump into the starting line-up of an award-winning team with an incredible company culture.

Our intern program offers the following and more:

Interaction with bright, driven professionals and senior leadership such as our Director of Finance and Accounting as well as other leaders at the company
Quarterly team week activities and \xe2\x80\x9cfun committee\xe2\x80\x9d events
Volunteer opportunities at New Horizons or other company sponsored charities
First-hand experience to see why Brighton Jones has been nominated a \xe2\x80\x9c100 Best Places to Work\xe2\x80\x9d now 8 consecutive years!

Professional Qualifications

Eligibility includes college juniors, seniors, and newly graduated
Academic success and other internships or work-related experience encouraged
Accounting, Finance or Business majors preferred
Experience with QuickBooks, Salesforce and Excel a plus
Excellent references required

Critical Skills & Attributes

Commitment to excellence and high standards
Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities with enthusiasm
A high degree of personal integrity, initiative, and acute attention to detail
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent work habits, strong organizational skills, and the ability to prioritize tasks and manage workflows
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with clients and co-workers
Must be able to interact well with others and project a capable and trustworthy image
Must be a self-starter and proactively manage workload, communications, and ownership of tasks

Common Attributes of Brighton Jones Employees

Passion
They are passionate about what they do. They demonstrate unquestioned commitment to integrity in their personal and professional activities, and respect the confidential nature of our business. They have a strong desire to help clients achieve their personal goals.

Collaboration
Teamwork is central to everything they do. They express opinions positively and constructively, focusing on solutions rather than on problems. They exhibit good listening skills and respect the opinions of others. They demonstrate a willingness to do whatever it takes, regardless of role, to meet client expectations. They share the burden with team members during heavy work periods.

Continuous Learning
They are naturally curious, and have a strong desire for continuous learning. They know what they know, and more importantly, what they don't know. They are not afraid to ask questions, and respectfully challenge answers.

INTERESTED? LET US KNOW!
Apply online at: http://www.brightonjones.com/careers/opportunities/
Do you have something you want to tell us in addition to what\xe2\x80\x99s on your resume? We want to hear about it! Click here to submit a short video to tell us more about you.

OUR CULTURE

As a group of individuals that love what we do and enjoy who we work with, we know that the genuine relationships we build with each other positively affect our clients and their experience of working with us. We\xe2\x80\x99re intentional in cultivating a culture that is inclusive, collaborative, and celebrates individual initiative.
We are:
Genuine - our unquestioned commitment to integrity is demonstrated in all of our personal and professional activities
Focused \xe2\x80\x93 we work together to manage heavy workloads and time-sensitive projects - we thrive in a fast-paced environment that fosters continued growth and development
Approachable \xe2\x80\x93 we enjoy interacting with each other and our clients, always projecting a professional, friendly and capable image in everything we do
Invested \xe2\x80\x93 our commitment to our clients and each other means we are willing to maintain a flexible work schedule to address cyclical work periods
Driven - we possess good judgment, initiative and decision-making skills - able to anticipate problems, determine the appropriate level of response, and act accordingly
OUR COMPANY

We are a nationally recognized wealth management firm that puts our clients first.

We invest in and value the relationships we have with our clients, colleagues and community members -it is our mission to help those that we work with live a richer life. Title: b'2021 Business Analyst Intern'
Summary: b'Currently enrolled in a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree program with a graduation conferral date between December 2021 and August 2022.\nAbility to deal with ambiguity.'
Details:
b"\xc2\xb7 Currently enrolled in a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree program with a graduation conferral date between December 2021 and August 2022

At Amazon, we are excited to offer undergraduate students the opportunity to launch into big careers with limitless possibilities. We know searching for a full-time role is as much about finding a company where you can picture yourself being successful as it is about finding the right role. We look forward to meeting you and your classmates this year. As we get to know you more, we invite you to get to know us better. Visit www.amazon.com/about to learn more about:

Our businesses by reviewing press releases on our investor relations site, Jeff Bezos\xe2\x80\x99 letters to shareholders, and the first letter shared in 1997, which is included in our annual report each yearWhere Amazon operates around the worldOur commitment to our communities, diversity, and veteransWhere to find Amazon on social media
Important Notes
Please list your undergraduate school and expected graduation date within the Education section of your online application.Internship recruitment will occur January 2021 - March 2021Internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks
Business Analyst: As you launch your career as a business analyst at Amazon, you will focus on improving the success within a business function by analyzing data, discovering and solving real world problems, and building metrics and business cases to improve the customer's experience. We are focused on your success and want to build future leaders within Amazon. A key component of the role is to identify process and system improvement opportunities by monitoring existent metrics, analyzing data and collaborating with internal teams. In addition, design and develop automated reporting solutions to enable stakeholders to manage the business and make effective decisions. Lastly, enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format. Internship roles are available nationwide: Corporate offices and fulfillment centers.
Preferred applicants are majoring in business, computer, data engineering, economics, finance, engineering, mathematics, machine learning, science, statistics, and symbolic systems. In addition, basic to advanced knowledge of TABLEAU/Power Query, intermediate (e.g., vlookup) / advanced Excel skills (e.g., Write/edit VBA), and a basic to advanced knowledge of SQL (all join types, group by, order by, calculated columns).

Ability to think and act strategically and tacticallyAbility to deal with ambiguitySolid organizational skills, including prioritization and time managementStrong interpersonal, written and oral skillsProblem solving skillsAbility to summarize and communicate important data

Title: b'2021 Summer Retail Banking Internship - Seattle'
Summary: b'The Retail Intern assists new and existing clients of the Bank with account transactions and uncovers opportunities that can help improve clients Financial\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'The Retail Intern assists new and existing clients of the Bank with account transactions and uncovers opportunities that can help improve clients Financial Wellness. In addition, he/she acts as a resource in identifying and resolving client servicing issues. The Retail Intern is a part of the branch team and through conversations with the clients uncovers financial needs, communicates opportunities and transitions clients to the branch relationship management team.

Retail Intern Functions

Welcome clients, build rapport and provide outstanding service while performing account transactions.
Participate as an active member of the branch team, following the Branch Playbook.
Accept and accurately process all financial service transactions
Maintain responsibility for cash drawer and follow proper balancing procedures
Act as a resource to identify and resolve client servicing issues

Build Client Rapport

Provide excellent customer service to all KeyBank clients
Greet and welcome every client as they enter the branch; acknowledge by name, if known
Accurately process all financial service transactions
Participate in client appreciation events
Take ownership of client issues when possible, with the assistance of the branch management
Help create and establish a business relationship between the Personal Banker and the client
Review and maintain knowledge of product guides, fees and policies to stay current on offerings
Provide answers and assistance for client questions/concerns, utilizing resources within the branch
Coordinate time between Personal Banker and client for business meetings as necessary

Fulfill Client Needs

Have a full understanding of Key\xe2\x80\x99s Financial Wellness strategy
Continue to build the client relationship by viewing client accounts when performing transactions and identifying potential needs
Participate in branch huddles to better understand specific client needs

Follow-Up

Maintain relationships with Personal Bankers and Branch Managers and notify them of client sales opportunities
Ensure more complex sales activities/opportunities are handed off to the Personal Banker
Ensure compliance with security and audit procedures

KeyCorp is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer committed to engaging a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Title: b'Research Technician I - Boeckh Lab'
Summary: b'Lab experience (honors thesis, internship in a laboratory) obtained during undergraduate studies will be considered.'
Details:
b'Overview:

Cures Start Here. At Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center, home to three Nobel laureates, interdisciplinary teams of world-renowned scientists seek new and innovative ways to prevent, diagnose and treat cancer, HIV/AIDS and other life-threatening diseases. Fred Hutch\xe2\x80\x99s pioneering work in bone marrow transplantation led to the development of immunotherapy, which harnesses the power of the immune system to treat cancer. An independent, nonprofit research institute based in Seattle, Fred Hutch houses the nation\xe2\x80\x99s first cancer prevention research program, as well as the clinical coordinating center of the Women\xe2\x80\x99s Health Initiative and the international headquarters of the HIV Vaccine Trials Network. Careers Start Here.
At Fred Hutch, we believe that the innovation, collaboration, and rigor that result from diversity and inclusion are critical to our mission of eliminating cancer and related diseases. We seek employees who bring different and innovative ways of seeing the world and solving problems. Fred Hutch is in pursuit of becoming an antiracist organization. We are committed to ensuring that all candidates hired share our commitment to diversity, antiracism, and inclusion.

The Boeckh lab, a busy, diverse, applied clinical research lab, is seeking a research technician to participate in our work studying cellular innate and adaptive immune responses to viral infection, with a focus on herpesvirus and respiratory virus infections, including COVID-19. The lab also manages a large biospecimen repository of clinical and research samples. This position offers the opportunity to work with a wide variety of laboratory techniques in a supportive, collaborative setting.
Responsibilities:
High throughput multiparameter flow cytometry, including carrying out experiments, running samples on flow cytometers, and analyzing data
Carry out cell culture and cellular neutralizing antibody assays
Perform molecular techniques for assessing immune function
Summarizing and presenting data at lab meetings and for publications
Processing of research samples, including blood and respiratory tract swabs/washes
Assisting with biospecimen repository functions, including sample inventory, movement and aliquoting
Perform ordering, reagent prep, equipment maintenance and other tasks as assigned
Qualifications:

Education and experience:
BA/BS in biology or other scientific field is required
Previous hands-on laboratory experience is required (minimum one year highly desired)
Lab experience (honors thesis, internship in a laboratory) obtained during undergraduate studies will be considered
Hands-on experience with flow cytometry, cell culture or molecular biology is preferred

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work well both independently and collaboratively as part of a team
Superior organizational, prioritization, and time management skills
Proficient computer skills (PC and/or Mac, Microsoft Office Suite, etc.) Experience with FACSDiva, FlowJo and GraphPad Prism a plus.
Meticulous attention to detail
Ability to maintain accurate documentation for experiments and quality control
Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously
Ability to work efficiently, be adaptable, and be self-motivated

A statement describing your commitment and contributions toward greater diversity, equity, inclusion, and anti-racism in your career or that will be made through work at Fred Hutch is requested of all finalists.
Our Commitment to Diversity: We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA) Employer. We are committed to cultivating a workplace in which diverse perspectives and experiences are welcomed and respected. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, ancestry, national origin, sex, age, disability (physical or mental), marital or veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, political ideology, or membership in any other legally protected class. We are an Affirmative Action employer. We encourage individuals with diverse backgrounds to apply and desire priority referrals of protected veterans. If due to a disability you need assistance/and or a reasonable accommodation during the application or recruiting process, please send a request to our Employee Services Center at hrops@fredhutch.org or by calling 206-667-4700.'

Title: b'Bridge Engineering Internship'
Summary: b'Completion of 90+ credits, including two or more design courses (concrete, steel, wood, or masonry), by the start of the 2021 summer internship.'

b"Job Title
Bridge Engineering Internship
Added
2021-01-18
Reporting Center
Seattle
City
Seattle, WA
Company

BRIDGE ENGINEERING INTERNSHIP
KPFF\xe2\x80\x99s Washington Division, located in Downtown Seattle, is seeking Bridge Engineering Interns for the Civil/Structural Group. Be sure to check out our website to learn more about what you can gain from an internship at KPFF: www.kpff.com
DESCRIPTION
We proudly take part in students\xe2\x80\x99 educational and professional development. We go beyond giving interns a glimpse into the job\xe2\x80\x94we place them in the middle of it. We do this by incorporating them into teams that are excited to share their professional experience as they work on projects together. We give interns real problems to solve and real designs to complete. Job responsibilities vary by group, and every intern walks away with real engineering experience and a unique story to tell.
KPFF typically hires interns during the summer, and begins reviewing resumes in January. In order to make the experience as beneficial as possible, we hire interns at certain levels in their college careers. Structural interns are typically graduating seniors or above (with 90+ credits).
The Bridge/Heavy-Civil Team consists of structural engineers working in a vast array of bridge and heavy-civil design fields such as, highway bridges, pedestrian bridges, walls, culverts/fish-passage, bridge inspection, ferry terminals, and piers/wharves.
We are passionate about developing great engineers. Join us and be part of a team that works on exciting projects with exceptional clients!

Strong technical and organizational abilities
Ability to work remotely
KPFF is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

Title: b'Arborist Trainee Internship | Summer 2021'
Summary: b'Davey Tree offers paid internships, where overtime may be offered on Saturdays.\nEducation Level Required: High School Diploma / GED.\n40-50 hours per week.'
Details:
b"Requisition Number: 86409
Company Name: The Davey Tree Expert Company
Service Line: 1RES - Kent-Residential & Commercial Services
Employment Type: Intern
Job Type: Temporary
Education Level Required: High School Diploma / GED
Work Experience Required: 1 - 2 years
Travel Expectations: Up to 25%

Summer 2021 - Arborist Trainee Internship
Davey Tree Residential & Commercial Services
NW Seattle, WA (Lake Forest Park, WA)
The Davey Tree Expert Company is looking for exceptional students who are interested in expanding their field experience in the areas of Tree Care, Plant Health Care, Sales and Client Services.

STARTING DATE:
Flexible - We are currently looking for Internship candidates for Spring/Summer 2021. Internship generally start in June and run through August.

LOCATION:
Seattle (Lake Forest Park), WA
HOURS:
40-50 hours per week. A typical schedule is 40-50 hours per week, Monday-Friday with some Saturdays. Davey Tree offers paid internships, where overtime may be offered on Saturdays.

OBJECTIVES:
Introduce career orientated students to exceptional opportunities in the industry including tree care, tree climbing, chainsaw use, plant health care and customer service. Internships in each division may vary in length depending on availability. Interns will be assigned a manager who will mentor them through a variety of job experiences within the industry. Throughout your experience, you will work on residential and commercial properties and in an office setting.

POSITION AND ENVIRONMENT:
If you love working outdoors, this physically demanding position may be for you.
Students will be introduced to training and direct work participation in the areas of tree surgery, pest management, tree fertilization, lawn care, sales and customer service, along with exposure to support services of scheduling, routing and client billing/records. These modules may vary in length of time and not fall in a set sequence or be intermittent in duration, depending upon weather, work scheduling and the student\xe2\x80\x99s proficiency.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Studying Arboriculture, Urban Forestry, Horticulture, Landscape Design, Forestry or related discipline
Driver\xe2\x80\x99s license is a plus

EXPERIENCE WE'RE LOOKING FOR:
This is an outdoor based, physically demanding, hands-on position
Must have enthusiasm for proper plant care and arboriculture
Positive attitude and willingness to learn
Demonstrated ability to report for work regularly and punctually
Collaboration and communication skills

EXPERIENCE AND PERKS WE OFFER:
Over 135 years of service gives you job security
National reputation for Stewardship and Excellence
Promotes ambitious, team-focused experts quickly and focuses on continuing education
Commitment to safety: Interns will work towards completing the CDP \xe2\x80\x9cC\xe2\x80\x9d Climber booklet
Access to industry related training materials
Climbing gear, uniforms and PPE provided
On your time off......Explore the mountain, numerous parks, and all that the beautiful pacific northwest offers

SALARY
 Competitive & Negotiable

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:
Pre-employment Drug Screen and Social Security verification required.
We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. As a service provider, our success depends upon our ability to attract and retain qualified personnel, regardless of their age, race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or other protected characteristics as established by federal, state or local law.
The Davey Tree Expert Company has U.S. and Canadian operations in more than 47 states and five provinces and provides a variety of tree care, grounds maintenance and consulting services for the residential, utility, commercial, and government markets. Founded in 1880, Davey has been employee-owned for 40 years and has more than 10,000 employees who provide Proven Solutions for a Growing World. For more information, visit www.davey.com If you need any assistance at any time please contact us at 1-877-411-7601 or at Recruiting@davey.com."

Title: b'Internship Opportunities for Students \xe2\x80\x93 Garage Software Engi...'
Summary: b'Some experience building software outside of the classroom environment like an internship, hackathon, research project or related experience preferred.'
Details:
b'The Garage is an innovative program that gives university students the opportunity to work with industry leaders and their peers to build apps for the latest Microsoft platforms. Garage students work in small teams with modern engineering toolsets to build and ship their work. Each team is responsible for an app or feature, starting with product definition, working through design and development; and if successful, wrapping up with the public launch of the app in the Store or feature included in our products. Coaches and technical leaders from across Microsoft provide guidance and expertise.

Garage Principles:
Invest in great talent: The Garage provides an opportunity for students to experience the breadth of Microsoft technologies and to practice engineering in a fast-paced environment.
Build on Microsoft platforms: Microsoft\xe2\x80\x99s strategic platform is constantly moving forward. Our teams build apps and cloud-powered services on Windows, Xbox One, HoloLens, Surface Hub and Azure with APIs from OneDrive, OneNote, Xbox Live, and others.
Ship fast with quality: The Garage uses modern engineering infrastructure and an agile development model to ship apps and features in 12 weeks. Our apps and features have received accolades from press, partners, and customers alike.
As a team member in the Garage, you\xe2\x80\x99ll bring a product to life by working with a small team with guidance and insight from a team of experienced technical coaches and mentors.

Software Engineer
Software engineers (SWEs) collaborate with a committed team to design, develop and test the next generation of technology solutions for millions of people.
Responsibilities
You will work closely with your team and have end-to-end ownership for development and quality of a product (and associated services) that will delight customers and add strategic value for Microsoft. Working closely as a team of program manager and software engineers, you will evaluate requirements, estimate costs, create and implement features and services. You will define and implement the quality criteria for your app, using measurements and insights to understand and validate the quality of experience for customers. You will manage risks, leverage other products and technologies, and drive integration with the broader ecosystem.

Software Engineer
Software engineers (SWEs) work with teammates to solve problems and build innovative software solutions. You are passionate about customers and product quality, and you provide technical guidance to Program Managers as they consider user needs and product requirements. You will also be expected to demonstrate an ability to learn and adopt relevant new technologies, tools, methods and processes to leverage in your solutions.
As a SWE, you are dedicated to building software to empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more.
Qualifications
Software Engineer
A bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in engineering, computer science or related field (pursuing with at least one semester/quarter remaining after internship).
Available to start on May 24, 2021
1-2 years of experience programming in C++, Java or other computer programming languages preferred.
1-2 years of experience in C/C++/C#/VB.NET and experience designing and developing tool architecture preferred.
Strong technical prowess, including understanding of algorithms, systems architecture and end-user experience.
Some experience building software outside of the classroom environment like an internship, hackathon, research project or related experience preferred
Expertise in feature definition, design and feasibility.
Demonstrated skill in estimating development time.
Ability to author test plans and cases, conduct security and stress tests and debug at source level after identifying, investigating and prioritizing bugs.
Proactive work ethic, capable and creative problem solver who is not afraid of big challenges.
Able to work closely with other team members in a collaborative productive multidisciplinary environment.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.'

Title: b'Brand Specialist, Amazon Fashion Canada'
Summary: b'Amazon is seeking to hire and develop leaders that have the capability to grow into general managers that can independently run large business segments spanning\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Bachelors degree required.
Excel experience
A minimum of 1 experience in one of the following roles:
Quantitative/Financial Analysis
Retail Buying
Retail Planning & Allocation
Product/Project Management
Retail Pricing
Marketing
E-Commerce.

Amazon Fashion (Canada) is a fast-growing business where our business model is evolving with technology and industry trends. We need nimble leaders who move fast, are capable of breaking down and solving complex problems, and have a strong will to get things done in an environment that resembles a start-up. Amazon is seeking to hire and develop leaders that have the capability to grow into general managers that can independently run large business segments spanning multiple functional areas. Incoming hires are given ownership of large, important areas of opportunity; the autonomy to make decisions; and the ability to drive significant impact to the customer experience. The team is looking for a smart, eager, hard-working, creative candidate with strong merchandising, organizational, and analytical skills.

In this role, a successful candidate will be an effective communicator and problem-solver and someone who is able to balance the needs and requirements of both Amazon and the vendor. This role is an ideal start to a dynamic career path at Amazon for an ambitious candidate who is eager to drive a business. The candidate will develop skills and work across all functional retail areas to grow and improve their vendor partner\xe2\x80\x99s success on the Amazon retail platform.

Other key tasks will include the following:
\xc2\xb7

Analyze sales and key metrics to identify business opportunities for top brands.

\xc2\xb7

Provide recommendations to improve sales and margin

\xc2\xb7

Improve catalog quality to enhance the customer experience.

\xc2\xb7

Coordinate and create launch plans for new brands launching on Amazon.ca.

\xc2\xb7

Manage site placements and promotions based on the vendor\xe2\x80\x99s event calendar

\xc2\xb7
This role is also responsible for inventory management, forecast generation, product launches, pricing, and conducting detailed analysis to identify opportunities to drive growth for the vendor and Amazon.ca.

Brand Specialist roles are in the General Management career path at Amazon. The general management career path offers the opportunity for advancement into a variety of roles including Marketing/Merchandising, Vendor Management, Product Management and Inventory Management.

Title: b'Human Resources (HR) Generalist - Intern 2021'
Summary: b'Work, internship, or other leadership experience in a professional environment.\nCurrently pursuing a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree with a conferral date between December\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"Currently pursuing a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree with a conferral date between December 2021 and August 2022.
Work, internship, or other leadership experience in a professional environment
Open for placement with one of Amazon's HR teams across North America.

Are you an undergraduate student looking for an internship opportunity in the summer of 2021? Are you looking for an opportunity to launch into Human Resources careers with limitless possibilities?

We know searching for an internship is as much about finding a company where you can picture yourself being successful as it is about finding the right full-time role. Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s HR Generalist internship is focused on people operations and preserving Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s peculiar culture in the way we attract, hire, and develop talented people. In this role, you will manage a project from beginning to end with one of Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s HR teams in North America. Projects will vary from working with compensation, HR managers and business partners, onboarding, training and development, talent acquisition, or international HR.

This internship is a project-based, educational opportunity intended to prepare students to enter Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s Global Human Resources organization. You will spend 12 weeks learning about Amazon's peculiar approach to hiring and developing the best professionals by working with experienced senior management and business partners, as well as cross-functional HR support teams. You will get a 360-degree view of Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s approach to HR, where you will see managerial strategy and concepts come alive in a fast-paced environment that showcases everything that goes on behind the scenes to ensure our teams have what's needed to develop and retain a high-powered workforce.

Do you thrive in a dynamic, fast paced environment? Would you like the challenge of delivering a continuously improving employee experience? Can you think broadly about creative solutions and work to implement process improvement across our HR teams worldwide? If the answer is yes, the HR Generalist internship may be right for you.
Come build the future with us.


Ability to show effective use of analytics and data
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to embrace the big picture and exercise judgment
Demonstrated ability to bring big ideas and influence across all levels of an organization
Strong bias for action
Ability to adapt well to fast-paced environments with high growth and ambiguity
Majors/concentrations in HR Management, Organizational Development, business administration, or related fields

Title: b'Product Manager (Summer 2021 Internship)'
Summary: b'We are looking for a Product Manager Intern to assist the team with strategy, roadmap, and feature definition for the Cloud Infrastructure Engineering Team.'
Details:
b"If you are a current Motorola Solutions employee, please click this link to apply through your Workday account.
Company Overview
At Motorola Solutions, we create technologies our customers refer to as their lifeline. Our technology platforms in communications, software, video and services help our customers work safely and more efficiently. Whether it\xe2\x80\x99s helping firefighters see through smoke, enabling police officers to see around street corners, or reliably keeping the lights on in homes and businesses around the world, our work supports those who put their lives on the line to keep us safe. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions, and help us usher in a new era in public safety and security.

Department Overview
The Cloud Infrastructure team is responsible for the development and operations of critical cloud infrastructure and platform services, in support of Motorola Solutions' public and hybrid cloud-based Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions for public safety customers. This team is part of Motorola Solutions\xe2\x80\x99 Software Enterprise division, which offers secure, reliable and efficient team communications, workflow and operational intelligence solutions for mission critical public safety and enterprise markets throughout the world. Our services leverage Cloud Computing infrastructure on Azure to build at scale.

Job Description
We are looking for a Product Manager Intern to assist the team with strategy, roadmap, and feature definition for the Cloud Infrastructure Engineering Team.


Responsibilities:
Analyze market and competitive conditions and lays out a product vision that is differentiated and delivers unique value based on customer demands.
Bridge gaps within the company between different functions, especially between development, sales and marketing, and support.
Coordinate overall release project and schedule, manage risks and resolves issues that affect release scope, schedule and quality
Gather customer and sales feedback and voice of customer
Create user stories and scenarios, direct and approve UI/UX activities, define acceptance criteria, KPIs and SLAs
Facilitate sales and channel training, assist pre-sales with custom project requests, demonstrate new pre-release features
Legal authorization to work in the U.S. indefinitely is required. Employer work permit sponsorship is not available for this position or full time roles in the future.

Basic Requirements
Currently pursuing a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, MBA or related field with a graduation date on or after December 1st, 2021.
Must be able to obtain background clearance as required by government customer

Travel Requirements
None

Relocation Provided
None

Position Type
Intern

Referral Payment Plan
No


EEO Statement
Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or, any other protected characteristic."

Title: b'2021 Field Engineering (Project Management) Internship (West...'
Summary: b'Recruiting for the 2021 internship program takes place from September 2020 through March 2021.\nThis is a 12-week paid learning experience with the Site\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Are you ready for a challenge that could launch your career? T-Mobile is revolutionizing the wireless industry for millions of customers nationwide. Working here means rolling up your sleeves and redefining the status quo with a team that has your back every step of the way.

You\xe2\x80\x99re encouraged to be an Intern at T-Mobile.
This is a 12-week paid learning experience with the Site Development Teams. You will supervise important metrics and to work with engineers to resolve the best course of action needed to impact the network for our customers. You will be pulling daily important metric trends to analyze the data with the other specialists. You will also participate in the daily performance calls and eventually own the call as your experience increases.
What you'll do in your role
Working as Intern with the Site Development Teams you will get experience and exposure to many of the following daily responsibilities:
Support of senior project team members across site development organizational functions
Analyze and report on project milestone and site attribute data to identify project risks, reveal trends, and capture business insights to improve project deployment
Crafting new and improving existing business processes
Crafting presentations to communicate project status updates
Coordination and communication on interdepartmental tasks and processes
Report on and prepare presentation materials for assigned projects
Coordinate with and support market project deployment teams as needed
You\xe2\x80\x99ll contribute your creativity and phenomenal ideas, working alongside innovative colleagues and mentors who will push you to be your very best. We\xe2\x80\x99ll give you hands-on projects and the chance to make an immediate impact.
The experience you'll bring.
You\xe2\x80\x99re currently enrolled in college and pursuing a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree with an Finance or Data Analytics focus. Aside from your degree path, we are looking for the following skills:
Excellent verbal and written communication
Understanding of General Project Management Theory
Strong Excel skills
Familiar with Power BI and SQL a plus
Well-organized and able to prioritize and manage time in a fast-paced environment
Self-starter with a passion for learning who is not afraid to ask questions.
Able to understand and analyze data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement
Data visualization: able to incorporate visual elements to effectively convey a message
Able to work both independently and in a cooperative team environment to achieve goals
Being an Intern
Our Internship Program takes place over the summer running 12 weeks from May to September. As an Intern, you\xe2\x80\x99ll receive competitive pay, relocation benefits, an outstanding experience, and the support of a team that believes in your potential. You\xe2\x80\x99ll also have plenty of opportunities to meet and network with other interns, fellow team members, and top leaders from all business functions across the company as you make connections that will last your career. Want to learn more?

A big part of our culture is about embracing our Magenta spirit. And we\xe2\x80\x99ll ask you to do the same. Check out #BeMagenta to see how we work together to take care of our customers and each other every day.

Recruiting Timeline
Recruiting for the 2021 internship program takes place from September 2020 through March 2021. We\xe2\x80\x99ll be virtually visiting campuses across the country and virtually attending national recruiting conferences in September through November. We\xe2\x80\x99ll be connecting with candidates and begin screening in January. If we believe you\xe2\x80\x99re a good fit for one of our roles, we\xe2\x80\x99ll contact you directly to discuss next steps. Interviews will start to take place in late January and all internships will be filled by the end of March.

Application Process
Select the job category that best matches your interests, education and experience and click apply. We\xe2\x80\x99ll then review your application. If we believe you\xe2\x80\x99re a good fit for one of our roles, we\xe2\x80\x99ll contact you directly to discuss next steps.

(NASDAQ: \xe2\x80\x9cTMUS\xe2\x80\x9d) is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. Title: b'Prime Gaming Live Producer Intern'
Summary: b'Currently enrolled in graduate interactive entertainment design program.\nHave produced multiple live productions, preferably in the digital space.'
Details:
b"Currently enrolled in graduate interactive entertainment design program.
Have produced multiple live productions, preferably in the digital space
Undergraduate degree in Television and Video Production, Film, or Journalism

Have you ever wanted to be part of building a new entertainment business? Twitch is a new media, and Prime Gaming Live is at the forefront of that evolution. The creation of this programming is a new role, and we are creating the processes and mechanisms that will help the next generation of video producers concentrate on making great programs.
We believe the evolution that began with pre-Internet arcade communities a quarter at a time, growing to the live streams and eSports of today, will continue to a future in which fans are creators, players are celebrities, and games are a global cultural touchstone that cuts across age, gender and nationality. Games have the power to connect communities at a massive scale, and this role will delve into linking these communities together and delivering great customer experiences to players, viewers, streamers, and game publishers.
This summer, we are seeking interns who have a blend of creative, production and technical skills. You will learn our production methodology, collaborate on our programming design and presentation, and contribute new programming ideas.
This isn't your average Video Production Internship program. There is a high degree of exploration and ambiguity and we are looking for students to have substantial, specific creative and technical experience with live television and video productions.


1-3 years relevant industry experience

As a security engineer, you will/may:
Collaborate with experienced Amazonians to create and execute security controls, defenses, and countermeasures to intercept and prevent internal and/or external attacksDevelop, test, review, debug, or deploy code that supports security protocolsWork effectively with your team to identify security problems and improve the security aspects of their service(s)Assess risks that could affect the integrity, availability, or confidentiality of data, systems, or servicesResolve security events, incidents, or conduct security assessments using penetration tests, ethical hacking tools, or risk mitigation methodologies to evaluate vulnerabilitiesClassify, store, and handle data in accordance with policy or best practicesTroubleshoot, research the root cause of, and resolve security or risk issues with guidance

Title: b'New Graduate Software Engineer'
Summary: b'Contribute to product and services development process; Design and test your own hypophysis by collecting and measuring data.'
Details:
b'Internship Description:

New Graduate -Software Engineer

This position can be in the following US cities: Bellevue, Washington, NYC, Knoxville

About the organization
Discovery Direct-to-Consumer is the technology arm of Discovery Inc.
We work at the intersection of technology, entertainment, and everyday utility, continuously leveraging technology to create immersive viewing and interactive experiences. We are building a global streaming video platform (OTT) and a suite of applications to support all our global brands. These include Discovery+, Food Network Kitchen, GolfTV, MotorTrend on Demand, Eurosport Player, and many more. We are building modern container-based micro-services operated on AWS. Our platform covers everything from search, catalogue, video transcoding, personalization, to global subscriptions, and much more. We build user experiences ranging from traditional video streaming, to highly interactive and immersive applications. We build across connected TV, web, mobile and consoles and are fast, nimble and have fun building world-class products for our iconic brands. This is a growing, global engineering group crucial to Discovery\xe2\x80\x99s future.

Why Join the Discovery Team?
Discovery\xe2\x80\x99s Direct-to- Consumer team offers a truly unique experience. As a Graduate Software Engineer, you\xe2\x80\x99ll make an almost immediate impact, helping to create world class global streaming products and the platform that powers them. You\xe2\x80\x99ll be able to build features that help to refine the modern viewing experience for millions. We\xe2\x80\x99re a global team, but with many of the benefits of working in a start-up environment, building from the ground up. We encourage our engineers to take educated risks, we celebrate mistakes, and we learn from them as a team. You\xe2\x80\x99ll also work with and learn from highly talented engineers, using cutting-edge technology to deliver immense value for passionate superfans around the world. We have a genuinely open culture and expect great ideas to come from everyone and look forward to the fresh perspective and new ideas our graduates bring!

What you will do
Create world-class global streaming products and the platform that powers them
Develop your area of expertise on the features and services you help build along with a group of talented engineers
Take end to end ownership of product features and own the technical and operational excellence of these products
Contribute to product and services development process; Design and test your own hypophysis by collecting and measuring data.
Requirements:

What we\xe2\x80\x99re looking for
In addition to academic qualifications, we look for proactive problem solvers, motivated to learn and able to collaborate and exchange ideas and most importantly be a team player.
Degree in Computer Science or related field
Software development experience coding in a general-purpose programming language.
Prior Intern experience as a developer in a consumer-focused company
Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis
Effective communication skills in both verbal and written communication.
Experience developing in at least one of the following languages (Java, C/C++, Python, GoLang, Swift or Javascript).
Desire to work on a diverse team
Knowledge of distributed systems, mobile and OTT client apps, video streaming, codecs, video delivery and broadcast workflows is a big plus.
Must be completing degree in 2021 or no more than 12 months post graduation
Must have the legal right to work in the United States
More About the Intern Program:

.'
