Title: b'Assistant Account Executive, Technology'
Summary: b'Prior internship experience highly preferred.\nFamiliarity with the public relations and communications discipline through past coursework, other internships, or\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"The role is open to be based from Seattle, WA; San Francisco, CA

Edelman is growing in Tech \xe2\x80\x93 and fast. We\xe2\x80\x99re helping Fortune 500 companies re-conceive their business models, and start-ups challenge entire markets. We operate at the heart of today\xe2\x80\x99s hottest industries in technology, including AI, mobility, consumer devices, and the cloud. Technology is our fastest growing sector, and the obsession of our clients big and small.

We are looking for an Assistant Account Executive to join our West Coast Tech team. You will have the opportunity to develop and drive integrated plans for some of today\xe2\x80\x99s hottest technologies.

A Little More About What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Do:
Reading and identifying media clips from clipping services and online resources
Monitoring client competition coverage
Preparation of press kits for distribution
Updating media lists
Assisting with compilation of media coverage reports
Drafting pitch letters and/or emailing pitches
Conducting and compiling research
Staffing and attending media events
Participation in brainstorms
About You:
Hold a Bachelor's degree in a related field such as journalism, business, communications, or public relations
Preferably have an understanding of the current technology industry landscape
Desire to stay up to date with emerging technologies and trends and how they integrate into communications programs
Familiarity with the public relations and communications discipline through past coursework, other internships, or personal experiences. Prior internship experience highly preferred.
Possess excellent organizational skills and the proven ability to adapt to new conditions, assignments, and deadlines
Superior verbal communication skills
Have strong writing abilities
Demonstrated strong leadership capabilities through extracurricular activities
Demonstrated creative thinking through projects, coursework, or activities
Knowledge of TrendKite is preferred but not required
#LI-JLF

Edelman is a global communications firm that partners with businesses and organizations to evolve, promote and protect their brands and reputations. Our 6,000 people in more than 60 offices deliver communications strategies that give our clients the confidence to lead and act with certainty, earning the trust of their stakeholders. Our honors include the Cannes Lions Grand Prix for PR; Advertising Age\xe2\x80\x99s 2019 A-List; the Holmes Report\xe2\x80\x99s 2018 Global Digital Agency of the Year; and, five times, Glassdoor\xe2\x80\x99s Best Places to Work. Since our founding in 1952, we have remained an independent, family-run business. Edelman owns specialty companies Edelman Data & Intelligence (DxI) and United Entertainment Group (entertainment, sports, lifestyle).

For more information please visit: www.edelman.com


Edelman is an equal opportunity employer of all protected classes, including veterans and individuals with disabilities."

Title: b'Full Time Opportunities for Students and Recent Graduates -...'
Summary: b'Some experience building software outside of the classroom environment like an internship, hackathon, research project or related experience preferred.'
Details:
b"Software engineers at Microsoft are passionate about building technologies that make the world a better place. At Microsoft, you will collaborate with others to solve problems and build some of the world's most advanced services and devices. Your efforts on the design, development, and testing of next-generation applications will have an impact on millions of people.
Do you want to work on a meaningful and impactful project and make a difference?
Are you willing to learn from others and open to new ideas?
Do you want to support others to succeed and operate in a highly-collaborative and global environment?
If this sounds like you, Microsoft would like to invite you to come join us as you are, where you can find more than just a job.
Read on to learn more about opportunities and apply online!

Applications to these opportunities are considered for all available Software Engineering roles including the ones described below, depending on education level and/or location. To be considered for a position for students and recent graduates, you need to be enrolled full-time as a student within 12 months from graduation majoring in an applicable field or graduated within last 12 months majoring in an applicable field.

Software Engineer
Software engineers (SWEs) collaborate with a committed team to design, develop and test the next generation of technology solutions for millions of people.
Responsibilities
Software Engineer
Software engineers (SWEs) work with teammates to solve problems and build innovative software solutions. You are passionate about customers and product quality, and you provide technical guidance to Program Managers as they consider user needs and product requirements. You will also be expected to demonstrate an ability to learn and adopt relevant new technologies, tools, methods and processes to leverage in your solutions.
As a SWE, you are dedicated to building software to empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more.
Qualifications
Software Engineer
A bachelor's or master's degree in engineering, computer science or related field 12 months of graduation or graduated within the last 12 months.
A year or two of experience programming in C++, Java or other computer programming languages preferred.
Ability to demonstrate understanding of algorithms, data structures and other systems architecture factors that affect code quality, performance and customer experience
Some experience building software outside of the classroom environment like an internship, hackathon, research project or related experience preferred
Demonstrated skill in time management and completing software projects in a cooperative team environment

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work."

Title: b'Virtual HBO Max Content Intelligence Intern \xe2\x80\x93\xc2\xa0Summer 2021'
Summary: b'Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship.\nFully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Opportunity Overview
The WarnerMedia Story
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Now, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

The Job
We are looking for an eager and analytical individual who will help dissect and action against key content performance and engagement metrics to help drive strategic decision-making for HBO Max.

The Essentials
Curiosity for exploring data, drive to understand the "why", and a passion for drawing connections.
Motivation to learn new skills, tools, and analytics techniques.
Hands-on data analysis experience using Microsoft Excel, Statistical programming languages (Python/R), or data visualization tools (Looker).
Quantitative thinker with an eye for details - Effective written and verbal communication skills.
Interest in media & entertainment, and LOVE watching new shows on HBO Max.

Internship Program
Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship.
Summer 2021 program dates are June 7th - August 13th; must be available for full program duration.
Must be able to accommodate full-time schedule (40 hours/week).
Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program.
Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided.
This position is targeted toward upperclassmen and graduate students.
The Perks
Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field
Networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals
Engaging events including executive speakers sessions, professional development workshops, and more
Opportunity to join the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.'

Title: b'Electrical Design Intern'
Summary: b'From new construction and ongoing operations to adaptive reuse and energy retrofits, we provide a single point of accountability that drives waste and\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Thank you for your interest in interning with McKinstry!

We are proud and excited to offer summer internships for 2021 across several of our different office locations and are currently seeking an Electrical Design Intern to join our team located in Seattle, WA.

McKinstry is a national leader in designing, constructing, operating, and maintaining high-performing buildings. From new construction and ongoing operations to adaptive reuse and energy retrofits, we provide a single point of accountability that drives waste and redundancy out of the design/build construction process. Every day our teams collaborate to innovate, create, and deliver energy-efficient and cutting-edge solutions across the entire building lifecycle, to improve systems efficiency, reduce facility operational costs, and optimize profitability for our clients. We're champions for sustainability and together, we can build a thriving planet. For more information, visit our website.

Our B.L.U.E. (Build, Learn, Understand, Enrich) summer internship program is purposefully designed to be an authentic reflection of what it means to be an integral part of McKinstry. This is achieved through our hands-on, summer-long program structured to build a foundation of industry knowledge while personal and professional growth is facilitated through collaboration, exploration, and mentorship. From weekly "lunch & learn" sessions to our 2-day all-intern event, we believe in connecting our interns to various aspects of the company so they can truly evaluate potential career paths within the work we do. You can learn more about our internship program here.


What we look for in our Electrical Design Interns:

Must be pursuing or have a degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field. Junior student standing or higher required.
Availability in Summer 2021 (May/June start until August/September depending on the school); part-time availability after Summer preferred.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Must be detail-oriented, well organized, and possess excellent follow-up skills.
Must be self\xe2\x80\x93motivated, able to multi\xe2\x80\x90task, and work independently.
Some familiarity with construction plans, specs, contracts, proposals, estimates, and other commonly encountered items would be beneficial, however, it is expected that an intern would not generally have prior exposure to these concepts.
Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite - Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook required; working knowledge of SharePoint would be beneficial.
Computer-Aided Design (CAD) / Building Information Modelling (BIM) experience preferred. This internship will give ample opportunity to gain experience in Autodesk Revit.
Must be 18 years of age or older.


What are our Electrical Design Interns responsible for:

A McKinstry Electrical Design Intern will be exposed to multiple facets of the electrical design process. Items you may expect exposure to include the following:

Performing site visits or reviewing site record drawings and photos to gather information during project development.
Undertaking site visits to review progress during construction.
Performing manual calculations to support power system design.
Researching and supporting development of Solar PV / renewable energy projects.
Generating drawings including plans and schematics.
Providing construction support/administration activities such as answering Requests For Information (RFI\xe2\x80\x99s) & reviewing vendor equipment submittals.
Researching codes and standards to determine requirements on lighting and electrical systems.
Coordinating Electrical design with other disciplines (Mechanical, Structural, Architectural).
Utilizing specialized software to perform design calculations.
Other duties as assigned.


**Applications for internships will be open through February 2021 or until filled. Interviews with selected candidates will occur throughout 2021.**


The McKinstry group of companies are equal opportunity employers. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and qualified applicants without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, race, color, creed, marital status, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment including, but not limited to employment, advancement, assignment, and training. This commitment to Equal Employment Opportunity is made equally as a social responsibility and as an economic and business necessity.

McKinstry is a drug-free workplace. Employment is contingent upon successfully passing a pre-employment drug and alcohol test, complying with the requirements of the Immigration Reform and Control Act and a Confidentiality Agreement, in addition to successful outcomes of background and reference checks.

Title: b'Medical Sales Enablement Intern'
Summary: b'Remmie Health(www.remmiehealth.com ) is looking for a Medical Sales Enablement Intern to support our sales team with sales strategy, monitoring sales metrics,\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details: b"Remmie Health(www.remmiehealth.com ) is looking for a Medical Sales Enablement Intern to support our sales team with sales strategy, monitoring sales metrics, and manage the entire sales administration process. In this role, the candidate will conduct full-cycle medical sales, drive improvements to sales processes as needed, implement improvements, and monitor the impact of these changes over a determined period of time. This role requires managing the sales pipeline, working collaboratively with marketing, qualifying leads, and performing sales enablement functions.* Offering College Credits * As a Medical Sales Enablement Intern, you will: Manage the sales cycle; prospecting to close and establish new businessMaintain client partnerships and educate physicians and cliniciansSuggest and implement improvements in the sales administration processDefine and manage the process around qualifying high-value, outbound leadsQualifying and researching leads from a variety of sources, including self-developed leads, to develop a quality pipeline of potential customersDevelop and execute call, email, LinkedIn campaigns to generate a pipeline of sales meeting prospectsSpeak with gatekeepers and decision-makers to describe the benefits of Remmie MonitorNavigate customer/prospect hierarchy to reach decision-makers and arrange meetings with multiple stakeholders.Performing online presentations and demonstrations to decision-makersManage content/collateral repository and ensure that all information is easily and readily accessible at the point of needWhat\xe2\x80\x99s Required: Strong interest or experience in Digital Health, Healthcare, or Medical Sales(Pursuing) Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree or equivalent experienceAbility to project manage various complex initiatives with internal and external teamsUnderstanding of the sales administration processStrong analytical/strategy, verbal and written communications skillsWhat are the Benefits: A passionate, talented team of incredible people!Super competitive commissionJob Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract, InternshipPay: Up to $20.00 per hourSupplemental Pay:Bonus payCommission payEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)License/Certification:Driver's License (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteCompany's website:www.remmiehealth.comCompany's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/remmiehealth/"

Title: b'Summer 2021 Intern - User Researcher'
Summary: b'Industry experience with a n understanding of the product design cycle (internships, industry partnerships, volunteer experience all qualify).'
Details:
b'To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Intern
Job Details
Tableau helps people see and understand data. We design products that are fast, easy, and beautiful ; that anyone can use to solve problems and make a difference in the world.
People at Tableau are builders, tinkerers, and collaborators. Our teams are constantly bringing their passion, deep expertise, skill sets and ideas together to drive new features and products that improve people\xe2\x80\x99s lives . In a User Research internship, you\xe2\x80\x99ll do real work and make an impact immediately.
Want to help build experiences in Tableau that will reach more than a million people around the globe? Navigate large-scale, complex UX and technical challenges to conduct research in a fast development cycle? Receive world-class mentorship and connect with some of the brightest people in the industry? Oh, and have a blast while you\xe2\x80\x99re doing it? Join our 2021 Tableau intern class! Not only will you build great products, you get to hear from our leadership, attend intern-exclusive events, give back to your community through volunteer events and more. Discover a summer of new opportunities and experience what sets Tableau apart.
The primary role of the User Research intern will be to conduct studies that improve the user experience through a better understanding of our customers They will learn about users\xe2\x80\x99 motivations, behaviors and attitude s to help sculpt Tableau\xe2\x80\x99s products and user experience. This role will work collaboratively with User Researchers, Designers, Product Managers, Engineers, and others throughout the planning and development lifecycle.
Some of the things you\xe2\x80\x99ll be doing include
Advocate for users and help teams develop empathy and understanding of goals, jobs to be done, motivations, and behaviors.
Collaborate with feature teams to drive user research activities for multiple features at each phase of the product development cycle.
Plan and conduct qualitative and quantitative research.
Provide coaching and resources to product managers, designers, and engineers who are engaging in self-service user research activities.
Translate research findings into opportunities and actionable insights.
Clearly communicate research findings to various audiences. This may include written reports and multimedia presentations.
Utilize knowledge of the product, domain, and existing research to impact design.
Who you are:
A student pursuing a BA/BS/MS/PhD in Psychology, Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors, Sociology, or related fields; or equivalent industry experience
Industry experience with a n understanding of the product design cycle (internships, industry partnerships, volunteer experience all qualify).
Strong understanding of research methods and their appropriate use in applied settings.
Experience with various qualitative and quantitative research methods, including contextual interviewing, usability testing, behavioral analytics, and survey research.
Strong understanding of HCI principles and user centered design practices.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to influence a range of audiences.
Experience working in collaborative multidisciplinary teams.
Strong project management skills with the ability to manage and prioritize research efforts for multiple concurrent projects, preferred.
Hands - on experience with quantitative data analysis, utilizing statistical and visual analysis tools and techniques, preferred.
Familiar with analytics and database technologies; or demonstrates the drive and ability to quickly ramp up on new domains and technologies.
Accommodations - If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
Posting Statement
At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.
Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesfore.com or Salesforce.org.
Salesforce welcomes all.'

Title: b'Environmental Science Intern'
Summary: b'+ Previous internship experience in related field a plus.\nWith world class technical expertise, leading edge technology and innovative project delivery\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"AECOM is actively seeking a highly motivated Environmental Science Intern for employment in the Seattle, WA office.

This position is expected to begin in March 2021.

Imagine working on rewarding projects within a diverse culture and having access to exceptional training and career development opportunities. Working at AECOM means being part of a global team, working with award-winning professionals across the world. Aspire to be a key player on some of the best projects regionally, with opportunities to work on projects nationally or internationally. Our people bring deep industry knowledge to help you succeed.

About AECOM

At AECOM, we believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it\xe2\x80\x99s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We take on the most complex challenges and pioneer innovative, iconic solutions that push the limits of what\xe2\x80\x99s possible \xe2\x80\x93 the world\xe2\x80\x99s longest cable-stayed bridge, record-breaking sports events, the largest greenfield port development mega project, life-sustaining and disaster recovery programs, and the tallest tower in the Western Hemisphere. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, governments, energy and the environment, we deliver professional services throughout the project lifecycle.

We are proud to be recognized for excellence:
+ Fortune\xe2\x80\x99s World\xe2\x80\x99s Most Admired Companies \xe2\x80\x93 2014-2020

+ \#1 in Transportation and General Building in Engineering-News Record's 2019 \xe2\x80\x9cTop 500 Design Firms\xe2\x80\x9d and #1 2019 \xe2\x80\x9cTop 200 Environmental Firms\xe2\x80\x9d

+ VIQTORY 2020 Military Friendly\xc2\xae Gold Employer

+ Perfect score on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation's Corporate Equality Index for 2017-2019

About DCSA\xe2\x80\x94Environment

With world class technical expertise, leading edge technology and innovative project delivery capability around the world, AECOM\xe2\x80\x99s global environmental practice helps industry and government meet their business goals \xe2\x80\x93 to achieve compliance, reduce or eliminate risks and manage impacts. We provide advisory and technical services to help clients cleanup and close contaminated sites and surplus operational facilities and restore them for reuse, plan and permit new facilities, address critical climate change issues, restore habitats and water quality, protect natural and cultural resources, maintain compliance, and cost effectively manage residuals and wastes.

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

+ Assist with field work (e.g., groundwater and soil sampling, remediation system operations, site inspections);

+ Collect and enter data, and apply technical principles and theories to assist in interpreting and analyzing data;

+ Assist in preparing calculations, evaluations, and visual presentations;

+ Compare investigation findings to relevant studies and provincial/federal regulations to assess compliance, draft reports documenting results and presenting findings; and

+ Miscellaneous assignments on an as-needed basis.

Minimum Requirements

+ Currently in pursuit of a Bachelor's Degree in Environmental Science, Environmental Engineering, or related field

+ Due to the nature of this work, U.S. citizenship is required

+ Valid Driver's License

Preferred Qualifications

+ Verbal/written communication skills for project communication and reporting

+ Previous internship experience in related field a plus

+ Capable of using spreadsheet, word processing and standard office software

+ GIS and/or CAD experience

What We Offer

When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is pioneering the future. Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions inclusion, diversity and overall employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only delivering a better world, but working to \xe2\x80\x9cmake amazing happen\xe2\x80\x9d in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person\xe2\x80\x99s potential, and we\xe2\x80\x99ll help you reach yours."

Title: b'Production Engineer Intern/Co-Op'
Summary: b'Intent to return to full-time degree program after completion of the internship.\nProduction Engineers (PEs) at Facebook are a hybrid between software and\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"Production Engineers (PEs) at Facebook are a hybrid between software and systems engineers and are core to every significant engineering effort that keeps Facebook running smoothly and scaling efficiently. PEs work within Facebook's product and infrastructure teams to make sure our products and services are reliable and scalable. This means writing code and debugging hard problems in live production that impacts over 2 billion people around the world. Our PEs are embedded in teams that work on products like Instagram, WhatsApp, Oculus and Videos to backend services like Storage, Cache and Network. Our team is comprised of varying levels of experience and backgrounds, from university grads to industry veterans. Relevant industry experience is important, but ultimately less so than your demonstrated abilities and attitude. Partnered alongside the best engineers in the industry on the coolest stuff around, the code and systems you work on will be in production and used by millions of users all around the world. We sail into uncharted waters every day at Facebook in Production Engineering.
Own back-end services like our Hadoop data warehouses, front-end services like Chat and Newsfeed, infrastructure components like our Memcached infrastructure, and everything in between
Write and review code, develop documentation, and debug the hardest problems, live, on some of the largest and most complex systems in the world
Experience in *nix (Linux, BSDs, or another UNIX-like OS)
Experience coding in at least one language
1 or more years with new development languages (Python, PHP, C++, and Java)
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Understanding of TCP/IP networking fundamentals
Knowledge of internet service architectures (such as load balancing, LAMP, CDN's
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a BS/MS degree in CS, Engineering, or a related technical discipline
Intent to return to full-time degree program after completion of the internship
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com."

Title: b'Internship Opportunities for Students - Software Engineer'
Summary: b'Some experience building software outside of the classroom environment like an internship, hackathon, research project or related experience preferred.'
Details:
b"Software engineers at Microsoft are passionate about building technologies that make the world a better place. At Microsoft, you will collaborate with others to solve problems and build some of the world's most advanced services and devices. Your efforts on the design, development, and testing of next-generation applications will have an impact on millions of people.

Do you want to work on a meaningful and impactful project and make a difference?
Are you willing to learn from others and open to new ideas?
Do you want to support others to succeed and operate in a highly-collaborative and global environment?
If this sounds like you, Microsoft would like to invite you to come join us as you are, where you can find more than just a job.
Read on to learn more about opportunities and apply online.

Applications to these opportunities are considered for all available Software Engineering intern roles including the ones described below, depending on education level and/or location. To be considered for an internship, you need to be enrolled full-time as a student majoring in an applicable field.

Software Engineer
Software engineers (SWEs) collaborate with a committed team to design, develop and test the next generation of technology solutions for millions of people.
Responsibilities
Software Engineer
Software engineers (SWEs) work with teammates to solve problems and build innovative software solutions. You are passionate about customers and product quality, and you provide technical guidance to Program Managers as they consider user needs and product requirements. You will also be expected to demonstrate an ability to learn and adopt relevant new technologies, tools, methods and processes to leverage in your solutions.
As a SWE, you are dedicated to building software to empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more.

Qualifications
Software Engineer
Currently pursuing bachelor's, master's, or PhD degree in engineering, computer science or related field with at least one semester/quarter remaining after internship.
A year or two of experience programming in C++, Java or other computer programming languages preferred.
Ability to demonstrate understanding of algorithms, data structures and other systems architecture factors that affect code quality, performance and customer experience
Some experience building software outside of the classroom environment like an internship, hackathon, research project or related experience preferred
Demonstrated skill in time management and completing software projects in a cooperative team environment

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work."

Title: b'Internship - Security Operations and Information Security'
Summary: b'Work directly with Managers and Senior Managers.\nAssisting with developing and implementing cloud application and security baselines.'
Details:
b"Company Information
PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR Inc is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of premium light-, medium- and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF nameplates and also provides customized financial services, information technology and truck parts related to its principal business.
Whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services, you can develop the career you desire with PACCAR. Get started!
Division Information
PACCAR\xe2\x80\x99s Information Technology Division (ITD), located in Renton, WA utilizes cutting-edge technology to provide systems development, consulting, voice and data communications services to the entire Corporation, which has high visibility in the technology sector.

Requisition Summary
PACCAR ITD is searching for talented individuals to join our Summer Internship Program!
Internships include unique learning opportunities:
Learn first-hand from the industry's top professionals
Work directly with Managers and Senior Managers
Develop mentoring relationships
Gain valuable hands on experience

PACCAR is looking for a curious, creative and motivated individual that is passionate about information technology and interested in learning more about information security in a Fortune 500 company. During your internship with PACCAR you\xe2\x80\x99ll have the opportunity to explore new technologies, work with technical teams and lead projects. Our internship program is designed to give you real world experience and develop skills to succeed within the technology and information security industry.
Job Functions / Responsibilities
Projects may include:
Assisting with developing and implementing cloud application and security baselines
Develop data loss prevention policies and governance
Coordinate with enterprise architects to develop and implement cloud security controls
Designing and implementing access control and authentication mechanisms for privilege access management
Contribute to development of an Information Security dashboard
Enhance security documentation
Contribute to the improvement of incident response technology and process
Qualifications
1+ years of college experience, preferably in the IT or Information Security Field
Experience using AWS, and Azure cloud platforms desired
PowerShell and Python scripting is desired
Tableau experience desired
Education
Currently pursuing Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree with a technology, Engineering or Computer Science or related field.
Additional Job Board Information

PACCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability."

Title: b'New Graduate - Product Manager'
Summary: b'A with prior internship, related projects or leadership experience.\nOn your journey, you will make an immediate impact on re-imagining travel by contributing to\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"Do you want to transform how millions of people engage with websites, apps, and bots through Conversational and Voice UI? Do you love creating platforms that deliver world-class experiences? Are you ready to fuel industry change and jump-start your career in Product Management? Expedia Group paves the way for early career talent to go far, fast with accelerated career advancement, unparalleled access to leadership and a culture of exceptional acceptance.
Travel is so much more than simply reaching your destination. On your journey, you will make an immediate impact on re-imagining travel by contributing to the creation of a Virtual Agent Platform. Using AI to continuously improve through network effects, our Virtual Agents automate the most meaningful travel journeys, and scale to serve both customers and suppliers. From building extraordinary user and developer experiences, to being at the forefront of technology by defining our future with a new interaction model there is no shortage of opportunities for technical innovation at Expedia Group \xe2\x80\x93 the sky\xe2\x80\x99s the limit!

Applications to this opportunity are considered for our Seattle, Austin and Chicago offices.

What you will do:
Create product feature visions and guide execution through every stage of the software development life-cycle. Build business cases using competitive analysis, market and customer research
Partner closely with engineering, UX, and business teams to deliver solutions that satisfy customer experience, business, and technology goals
Build features as part of our scalable architecture allowing other teams to enable conversation features while maintaining overall conversation quality
Define a set of success metrics to measure customer satisfaction and business impact and be able to utilize them in decision-making

You\xe2\x80\x99ve Applied, Now What?
We will review your application and if you are considered a fit, we will invite you to take an online assessment. Those who pass the assessment will be invited for a final interview.
New Grad Start Dates: To ensure a consistent experience, we offer a limited number of start dates. These dates accommodate varying school\xe2\x80\x99s schedules.
Group 1: June 28, 2021
Group 2: August 23, 2021

Who you are:
You are a creative product manager who will define and drive product development while building features into scalable architecture. You have experience delivering solutions in a fast-paced environment. Your ability to build and manage relationships with is celebrated, and you communicate effectively with everyone. You focus on design experiences that our customers love. You have a bias toward action and can break down problems into steps that drive product development at high speed. You are passionate about delivering differentiated experiences that put customers first.
Pursuing a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s or master\xe2\x80\x99s degree in:
Computer Science
Computer Engineering
Human Computer Interaction
User Experience
Product Management
Graduating in December 2020 or Spring 2021
3.5 or above minimum cumulative G.P.A with prior internship, related projects or leadership experience
Be a dynamic multi-tasker
You feel comfortable working and partnering with a team and have strong communication skills, which includes a clear and concise message.

Why join us:
Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are a global travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and bring the world within reach \xe2\x80\x93 that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them the tools to do so.
Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.
If you have a hunger to make a difference with one of the most loved brands in the world and to work in the dynamic travel industry, this is the job for you.
Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia\xc2\xae, Hotels.com\xc2\xae, Expedia\xc2\xae Partner Solutions, Egencia\xc2\xae, trivago\xc2\xae, Vrbo\xc2\xae, Orbitz\xc2\xae, Travelocity\xc2\xae, Wotif\xc2\xae, ebookers\xc2\xae, CheapTickets\xc2\xae, Hotwire\xc2\xae, Expedia\xc2\xae Media Solutions, CarRentals.com\xe2\x84\xa2, Expedia Local Expert\xc2\xae, Expedia Cruises\xe2\x84\xa2 and SilverRail Technologies, Inc. For more information, visit www.expediagroup.com.
Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. This employer participates in E-Verify. The employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee's I-9 to confirm work authorization."

Title: b'Business Intelligence Engineer Internship - Summer 2021 (US)'
Summary: b'Amazon internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks with start dates in May and June 2021.\nMaster\xe2\x80\x99s or advanced technical degree.'
Details:
b"Currently enrolled in or will receive a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s or Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in math/statistics/engineering or other equivalent quantitative discipline with a conferral date after September 2021
Experience with data querying or modeling with SQL
Experience with building and maintain basic data artifacts (e.g. ETL, data models, queries)
Experience with one or more industry analytics visualization tools (e.g. Excel, Tableau, QuickSight, MicroStrategy, PowerBI) and statistical methods (e.g. t-test, Chi-squared)
Experience with scripting language (e.g., Python, Java, or R)

Do you enjoy solving complex problems and troubleshooting products? Are you passionate about developing test strategies, finding, and tracking bugs to resolution, and innovating on behalf of customers? Do you want to be a part of a fast-paced, ambiguous environment and contribute to one of the most visited sites on the Internet?

If this describes you, consider joining us as an intern in the summer of 2021. Amazon is looking for a business intelligence engineer intern to join one of our many lines of business. Amazon interns have the opportunity to work alongside the industry\xe2\x80\x99s brightest engineers who innovate everyday on behalf of our customers. You will be matched to a manager and a mentor. You will have the opportunity to impact the evolution of Amazon technology as well as lead mission-critical projects early in your career. Your work will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the company.

In addition to working on an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in fun activities with other interns throughout the summer. No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your summer and learn in a real world setting.

Come chart your own path at Amazon.

Note: By applying to this position, your application will be considered for all locations we hire for in the United States including but not limited to: Seattle/Bellevue, WA; Nashville, TN; Austin, TX; Greater Bay Area, CA; DC Metro Area; Denver, CO; Detroit, MI; Greater Boston Area, MA; Greater Denver Area, CO; Greater Los Angeles Area, CA; Greater New York Area; Irvine, CA; Madison, WI; Minneapolis, MN; Phoenix, AZ; Portland, OR; San Diego, CA.

Amazon internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks with start dates in May and June 2021. Applicants should have at a minimum one quarter/semester remaining after their internship concludes.

Responsibilities:As a business intelligence engineer intern, you will/may:

Build small- to mid-size business intelligence (BI) solutions \xe2\x80\x93 data sets, queries, reports, dashboards, analyses \xe2\x80\x93 or components of larger solutions to answer business questions with data
Use well-defined requirements to build a solution that enables effective, data-driven business decisions. Deliver end product on schedule
Create and populate data structures using one or more schema definition languages (e.g. DDL, SDL, XSD, RDF)
Write secure, stable, testable, and maintainable code with minimal defects, and automate manual processes where possible
Use one or more industry analytics visualization tools (e.g. Excel, Tableau, QuickSight, MicroStrategy, PowerBI) and, as needed, statistical methods (e.g. t-test, Chi-squared) to deliver actionable insights to stakeholders
Invent, refine, and develop BI solutions to ensure they meet the needs of the business and team goals
Troubleshoot data, analyses, and code, research root causes, propose solutions, and take ownership in next steps for their resolutions
Master\xe2\x80\x99s or advanced technical degree
Knowledge of data modeling and data pipeline design
Application of basic statistical methods (e.g. regression) for difficult business problems
Knowledge of how to improve code quality and optimizes BI processes (e.g. speed, cost, reliability)
Ability to deal with ambiguity in a fast-paced environment
Excellent verbal/written communication skills and data presentation skills

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

The pay range for this position in Colorado is $36.70/hr. Fulltime interns working longer than 90 days will be eligible for access to a medical benefit, and can enroll in a 401k on Day 1 if age 18. Interns will also have access to paid time off. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Amazon's internal or external careers site."

Title: b'2021-01-14 Paid Internship - Entry Level Network PC Tech Tec...'
Summary: b'The position being posted will require the employee to be present at our office M-F and perform occasional work at various customers sites - we are "Essential\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details: b'COVID-19 STUFF: The position being posted will require the employee to be present at our office M-F and perform occasional work at various customers sites - we are "Essential Workers".Yes, we are hiring.Yes, we are conducting in-person interviews.Please address any concerns in your cover letter.ABOUT THE COMPANY: Founded in 2001, our firm provides cradle to grave I.T. support for small businesses with high reliability computing needs. We are seeking to find techs that possess Windows-based Domain and Networking skills.THIS INTERNSHIP/APPRENTICESHIP: This opportunity is aimed at an Entry-Level, tech-savvy individual that wants to get their foot in the door of a well-established small IT firm. UTS is a great place to apply your existing skills, learn and gain experience working with business networks, Active Directory, visualization, security, firewalling, VLAN\'s, VPN\'s, Group Policies, and end user support are what we work with all day. We are a full-spectrum IT firm for our clients handling virtually all issues with anything that has a power button. We are also small enough where jobs are not compartmentalized to a degree where the junior techs never get exposure to server-level technologies. We are all about internal cross-training our staff to help them grow in their aptitude and prefer to promote from within. This position can and will advance as fast as the employee demonstrates the necessary skills.WHAT WE DO: We build, manage and support small-ish (ranging from 5-250 node) windows domain-based networks for local small business clients; many of whom are in the medical/dental industry. Building PCs, taking client calls, doing remote tech support, running out to the client\'s location when necessary, troubleshooting hardware, networking and software issues are the routine.JOB DUTIES: - Answer client phone calls and email.- Occasional (we do about 80% of our work from within our Burien office) travel to customer location to perform on-site work.- Document work in our Helpdesk system.- Assemble PCs.- Provide remote and on-site business client support - user training, problem-solving and workarounds.- Installations & deployments of PCs, cabling and network gear.- Assist co-workers on larger projects.- Working with, engaging and coordinating 3rd party vendors (telecom companies, software vendors, etc.)- Helping out with other small business tasks like keeping the office tidy, picking up office supplies, etc.- Maintain a positive demeanor throughout.NON-TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS: - Higher preference given to applicants that reside within a 10mi/15min distance of our Burien office.- Good at working with customer face-to-face and phone in a positive and friendly manner.- Professional appearance.- Some onsite travel - you must own a presentable vehicle.- You must be completely smoke-free. We work in highly sensitive medical environments. Smoke odor is completely unacceptable here.MINIMAL REQUIRED SKILLS: - Speak, read and write clear English.- Experience with PC Assembly.- Loading and upgrading Operating Systems.- Great attitude, high energy and desire to learn.Additional Desired Skills: - Troubleshooting hardware/driver problems.- Hunting down drivers and troubleshooting driver issues. (Actual hunting experience not required)- Understanding of basic TCP/IP to a sufficient degree necessary to put workstations on the server\'s domain.- Experience with MSOffice applications.- Experience with cleaning viruses/malware from PCs.- Working with 3rd party software support technicians to jointly troubleshoot a problem.HOURS: We are here from 7:30am to 6pm M-F; your shift will fit somewhere in there.WHY WORK HERE: We\'ve been around for almost 19 years and have retained many of our early clients. The owner is a tech (not a sales guy or accountant) who came up through the ranks, and knows first hand what technical work is all about. The company is well-organized with procedures, knowledge base and an awesome in-house helpdesk system. We foster mentorship from within - there is no silo-ing of knowledge or information. Nearly all of our long-term senior techs, entered the company as interns. Additionally, we work exclusively with other businesses - we do not service home users.About 3 years ago we purposely moved our office from Seattle, to Burien. Burien provides for a better commute, free parking, much lower cost of living, great highway access and a vibrant downtown with many lunch or after-work happy hour options.The biggest benefit is a good work environment. In a small and rapidly growing company you have the opportunity to do and learn a wide variety of tasks, learn many different systems, configurations and work on a very diverse set of problems. There is also opportunity to grow -- there are not 8 levels of management between you and your wonderful ideas on how to do things better, or how you could be better utilized within the firm.You will be provided with a desk, a chair and office computer. Maybe a phone. A window from which squirrel sightings might take place, may or may not be available. If you require a red Swingline stapler, please bring your own.COMPENSATION: $15+/h; with aim towards promotion to a Desktop Technician making $40k+yr; Lead Techs make $70k+/yrTO APPLY: - Send resume.- Please include a cover letter that demonstrated that you\'ve actually read the job description. Tell us why you want to work here and how you fit the criteria above.- Letters of reference are a plus.Job Type: Full-timePay: From $2,600.00 per monthBenefits:Paid time offSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payExperience:Troubleshooting: 1 year (Preferred)Windows: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:One locationCompany\'s website:www.utspro.comCompany\'s Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/SeattleUTSWork Remotely:No'

Title: b'Core Platform DevOps Software Engineer Intern'
Summary: b'Onboarding teams to Continuous Delivery tooling.\nAs part of modern software delivery practices, Dev teams are increasingly leveraging automation for delivery of\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'REI is looking for a Core Platform DevOps Software Engineering Intern to contribute to REI\xe2\x80\x99s success by helping automate our AWS foundational Cloud practice, build out CICD pipelines for DevTeams and help in our new API Management platform where we are creating a common platform to help connect in more real time with our customers.
Throughout the course of your internship experience, you will work alongside a supportive team that will help you elevate and grow in a fun, high-energy environment. We view the intern role as an equal opportunity to learn from the intern we will bring on. We know you will have great ideas and we want to give you a platform to share and apply those ideas.

Under the supervision of your Manager and an Engineering lead in the team, you will gain insights into the key functions of your team as it relates to REI\xe2\x80\x99s broader strategy and vision.

Examples of our Intern projects may include:
AWS Cloud automation and tuning:
We will ramp you into the exciting world of AWS. We will also provide you insight into the industry leading tooling we use to help protect REI services in AWS. This project would be to help us inject automated remediation steps for sub-standard CloudSec practices.. This would also include scripting alerting for certain Security conditions.
Onboarding teams to Continuous Delivery tooling
As part of modern software delivery practices, Dev teams are increasingly leveraging automation for delivery of their code and binaries. We will give you an opportunity to onboard a team(s) to our Continuous Delivery (CD) platform.. This will give you great immersion into pipeline triggers, test automation, infrastructure pipelines and much more.
API Management
We are building out one of the industry leading API Management platforms (Apigee) for use within REI.. The value this brings is tremendous as it offers the ability for our mobile and 3rd party apps to gain access via RestAPI endpoints to our key data. These APIs are used to then trigger real time marketing engagements to our customers. In this project you will support the needs of the Apigee platform build out, inclusive of CICD tooling, Developer Portal build out and test automation practices.

REI Introduction and Exposure to:
Seattle Area
Challenging and relevant project assignments
DevOps
Leadership team members
Cross-divisional intern activities
Mentorship

Bring your passion and expertise
Job functions include:
Coding and a passion for automating \xe2\x80\x98all the things\xe2\x80\x99
Analysis of opportunity from cost, service and capacity perspectives
Recommendation for changes, if applicable
Quantify impact of opportunities
Qualifications and expectations:
Currently majoring in CS or CSE undergrad
Coursework completed in some or all of the following areas: JavaScript, Python, Building in Cloud (AWS)
Candidates should have a strong aptitude in analytics and problem solving.

#LI-JM1'

Title: b'Industrial Design Intern'
Summary: b'Fluke is looking for a student pursuing a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Industrial Design to join our current team for a 12-week internship.'
Details:
b'Fluke is looking for a student pursuing a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Industrial Design to join our current team for a 12-week internship. Partnering with a diverse group of end-users, engineers, and other stakeholders, you will help develop the function and form of product enclosures for complex and highly technical products and workflows. You will participate in all aspects of our product development process.

Primary Activities:

Conceive and develop new, innovative Fluke tools that will transform the way our customers work
Support Voice of Customer research and document user needs, opportunities, and workflows
Support a project\xe2\x80\x99s design development process through sketching, model building, applying materials, CAD development, and recommending fabrication and assembly processes
Participate in design reviews
Present proposed product concepts for review and buy-in from engineering, marketing, and other stakeholders as required

Fluke promises all interns a meaningful work environment that is committed to the development of you as an industrial designer. This means:


You will be given a direct supervisor who will provide mentoring.
You will be given a project that is tailored to the existing needs of Fluke and your interests*
You will expand your professional network via your daily work and several other organized events, including a report-out at the end of your internship open to all employees.
With current Covid-19 restrictions, this is planned to be a remote position.
Given that each project is designed with the selected intern's interests in mind, specific projects are detailed out after hire

Please note that you are currently applying for a \xe2\x80\x9cpool\xe2\x80\x9d position. This requisition is used as a funnel for all industrial design intern positions we intend to hire for. As such, this position is relatively vague and inclusive of all types of industrial design intern duties one may have.

Candidate Qualifications


Current or recent student majoring in Industrial Design or related field.
Must be rising junior or senior in college, Master's student or recent grad. All eligible undergraduate students must be graduating no later than Spring 2023
Strong attention to detail and organization
Must be a team-player who is willing to receive and professionally give feedback

Portfolio Requirement:
Candidates must submit a portfolio demonstrating their design process, skills, and other examples of work that exemplify the above requirements. Please upload a PDF no larger than 2.4 MB or provide a link to your work for review.

Fortive is a diversified industrial growth company comprised of global businesses that are recognized leaders in attractive markets. With more than $6 billion in annual revenues, Fortive\xe2\x80\x99s well-known brands hold leading positions in field instrumentation, transportation, sensing, product realization, automation and specialty, and franchise distribution.

Fortive is headquartered in Everett, Washington and employs a team of more than 24,000 research and development, manufacturing, sales, distribution, service and administrative employees in more than 40 countries around the world. Our team grows by tackling challenges that accelerate progress and further their careers. With a culture rooted in continuous improvement, the core of our company\xe2\x80\x99s operating model is the Fortive Business System. For more information please visit: www.fortive.com.

Fluke is leading the world in creating software, test tools and technology that will support customers today and in the future. We are a customer-obsessed market leader with a strong reputation for reliability, quality and safety.

A wholly owned subsidiary of Fortive Corporation (www.fortive.com), Fluke is a global corporation headquartered in the greater Seattle area. Driven by the successful Fortive Business System, Fluke offers the passion of a startup with the resources of a Fortune 500 company. We are focused on the growth of our individual employees, teams and the Fluke brand.

Title: b'Systems Engineering Intern'
Summary: b'The Systems Engineering intern will support the Systems Engineering department by researching and developing tools for better understanding maintenance data to\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"GENERAL PURPOSE: Sound Transit has an exciting virtual paid internship available for the summer of 2021! This is a great opportunity for currently enrolled undergraduate or graduate students who want to observe and participate in real world application of their current field of study. This opportunity will allow the intern to gain valuable experience within the Systems Engineering and Integration division under our Portfolio Services Office department.

The Systems Engineering intern will support the Systems Engineering department by researching and developing tools for better understanding maintenance data to inform engineering designs and decisions.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

The following duties ARE NOT intended to serve as a comprehensive list of all duties performed by all employees in this classification, only a representative summary of the primary duties and responsibilities. Incumbent(s) may not be required to perform all duties listed and may be required to perform additional, position-specific duties.

An undergraduate student entering their junior or senior year with the following:

Familiarity with data science and analysis tools.


Potential Projects:

Work with train control systems engineers to develop a tool that examines maintenance data for critical failures, categorizes data, and make recommendations for design changes for re-occurring failures.
Work with communications and SCADA systems engineers to analyze IOT data to develop monitoring metrics and data visualization tools for failure mode predication and analysis.
Work with construction management teams to develop a tool that examines construction data, categorizes, trends, develops metrics and provides a visualization tool that can be used for design improvements


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Applicants must be a current college student in good academic standing, enrolled in an accredited associate, Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s or Master's degree program in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering, or a graduate degree in Computer Science.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS/ WORK ENVIRONMENT:

Work is performed remotely, ST offices are closed temporarily.
Subject to standing, walking, bending, reaching, stooping, and lifting of objects up to 25 pounds; may occasionally be exposed to dangerous machinery when visiting job sites during construction and when working in the field.
The Agency promotes a safe and healthy work environment and provides appropriate safety and equipment training for all personnel as required.


Sound Transit is an equal employment opportunity employer. No person is unlawfully excluded from employment action based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation and pregnancy), age, genetic information, disability, veteran status or other protected class."

Title: b'2021 RF Field Engineering Internship (West Region)'
Summary: b'Recruiting for the 2021 internship program takes place from September 2020 through March 2021.\nYou\xe2\x80\x99re encouraged to be an Intern at T-Mobile.'
Details:
b'Are you ready for a challenge that could launch your career? T-Mobile is revolutionizing the wireless industry for millions of customers nationwide. Working here means rolling up your sleeves and redefining the status quo with a team that has your back every step of the way.
You\xe2\x80\x99re encouraged to be an Intern at T-Mobile.
This is a 12-week paid learning experience with the Network Performance and Optimization team to supervise important metrics and to work with engineers to resolve the best course of action needed to impact the network for our customers. You will be pulling daily important metric trends to analyze the data with the other specialists. You will also participate in the daily performance calls and eventually own the call as your experience increases.
What you'll do in your role
Working as an Intern with the RF Engineering Team, you will get experience and exposure to many of the following daily responsibilities:
Pull important metric trends and watching the OneScore for the KPIs
Design and Optimize the UMTS, LTE and & 5G network for enhanced customer experience
Work with engineers to analyze data and course of action to take with a hands-on approach to solutions
Collaborate with Sales and care team to support the growth and retention
Site solution visits along with field tech
Parameter checking & live monitoring (direct access into sites as your experience expands)
Trouble Ticket and Work Order Generation
You\xe2\x80\x99ll contribute your creativity and phenomenal ideas, working alongside innovative colleagues and mentors who will push you to be your very best. We\xe2\x80\x99ll give you hands-on projects and the chance to create an immediate impact.
The experience you'll bring
You\xe2\x80\x99re currently enrolled in college and pursuing a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree with an Electrical Engineering or Computer Science path. Aside from your degree path, we are looking for the following skills:
Excellent verbal and written communication
Academic experience coding with Python and/or SQL
Strong Data analysis & Excel skills
Well-organized and able to prioritize and manage time in a fast-paced environment
Self-starter with a passion for learning who is not afraid to ask questions.
Able to understand and analyze data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement
Data visualization: able to incorporate visual elements to efficiently convey a message
Able to work both independently and in a collaborative team environment to achieve goals
Being an Intern
Our Internship Program takes place over the summer running 12 weeks from May to September. As an Intern, you\xe2\x80\x99ll receive competitive pay, relocation benefits, an outstanding experience, and the support of a team that believes in your potential. You\xe2\x80\x99ll also have plenty of opportunities to meet and network with other interns, fellow team members, and top leaders from all business functions across the company as you make connections that will last your career. Want to learn more?

A big part of our culture is about embracing our Magenta spirit. And we\xe2\x80\x99ll ask you to do the same. Check out #BeMagenta to see how we work together to take care of our customers and each other every day.

Recruiting Timeline
Recruiting for the 2021 internship program takes place from September 2020 through March 2021. We\xe2\x80\x99ll be virtually visiting campuses across the country and virtually attending national recruiting conferences in September through November. We\xe2\x80\x99ll be connecting with candidates and begin screening in January. If we believe you\xe2\x80\x99re a good fit for one of our roles, we\xe2\x80\x99ll contact you directly to discuss next steps. Interviews will start to take place in late January and all internships will be filled by the end of March.

Application Process
Select the job category that best matches your interests, education and experience and click apply. We\xe2\x80\x99ll then review your application. If we believe you\xe2\x80\x99re a good fit for one of our roles, we\xe2\x80\x99ll contact you directly to discuss next steps.
As America\xe2\x80\x99s Un-carrier, T-Mobile USA, Inc. (NASDAQ: \xe2\x80\x9cTMUS\xe2\x80\x9d) is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. The company\xe2\x80\x99s advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile USA. Inc. provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile and Metro by T-Mobile. For more information, please visit http://www.t-mobile.com

Applicant Privacy Policy

We are committed to maintaining your trust by respecting and protecting your privacy. For more information about how T-Mobile processes the personal data of job applicants, please visit Applicant Privacy Policy.
Equal Employment Opportunity

We take equal opportunity seriously\xe2\x80\x94by choice.

T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, religious affiliation, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination, retaliation or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with how we do business and will not be tolerated."
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States
High School Diploma or GED'

Title: b'Specialty Lending Intern'
Summary: b'The Specialty Lending intern will have exposure to and responsibility for providing assistance and support to the Specialty Lending team by performing analysis\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'POSITION SUMMARY:
Columbia Bank is proud to offer internship opportunities to college students looking to pursue a career in banking. Our internship programs provide real world work experience and place the highest priority on relationship-based customer service, while striving to make meaningful contributions to each of the communities we serve.
Columbia Bank\xe2\x80\x99s Specialty Lending Group is a small team of seasoned commercial lenders with expertise in specialized industries and credits including media/communications, transportation, and mezzanine (subordinated) debt. The Specialty Lending Group is also responsible for the Bank\xe2\x80\x99s Syndication and Agency Management function, whereby Columbia Bank acts as the agent and/or participant bank in multi-bank deals.
The Specialty Lending intern will have exposure to and responsibility for providing assistance and support to the Specialty Lending team by performing analysis on financial statements. Interns will also gain valuable experience in relationship management, syndication/agency management, and customer interaction through assisting our team in the day-to-day management of complex commercial relationships.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Credit & Financial Analysis:
Researches client banking relationships and credit history
Analyzes financial trends (income statements, cash flow, etc.)
Appropriately analyzes collateral values
Determines strengths and weaknesses of the credit
Conducts pricing model to establish profitability
Conducts industry research based on various borrowing entities
Reviews and maintains commercial credit files for completeness, including: reviewing loan documentation packages, ordering and reviewing credit reports, reviewing preliminary title reports, appraisals, environmental reports, etc.
Ensures all files include current financial statements, agency reports, etc.
Maintains a current knowledge of banking/financial terminology and regulations
Participates in training opportunities as presented
Agency/Syndication Management:
Provides analytical and administrative support for the Syndicated Loan Portfolio and Agency Management functions, including dissemination of information to participant banks, coordinating credit actions and amendments, facilitating loan funding and booking, and performing credit analysis on syndicated credits.
Assists with the quarterly Syndicated Loan Portfolio data analysis and reporting to Executive Management
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Power Point, etc.)
General understanding of financial accounting and data analysis as it relates to banking
Ability to work independently
Superior interpersonal skills and high level of customer service
Currently enrolled in college or graduate level courses and pursuing a business-related degree, preferably accounting or finance, or recently graduated in 2021
Commit to 10+ weeks of full time work during the summer.
Must provide own living arrangements and transportation
Values and Behaviors:
Build enduring RELATIONSHIPS with clients and each other.
Drive INNOVATION that simplifies life and work.
Seek continuous GROWTH in your personal and professional development.
Commit with HEART to serve others.
Extend TRUST in order to receive it.
Working Environment:
Primarily an office environment requiring significant computer usage.'

Title: b'AWS Sales Internship - Undergraduate'
Summary: b'AWS Sales internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks.\nUpon successful completion of the internship program, interns may receive a full\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'\xc2\xb7 Currently enrolled in a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree program with a graduation conferral date between December 2021 and August 2022.

AWS SALES INTERN
NOTE: By applying to this position, your application will be considered for all locations we hire in the United States including, but not limited to Seattle, WA; Washington DC Metro area; New York City; Chicago, IL; and Atlanta, GA.

Do you want to intern with a specialized sales team focused on increasing adoption of Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud solutions?

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world\xe2\x80\x99s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, offering over 165 fully featured services from data centers globally. Millions of customers\xe2\x80\x94including the fastest-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies\xe2\x80\x94trust AWS to power their infrastructure, become more agile, and lower costs. AWS\xe2\x80\x99 America sales organization is a diverse team that focuses on driving greater AWS adoption and customer value.

We are hiring sales interns to help us increase customer adoption of the AWS cloud platform. As a sales intern, you will collaborate with sales teams to help build new business client leads, enter new client data, and assist with opportunity execution and follow up. As part of your internship, you will attend the AWS sales internship training and immerse yourself in cloud computing, develop business and sales acumen, and learn more about AWS culture. Following training, you will work on your projects, complete the Cloud Practitioner examination, and attend professional development events. Upon successful completion of the internship program, interns may receive a full-time offer to join AWS starting in 2022.

Come build the future with us!

AWS Sales internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks.
