Title: b'University Recruiter- Engineering, Product, & Design'
Summary: b'Act as a key contact for interns throughout their internship and maintain candidate relationships.\nManage full-cycle recruitment processes from sourcing,\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"Splunk: People + Product + Passion
At Splunk, we are tackling complex problems by making machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. Our goal: to provide a game-changing technology to creatively solve today's problems.
Are you seeking to join a high performing, collaborative, and fun-loving team that genuinely cares about your success and personal development? Are you someone who is passionate about technology, people, and diversity? Are you a self-starter ready to take the next step in your career? Then our University Recruiter role is for you!
At Splunk, we\xe2\x80\x99re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly, committed to our employees' success. We have built out our University Recruiting program globally over the last six years and are now hiring interns and new graduates in 14 offices across 8 countries with no plans to stop our momentum any time soon. Joining our University Recruiting team offers you an opportunity to become a part of our incredible journey and make a significant impact on the development of the University Recruiting program.
As a University Recruiter, you will have the opportunity to build a pipeline of diverse, top-quality intern and new graduate candidates to join our ever-growing organization.
Responsibilities
Manage full-cycle recruitment processes from sourcing, screening and hiring high caliber students for a combination of our Engineering, Product, and Design functions.
Develop the recruitment strategy for teams.
Schedule all interviews with candidates.
Collaborate with hiring managers to build and execute customized, full-cycle recruitment strategies to build a pipeline of interns and new graduates
Lead key initiatives and projects with partner groups that will continuously improve and scale our university recruiting operations
Regularly run pipeline activity, maintain data integrity, and proactively share data-centric updates with internal partners
Manage, maintain and develop relationships with faculty, staff, alumni and student organizations on-campus. Implements on-campus recruitment strategy & attends on-campus events.
Act as a key contact for interns throughout their internship and maintain candidate relationships
Minimum Qualification
3+ years of university recruiting experience
Strong communication skills
Incredibly organized
Ability to work cross-functionally
Detail oriented and ability to multi-task
Willingness to work flexible hours
Ability to travel during peak recruiting cycles
Preferred Qualification
Jobvite experience
Workday experience
Please note we welcome those seeking remote opportunities."

Title: b'Remote Human Resources Specialist - Unpaid Internship'
Summary: b'If work the minimum hours (10 hours per week) it will take you 20 weeks to complete your internship.\nConduct the first interview and schedule the second\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'With millions of people currently out of school and work due to the COVID-19 pandemic, now is the perfect time to learn new skills or improve already existing skills! A virtual internship is one of the most helpful things you can do for your career. Beginning your incredible journey to a new career starts now!

Do you want to take part in the opportunity of expanding a business that will make a positive and significant impact on millions of people? Do you want to unleash your hidden talents and work with a unique and diverse team of go-getters like yourself with leadership that leads by example? LOOK NO FURTHER, Super PurposesTM is the place for you!!!


If you are searching for a position with an up-and-coming company that will expose you to more opportunities than you can imagine while working in a relaxed, virtual environment, then you have successfully found the internship of your dreams!


WHO WE ARE:

Our Founder & CEO Super Julie Braun (also known as SJ) created Super Purposes\xe2\x84\xa2 LLC in 2018. The mission of our Company is to help millions of people gain the real-world experience needed to help them reach their career goals. (Our favorite soul sister company is SuperInterns.com.) Because we are experts Edutainment Programs and helping people get the careers they deserve, the experiences we offer are unique in that we respect interns unlike most companies. We aren\xe2\x80\x99t playing in a sandbox. We know that interns (we call them Teammates) aren\xe2\x80\x99t burdens, coffee fetchers, or file cleaners; our Teammates are given high level, impactful, and skill building projects to help us grow while the Teammate grows.


To learn more, go to https://tinyurl.com/JoinSuperP... and meet our Founder SJ and get insight on our wack-a-doodle team, what we are building and how you may help us.

YOU WILL:
Conduct the first interview and schedule the second interview with department Senior.
Seek out and recommend creative new ways of sourcing talent.
Source and recruit candidates using a variety of outlets, such as job postings and social media, while effectively targeting the right candidates for the job.
Develop relationships with colleges and prospective talent.
Review resumes, cover letters, and assess interview performance.
Administer and submit all hiring paperwork for new employees and assist with the orientation process.

Conduct and train new teammates on our on-boarding and recruiting processes.
Be the main point of contact for new teammates.
Update Teammate Bios; create profiles for new Teammates and update profiles for existing Teammates.
Create and distribute the company newsletter.
Handle Employment Verification and Letters of Recommendation.
Process departures.
Attend team and senior meetings as needed.

YOU ARE:
Adaptable to changes in projects and priorities and can handle multiple projects.
Highly motivated, detail-oriented, reliable and organized.
Excellent in verbal and written communication, email etiquette, the Internet, and MS Office.
Able to work independently with minimum supervision and attend video conferencing meetings whenever needed.
Enthusiastic and grateful to have the opportunity to work with us!
Tech savvy and own a computer with reliable access to an Internet connection.
A Super Human Resources Specialist!

YOU WILL BENEFIT BY:
Attaining high-level skills and experience that will help you increase your earning potential, reach your career goals, and find more rewarding jobs.
Receiving mentoring on your LinkedIn Profile (and thus, your resume), interviewing skills, and professional goals, and how to manage your career.
Building your professional portfolio.
Participating in collaboration sessions with our hilarious creative Teammates and team leadership.
Being exposed to the behind-the-scenes of a one-of-a-kind start-up company.
Gaining access to a variety of training materials on sales, marketing, program management, and other topics, worth thousands of dollars.
Receiving a top-notch letter of recommendation and referrals from our Employment Verification team upon the successful completion of your 200 hour internship. In addition, we will gladly help you arrange for academic credit if needed.

LOCATION:

This is a virtual/remote opportunity which means you don\xe2\x80\x99t have to deal with traffic or sitting in a stuffy office! You are able to work in a comfortable environment that provides a reliable and secure internet connection so that you can attend meetings and video conferences.

VIDEO CONFERENCING:

As a virtual company, we use video conferencing application(s) as our primary form of communication. You will be required to have video conferencing program(s) on your laptop or desktop so that you can fully participate in meetings and training sessions. Our team meetings, oneon- one meetings and training sessions often require team members to turn on their video camera, share their screens and interact with other team members.


NOTE: Your cell phone should not be your main source of working on assignments or attending meetings.


TIMING:

Immediately! Our internships are 200 hours. Each intern is required to work 10 hours a week. If work the minimum hours (10 hours per week) it will take you 20 weeks to complete your internship.


COMPENSATION:

This is an unpaid virtual internship, but the experience and connections you will get for your professional portfolio and LinkedIn profile are priceless!'

Title: b'Human Factors Intern (Summer 2021)'
Summary: b'Our current estimate is a (minimum) 4-month engagement to a (maximum) 6-month engagement that would take place between May 2021 and September 2021.'
Details:
b"Battelle\xe2\x80\x99s founding mission \xe2\x80\x9cto translate scientific discovery and technology advances into societal benefit\xe2\x80\x9d is as relevant today as when we opened our doors over 90 years ago. Our science and technology enhance society's well-being and create critical innovations that drive scientific advances for the future. We conduct groundbreaking research and development, design and manufacture leading-edge products, and deliver critical services for commercial and government customers. Our work meets the needs of the nation when it matters most, and Battelle is committed to driving innovation today and for generations to come.

JOB SUMMARY
We are currently seeking a Human Factors Intern. This position is located in Seattle, Washington. The exact length and timing of the internship is negotiable. Our current estimate is a (minimum) 4-month engagement to a (maximum) 6-month engagement that would take place between May 2021 and September 2021.

Battelle\xe2\x80\x99s human factors staff in Seattle, WA provide a human-centered approach to the development and evaluation of programs, systems, and products. The human factors researchers at Battelle combine human factors tools and techniques with behavioral science, computer science, and engineering expertise to address the needs and requirements of users, operators, and maintainers. Clients include both government and industry organizations in the transportation, energy, and national security domains. Human Factors Interns work with our technical staff to conduct human factors research and are provided direction, support, and supervision from project managers and more senior technical staff. Primary activities include literature searches and reviews, field data collection and analysis, laboratory data collection and analysis, and execution of human factors analyses

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
Perform assigned technical tasks and activities, in a timely manner as requested
Prepare and present oral briefings to colleagues and other professionals
Contribute to project development and client relationship activities as directed
Improve performance in technical activities through job training and outside study
This position reports to the Transportation Business Line (TBL) Manager and is provided day-to-day work direction by various technical staff and project managers
THE FOLLOWING IS REQUIRED
Currently enrolled in a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s, master\xe2\x80\x99s or PhD program in Psychology, Industrial Engineering, or a degree related to human factors
Minimum 3.0 GPA
Must be a junior standing or higher
Experience conducting behavioral research and standard social science analyses, such as literature searches and reviews
Demonstrated experience in applying human factors techniques (coursework projects are acceptable)
Proven ability to perform statistical analysis using standard social sciences statistical packages (SAS, R, etc.)
Demonstrated writing communication skills and capable of writing technical reports and publications
THE FOLLOWING IS DESIRED
Graduate students preferred
Local students preferred. This position will not offer a housing stipend.
Experience conducting human factors research within safety-critical systems (i.e., forward collision warning devices, speed warning devices, pedestrian detection systems, or adaptive cruise control)

LEGAL DISCLAIMER
The above statements are intended to describe the nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, activities and skills required of staff members. No statement herein is intended to imply any authorities to commit Battelle unless special written permission is granted by Battelle's Legal Department.

BENEFITS
Battelle is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and supports diversity in the workplace. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, genetic information, disability, veteran-status, or any other characteristic protected under applicable Federal, state, or local law. For more information about our other openings, please visit www.battelle.org/careers"

Title: b'Research Internship, AllenNLP'
Summary: b'Invitation to return to AI2 for another internship.\nPhD, Masters and Undergraduate students in computer science are invited to apply for an internship on the\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"Research Internship, AllenNLP

Who You Are:

AI2's AllenNLP team seeks a creative, early career Intern who has a strong interest in natural language processing.

The AllenNLP team collaborates frequently with researchers on AI2's other teams focused on commonsense reasoning and the Semantic Scholar engine, among others. Our main office has unique access to researchers at the University of Washington, only 1.5 miles away; our California team works on the campus of UC Irvine. Researchers excited about such internal and external collaborations are encouraged to apply.

 At AI2, you will be working with world-class AI researchers and talented software engineers. We perform team-based, ambitious research, with a mandate to strive for big breakthroughs, not just incremental progress, in an exciting and interactive workplace.

Please apply by October 15, 2020 for summer 2021 and January 15, 2021 for autumn 2021

Your Next Challenge:

PhD, Masters and Undergraduate students in computer science are invited to apply for an internship on the AllenNLP team year-round. Applicants should have an interest in natural language processing, machine learning, knowledge representation, semantics, question answering, textual entailment, or computer vision. All interns are paired with an AllenNLP mentor and participate in AI2's groundbreaking work. There are no restrictions on publications based on internships. Pay is competitive, and visa sponsorship is available.

To see more about our current, future, and past interns, check out our internship page on our website!

AI2 Intern of the Year Opportunity:

AI2 offers an Intern of the Year Award that will recognize a research intern who has performed outstanding research that will lead to a high-quality paper aligned with one of AI2's projects. This winning intern will receive:

$10,000 cash prize (applicable to tax)
Invitation to return to AI2 for another internship
Potential future employment opportunity at AI2
External announcement of their award
Why AI2:

In addition to AI2's core mission, we also aim to contribute to humanity through our treatment of each member of the AI2 Team. Some highlights are:

We are a learning organization \xe2\x80\x94 because everything AI2 does is ground-breaking, we are learning every day. Similarly, through weekly AI2 Academy lectures, a wide variety of world-class AI experts as guest speakers, and our commitment to your personal on-going education, AI2 is place where you will have opportunities to continue learning alongside your coworkers.
We value diversity \xe2\x80\x94 We seek to hire, support, and promote people from all genders, ethnicities, and all levels of experience regardless of age. We particularly encourage applications from women, non-binary individuals, people of color, members of the LGBTQA+ community, and people with disabilities of any kind.
We value inclusion \xe2\x80\x94 We understand the value that people's individual experiences and perspectives can bring to an organization, and we are building a culture in which all voices are heard, respected and considered.
We emphasize a healthy work/life balance \xe2\x80\x94 we believe our team members are happiest and most productive when their work/life balance is optimized. While we value powerful research results which drive our mission forward, we also value dinner with family, weekend time, and vacation time. We offer generous paid vacation and sick leave as well as family leave.
We are collaborative and transparent \xe2\x80\x94 we consider ourselves a team, all moving with a common purpose. We are quick to cheer our successes, and even quicker to share and jointly problem solve our failures.
We are in Seattle \xe2\x80\x94 and our office is on the water! We have mountains, we have lakes, we have four seasons, we bike to work, we have a vibrant theater scene, and we have so much else. We even have kayaks for you to paddle right outside our front door. We welcome interest from applicants from outside of the United States.
We are friendly \xe2\x80\x94 chances are you will like every one of the 100+ (and growing) people who work here. We do.

AI2 is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics."

Title: b'Research Associate, Primary'
Summary: b'In this role you will join one of our data-set teams with an initial focus on mastering our data management tool and direct outreach processes.'
Details:
b'At PitchBook we work to provide global professionals with comprehensive data on the entire venture capital, private equity and M&A landscape so they can discover and execute opportunities with confidence. We credit our success and rapid growth to our cutting-edge products, customer centered attitude and ability to embrace and drive change.

In just over a decade, PitchBook has reached over 1,300 global employees with offices worldwide, and we\xe2\x80\x99re not slowing down! Consistently recognized as a Best Place to Work, our culture is at the heart of our success and is driven by excellence, inclusion and fun. At PitchBook we\xe2\x80\x99re committed to fostering an open and collaborative work environment.

About the Role:

Nearly everyone in Research starts as a Research Associate. In this role you will join one of our data-set teams with an initial focus on mastering our data management tool and direct outreach processes. Once mastered, you will create outbound campaigns using email and/or phone calls to gather and update data in our platform. The focus will be on primary research, which is the collection of proprietary data obtained from contacts at investment and advisory firms involved in PE and VC deals, or the companies being funded with private capital. This learning process and growth of industry knowledge creates a pathway for our Primary Research Associates to grow into Senior Research Associates and Team Leads within Research or a variety of roles on other teams at PitchBook.
Primary Job Responsibilities:

Building relationships with industry professionals at private equity and venture capital backed companies, service providers or private investment firms
Managing email and/or call campaigns with the goal of gathering and verifying private markets data
Working with marketing, editorial and customer success teams to tailor email messaging, meet reporting deadlines and better understand client use cases
Leveraging technology-based tools to ensure that proprietary data is added to the PitchBook Platform efficiently and with the utmost quality
Working with team to develop and improve processes, tools and methodologies
Taking on projects to identify opportunities to improve upon the core quality metrics (comprehensiveness, accuracy, timeliness)
Becoming an expert in PitchBook\xe2\x80\x99s core research areas of private equity, venture capital and M&A through dedicated training
Skills and Qualifications:

Communication skills, both verbal and in written materials, targeting an audience all the way up to the executive level
A strong sense of urgency, as well as comfort making a high volume of outbound calls on a daily basis
The ability to work both independently and as part of a team
Strong organization methods and top-notch multi-tasking skills
Incessant curiosity, innovative thinking and meticulous work habits
A background or interest in the private equity, venture capital and M&A industries
1 \xe2\x80\x93 2 years professional experience, which might be in the form of an internship
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree required
If you are ready to start the conversation about how you might contribute to all the happenings at PitchBook, submit your resume today! PitchBook appreciates and respects diversity, and as such, we are an equal opportunity employer.

#LI-JH1'

Title: b'Intern'
Summary: b'During this paid internship you will discover how sales management software can make your job more efficient, learn how to generate leads and navigate a sales\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'About the Company
Come work for one of the fastest growing office automation companies in the Pacific Northwest! We provide our clients with copiers, printers, and solutions to help grow their business. We have been in business for 30+ years and have a diverse team of leaders with decades of experience. We embrace the \xe2\x80\x9cwork hard, play hard\xe2\x80\x9d mentality. CNW is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

About the Position
During this paid internship you will discover how sales management software can make your job more efficient, learn how to generate leads and navigate a sales cycle, receive mentoring from seasoned sales professionals. This position also is eligible for commissions.

Essential Duties

Assist account managers in prospecting and networking, in-person and virtual calls as available
Learn what it takes to find new business, reach decision makers, establish and maintain long term business partnerships'

Title: b'SENIOR CAREER COACH'
Summary: b'The Career Coach provides innovative career development services and activities for Foster business students.\nDevelops and conducts career preparation workshops\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Notes: As a UW employee, you will enjoy generous benefits and work/life programs. For detailed information on Benefits for this position, click here.


The University of Washington is following physical distancing directives from state and local governments as part of the collective effort to combat the spread of COVID-19. Click HERE for updates.


Work is ordinarily performed in an office environment but may be performed remotely depending on health and safety requirements under the COVID-19 pandemic.


As a UW employee, you have a unique opportunity to change lives on our campuses, in our state and around the world. UW employees offer their boundless energy, creative problem solving skills and dedication to build stronger minds and a healthier world.


UW faculty and staff also enjoy outstanding benefits, professional growth opportunities and unique resources in an environment noted for diversity, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits and natural beauty. All of which has allowed the UW to be nationally recognized as a \xe2\x80\x9cGreat College to Work For\xe2\x80\x9d for six consecutive years.


The Michael G. Foster School of Business at the University of Washington is seeking an inclusive, collaborative, creative, strategic team player to serve as a Sr. Career Coach for EY Center for Career Advancement.


The Sr. Career Coach joins a world-class business school in a pioneering city perched on the Pacific Rim. The world\xe2\x80\x99s best and brightest leaders are at UW Foster, applying ingenuity to better humanity. From entrepreneurial ventures to world-class companies, Foster alumni are working to create their greatest impact.


Foster\xe2\x80\x99s purpose statement is: Together\xe2\x80\xa6 We Foster Leaders. We Foster Insights. We Foster Progress\xe2\x80\xa6To Better Humanity. We are looking for a team member who is passionate about bettering humanity through fostering a welcoming and inclusive environment that inspires everyone to be better tomorrow than they are today.


EY Center for Career Advancement has an opening for an outstanding individual to serve as a Career Coach for Foster Business School student populations (undergraduates and specialized masters). The Career Coach provides innovative career development services and activities for Foster business students. This position reports to the Foster Career Center Executive Director and works in collaboration with other career services staff to enhance the career and professional development of Foster students.


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Career advising and programming

Serves as the career coach to Foster business student populations. Primary focus is undergrad business students w/ support to some specialized master\xe2\x80\x99s populations. Provides individual career counseling and assessment

Develops career programming and resources dedicated to the success of Foster students.

Develops and conducts career preparation workshops and events

Works with career advising team in developing materials and resources for career advising and programming

Facilitate quarterly event planning strategy and logistics meetings

Responsible for coordinating, creating, and distributing quarterly event calendar

Career Coach liaison to work with program coordinator on event marketing materials and execution

Creates career content and updates for student career web portal


Career and community outreach

Interfaces with student business clubs, faculty, and Foster departments to provide niche programming for specific populations

Works closely with UW Career Center, MBA Career Services, and other campus departments to collaborate and create effective programming and resources for Foster students

Support efforts in Career Class and Internship for Credit course execution


Undergrad program activities and special projects

Assist in the overall strategy and evaluation of the EY Center for Career Advancement

Assume shared responsibility for assessing and modifying/updating web site content related to Career Services

Serve and participate on Foster and University committees as assigned or designated

Support Foster Undergraduate Programs events and participate fully in a fast-moving team environment where everyone is expected to roll-up her/his sleeves and contribute whenever possible

Conducts and assists with special projects and activities, including outreach efforts, orientations, and other activities throughout Foster Business School and UW community. Represents Foster Undergraduate Career Services to various organizations on and off campus

Other duties as assigned


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree

2+ years of career planning or related business, industry, college relations, or higher education experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Flexibility to work selected evening and weekend events and workshops


Equivalent education and/or experience may substitute for minimum requirements.


DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree preferred

Strong communication skills. Ability to communicate successfully with a variety of audiences across all levels of an organization

Experience creating, coordinating, and delivering programs/services

Comfortable working in a fast-paced, high volume, team-oriented office setting

Exhibit strong attention to detail

Enjoy working with a diverse student body

Able to make independent decisions based on University and Foster School policies and procedures

A high degree of comfort with technology and data and social media

Project management skills

Experience creating program and services for underclass student populations

Experience working with student clubs and campus diversity programs


Application Process:

The application process for UW positions may include completion of a variety of online assessments to obtain additional information that will be used in the evaluation process. These assessments may include Work Authorization, Cover Letter and/or others. Any assessments that you need to complete will appear on your screen as soon as you select \xe2\x80\x9cApply to this position\xe2\x80\x9d. Once you begin an assessment, it must be completed at that time; if you do not complete the assessment you will be prompted to do so the next time you access your \xe2\x80\x9cMy Jobs\xe2\x80\x9d page. If you select to take it later, it will appear on your "My Jobs" page to take when you are ready. Please note that your application will not be reviewed, and you will not be considered for this position until all required assessments have been completed.


Applicants considered for this position will be required to disclose if they are the subject of any substantiated findings or current investigations related to sexual misconduct at their current employment and past employment. Disclosure is required under Washington state law.

Committed to attracting and retaining a diverse staff, the University of Washington will honor your experiences, perspectives and unique identity. Together, our community strives to create and maintain working and learning environments that are inclusive, equitable and welcoming.
The University of Washington is a leader in environmental stewardship & sustainability, and committed to becoming climate neutral.
The University of Washington is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.
To request disability accommodation in the application process, contact the Disability Services Office at 206-543-6450 or dso@uw.edu.'

Title: b'University Recruiter- Engineering, Product, & Design'
Summary: b'Act as a key contact for interns throughout their internship and maintain candidate relationships.\nManage full-cycle recruitment processes from sourcing,\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"Splunk: People + Product + Passion
At Splunk, we are tackling complex problems by making machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. Our goal: to provide a game-changing technology to creatively solve today's problems.
Are you seeking to join a high performing, collaborative, and fun-loving team that genuinely cares about your success and personal development? Are you someone who is passionate about technology, people, and diversity? Are you a self-starter ready to take the next step in your career? Then our University Recruiter role is for you!
At Splunk, we\xe2\x80\x99re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly, committed to our employees' success. We have built out our University Recruiting program globally over the last six years and are now hiring interns and new graduates in 14 offices across 8 countries with no plans to stop our momentum any time soon. Joining our University Recruiting team offers you an opportunity to become a part of our incredible journey and make a significant impact on the development of the University Recruiting program.
As a University Recruiter, you will have the opportunity to build a pipeline of diverse, top-quality intern and new graduate candidates to join our ever-growing organization.
Responsibilities
Manage full-cycle recruitment processes from sourcing, screening and hiring high caliber students for a combination of our Engineering, Product, and Design functions.
Develop the recruitment strategy for teams.
Schedule all interviews with candidates.
Collaborate with hiring managers to build and execute customized, full-cycle recruitment strategies to build a pipeline of interns and new graduates
Lead key initiatives and projects with partner groups that will continuously improve and scale our university recruiting operations
Regularly run pipeline activity, maintain data integrity, and proactively share data-centric updates with internal partners
Manage, maintain and develop relationships with faculty, staff, alumni and student organizations on-campus. Implements on-campus recruitment strategy & attends on-campus events.
Act as a key contact for interns throughout their internship and maintain candidate relationships
Minimum Qualification
3+ years of university recruiting experience
Strong communication skills
Incredibly organized
Ability to work cross-functionally
Detail oriented and ability to multi-task
Willingness to work flexible hours
Ability to travel during peak recruiting cycles
Preferred Qualification
Jobvite experience
Workday experience
Please note we welcome those seeking remote opportunities."

Title: b'Remote Human Resources Specialist - Unpaid Internship'
Summary: b'If work the minimum hours (10 hours per week) it will take you 20 weeks to complete your internship.\nConduct the first interview and schedule the second\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'With millions of people currently out of school and work due to the COVID-19 pandemic, now is the perfect time to learn new skills or improve already existing skills! A virtual internship is one of the most helpful things you can do for your career. Beginning your incredible journey to a new career starts now!

Do you want to take part in the opportunity of expanding a business that will make a positive and significant impact on millions of people? Do you want to unleash your hidden talents and work with a unique and diverse team of go-getters like yourself with leadership that leads by example? LOOK NO FURTHER, Super PurposesTM is the place for you!!!


If you are searching for a position with an up-and-coming company that will expose you to more opportunities than you can imagine while working in a relaxed, virtual environment, then you have successfully found the internship of your dreams!


WHO WE ARE:

Our Founder & CEO Super Julie Braun (also known as SJ) created Super Purposes\xe2\x84\xa2 LLC in 2018. The mission of our Company is to help millions of people gain the real-world experience needed to help them reach their career goals. (Our favorite soul sister company is SuperInterns.com.) Because we are experts Edutainment Programs and helping people get the careers they deserve, the experiences we offer are unique in that we respect interns unlike most companies. We aren\xe2\x80\x99t playing in a sandbox. We know that interns (we call them Teammates) aren\xe2\x80\x99t burdens, coffee fetchers, or file cleaners; our Teammates are given high level, impactful, and skill building projects to help us grow while the Teammate grows.


To learn more, go to https://tinyurl.com/JoinSuperP... and meet our Founder SJ and get insight on our wack-a-doodle team, what we are building and how you may help us.

YOU WILL:
Conduct the first interview and schedule the second interview with department Senior.
Seek out and recommend creative new ways of sourcing talent.
Source and recruit candidates using a variety of outlets, such as job postings and social media, while effectively targeting the right candidates for the job.
Develop relationships with colleges and prospective talent.
Review resumes, cover letters, and assess interview performance.
Administer and submit all hiring paperwork for new employees and assist with the orientation process.

Conduct and train new teammates on our on-boarding and recruiting processes.
Be the main point of contact for new teammates.
Update Teammate Bios; create profiles for new Teammates and update profiles for existing Teammates.
Create and distribute the company newsletter.
Handle Employment Verification and Letters of Recommendation.
Process departures.
Attend team and senior meetings as needed.

YOU ARE:
Adaptable to changes in projects and priorities and can handle multiple projects.
Highly motivated, detail-oriented, reliable and organized.
Excellent in verbal and written communication, email etiquette, the Internet, and MS Office.
Able to work independently with minimum supervision and attend video conferencing meetings whenever needed.
Enthusiastic and grateful to have the opportunity to work with us!
Tech savvy and own a computer with reliable access to an Internet connection.
A Super Human Resources Specialist!

YOU WILL BENEFIT BY:
Attaining high-level skills and experience that will help you increase your earning potential, reach your career goals, and find more rewarding jobs.
Receiving mentoring on your LinkedIn Profile (and thus, your resume), interviewing skills, and professional goals, and how to manage your career.
Building your professional portfolio.
Participating in collaboration sessions with our hilarious creative Teammates and team leadership.
Being exposed to the behind-the-scenes of a one-of-a-kind start-up company.
Gaining access to a variety of training materials on sales, marketing, program management, and other topics, worth thousands of dollars.
Receiving a top-notch letter of recommendation and referrals from our Employment Verification team upon the successful completion of your 200 hour internship. In addition, we will gladly help you arrange for academic credit if needed.

LOCATION:

This is a virtual/remote opportunity which means you don\xe2\x80\x99t have to deal with traffic or sitting in a stuffy office! You are able to work in a comfortable environment that provides a reliable and secure internet connection so that you can attend meetings and video conferences.

VIDEO CONFERENCING:

As a virtual company, we use video conferencing application(s) as our primary form of communication. You will be required to have video conferencing program(s) on your laptop or desktop so that you can fully participate in meetings and training sessions. Our team meetings, oneon- one meetings and training sessions often require team members to turn on their video camera, share their screens and interact with other team members.


NOTE: Your cell phone should not be your main source of working on assignments or attending meetings.


TIMING:

Immediately! Our internships are 200 hours. Each intern is required to work 10 hours a week. If work the minimum hours (10 hours per week) it will take you 20 weeks to complete your internship.


COMPENSATION:

This is an unpaid virtual internship, but the experience and connections you will get for your professional portfolio and LinkedIn profile are priceless!'

Title: b'Research Internship, AllenNLP'
Summary: b'Invitation to return to AI2 for another internship.\nPhD, Masters and Undergraduate students in computer science are invited to apply for an internship on the\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"Research Internship, AllenNLP

Who You Are:

AI2's AllenNLP team seeks a creative, early career Intern who has a strong interest in natural language processing.

The AllenNLP team collaborates frequently with researchers on AI2's other teams focused on commonsense reasoning and the Semantic Scholar engine, among others. Our main office has unique access to researchers at the University of Washington, only 1.5 miles away; our California team works on the campus of UC Irvine. Researchers excited about such internal and external collaborations are encouraged to apply.

 At AI2, you will be working with world-class AI researchers and talented software engineers. We perform team-based, ambitious research, with a mandate to strive for big breakthroughs, not just incremental progress, in an exciting and interactive workplace.

Please apply by October 15, 2020 for summer 2021 and January 15, 2021 for autumn 2021

Your Next Challenge:

PhD, Masters and Undergraduate students in computer science are invited to apply for an internship on the AllenNLP team year-round. Applicants should have an interest in natural language processing, machine learning, knowledge representation, semantics, question answering, textual entailment, or computer vision. All interns are paired with an AllenNLP mentor and participate in AI2's groundbreaking work. There are no restrictions on publications based on internships. Pay is competitive, and visa sponsorship is available.

To see more about our current, future, and past interns, check out our internship page on our website!

AI2 Intern of the Year Opportunity:

AI2 offers an Intern of the Year Award that will recognize a research intern who has performed outstanding research that will lead to a high-quality paper aligned with one of AI2's projects. This winning intern will receive:

$10,000 cash prize (applicable to tax)
Invitation to return to AI2 for another internship
Potential future employment opportunity at AI2
External announcement of their award
Why AI2:

In addition to AI2's core mission, we also aim to contribute to humanity through our treatment of each member of the AI2 Team. Some highlights are:

We are a learning organization \xe2\x80\x94 because everything AI2 does is ground-breaking, we are learning every day. Similarly, through weekly AI2 Academy lectures, a wide variety of world-class AI experts as guest speakers, and our commitment to your personal on-going education, AI2 is place where you will have opportunities to continue learning alongside your coworkers.
We value diversity \xe2\x80\x94 We seek to hire, support, and promote people from all genders, ethnicities, and all levels of experience regardless of age. We particularly encourage applications from women, non-binary individuals, people of color, members of the LGBTQA+ community, and people with disabilities of any kind.
We value inclusion \xe2\x80\x94 We understand the value that people's individual experiences and perspectives can bring to an organization, and we are building a culture in which all voices are heard, respected and considered.
We emphasize a healthy work/life balance \xe2\x80\x94 we believe our team members are happiest and most productive when their work/life balance is optimized. While we value powerful research results which drive our mission forward, we also value dinner with family, weekend time, and vacation time. We offer generous paid vacation and sick leave as well as family leave.
We are collaborative and transparent \xe2\x80\x94 we consider ourselves a team, all moving with a common purpose. We are quick to cheer our successes, and even quicker to share and jointly problem solve our failures.
We are in Seattle \xe2\x80\x94 and our office is on the water! We have mountains, we have lakes, we have four seasons, we bike to work, we have a vibrant theater scene, and we have so much else. We even have kayaks for you to paddle right outside our front door. We welcome interest from applicants from outside of the United States.
We are friendly \xe2\x80\x94 chances are you will like every one of the 100+ (and growing) people who work here. We do.

AI2 is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics."

Title: b'Research Associate, Primary'
Summary: b'In this role you will join one of our data-set teams with an initial focus on mastering our data management tool and direct outreach processes.'
Details:
b'At PitchBook we work to provide global professionals with comprehensive data on the entire venture capital, private equity and M&A landscape so they can discover and execute opportunities with confidence. We credit our success and rapid growth to our cutting-edge products, customer centered attitude and ability to embrace and drive change.

In just over a decade, PitchBook has reached over 1,300 global employees with offices worldwide, and we\xe2\x80\x99re not slowing down! Consistently recognized as a Best Place to Work, our culture is at the heart of our success and is driven by excellence, inclusion and fun. At PitchBook we\xe2\x80\x99re committed to fostering an open and collaborative work environment.

About the Role:

Nearly everyone in Research starts as a Research Associate. In this role you will join one of our data-set teams with an initial focus on mastering our data management tool and direct outreach processes. Once mastered, you will create outbound campaigns using email and/or phone calls to gather and update data in our platform. The focus will be on primary research, which is the collection of proprietary data obtained from contacts at investment and advisory firms involved in PE and VC deals, or the companies being funded with private capital. This learning process and growth of industry knowledge creates a pathway for our Primary Research Associates to grow into Senior Research Associates and Team Leads within Research or a variety of roles on other teams at PitchBook.
Primary Job Responsibilities:

Building relationships with industry professionals at private equity and venture capital backed companies, service providers or private investment firms
Managing email and/or call campaigns with the goal of gathering and verifying private markets data
Working with marketing, editorial and customer success teams to tailor email messaging, meet reporting deadlines and better understand client use cases
Leveraging technology-based tools to ensure that proprietary data is added to the PitchBook Platform efficiently and with the utmost quality
Working with team to develop and improve processes, tools and methodologies
Taking on projects to identify opportunities to improve upon the core quality metrics (comprehensiveness, accuracy, timeliness)
Becoming an expert in PitchBook\xe2\x80\x99s core research areas of private equity, venture capital and M&A through dedicated training
Skills and Qualifications:

Communication skills, both verbal and in written materials, targeting an audience all the way up to the executive level
A strong sense of urgency, as well as comfort making a high volume of outbound calls on a daily basis
The ability to work both independently and as part of a team
Strong organization methods and top-notch multi-tasking skills
Incessant curiosity, innovative thinking and meticulous work habits
A background or interest in the private equity, venture capital and M&A industries
1 \xe2\x80\x93 2 years professional experience, which might be in the form of an internship
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree required
If you are ready to start the conversation about how you might contribute to all the happenings at PitchBook, submit your resume today! PitchBook appreciates and respects diversity, and as such, we are an equal opportunity employer.

#LI-JH1'

Title: b'SENIOR CAREER COACH'
Summary: b'The Career Coach provides innovative career development services and activities for Foster business students.\nDevelops and conducts career preparation workshops\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Notes: As a UW employee, you will enjoy generous benefits and work/life programs. For detailed information on Benefits for this position, click here.


The University of Washington is following physical distancing directives from state and local governments as part of the collective effort to combat the spread of COVID-19. Click HERE for updates.


Work is ordinarily performed in an office environment but may be performed remotely depending on health and safety requirements under the COVID-19 pandemic.


As a UW employee, you have a unique opportunity to change lives on our campuses, in our state and around the world. UW employees offer their boundless energy, creative problem solving skills and dedication to build stronger minds and a healthier world.


UW faculty and staff also enjoy outstanding benefits, professional growth opportunities and unique resources in an environment noted for diversity, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits and natural beauty. All of which has allowed the UW to be nationally recognized as a \xe2\x80\x9cGreat College to Work For\xe2\x80\x9d for six consecutive years.


The Michael G. Foster School of Business at the University of Washington is seeking an inclusive, collaborative, creative, strategic team player to serve as a Sr. Career Coach for EY Center for Career Advancement.


The Sr. Career Coach joins a world-class business school in a pioneering city perched on the Pacific Rim. The world\xe2\x80\x99s best and brightest leaders are at UW Foster, applying ingenuity to better humanity. From entrepreneurial ventures to world-class companies, Foster alumni are working to create their greatest impact.


Foster\xe2\x80\x99s purpose statement is: Together\xe2\x80\xa6 We Foster Leaders. We Foster Insights. We Foster Progress\xe2\x80\xa6To Better Humanity. We are looking for a team member who is passionate about bettering humanity through fostering a welcoming and inclusive environment that inspires everyone to be better tomorrow than they are today.


EY Center for Career Advancement has an opening for an outstanding individual to serve as a Career Coach for Foster Business School student populations (undergraduates and specialized masters). The Career Coach provides innovative career development services and activities for Foster business students. This position reports to the Foster Career Center Executive Director and works in collaboration with other career services staff to enhance the career and professional development of Foster students.


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Career advising and programming

Serves as the career coach to Foster business student populations. Primary focus is undergrad business students w/ support to some specialized master\xe2\x80\x99s populations. Provides individual career counseling and assessment

Develops career programming and resources dedicated to the success of Foster students.

Develops and conducts career preparation workshops and events

Works with career advising team in developing materials and resources for career advising and programming

Facilitate quarterly event planning strategy and logistics meetings

Responsible for coordinating, creating, and distributing quarterly event calendar

Career Coach liaison to work with program coordinator on event marketing materials and execution

Creates career content and updates for student career web portal


Career and community outreach

Interfaces with student business clubs, faculty, and Foster departments to provide niche programming for specific populations

Works closely with UW Career Center, MBA Career Services, and other campus departments to collaborate and create effective programming and resources for Foster students

Support efforts in Career Class and Internship for Credit course execution


Undergrad program activities and special projects

Assist in the overall strategy and evaluation of the EY Center for Career Advancement

Assume shared responsibility for assessing and modifying/updating web site content related to Career Services

Serve and participate on Foster and University committees as assigned or designated

Support Foster Undergraduate Programs events and participate fully in a fast-moving team environment where everyone is expected to roll-up her/his sleeves and contribute whenever possible

Conducts and assists with special projects and activities, including outreach efforts, orientations, and other activities throughout Foster Business School and UW community. Represents Foster Undergraduate Career Services to various organizations on and off campus

Other duties as assigned


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree

2+ years of career planning or related business, industry, college relations, or higher education experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Flexibility to work selected evening and weekend events and workshops


Equivalent education and/or experience may substitute for minimum requirements.


DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree preferred

Strong communication skills. Ability to communicate successfully with a variety of audiences across all levels of an organization

Experience creating, coordinating, and delivering programs/services

Comfortable working in a fast-paced, high volume, team-oriented office setting

Exhibit strong attention to detail

Enjoy working with a diverse student body

Able to make independent decisions based on University and Foster School policies and procedures

A high degree of comfort with technology and data and social media

Project management skills

Experience creating program and services for underclass student populations

Experience working with student clubs and campus diversity programs


Application Process:

The application process for UW positions may include completion of a variety of online assessments to obtain additional information that will be used in the evaluation process. These assessments may include Work Authorization, Cover Letter and/or others. Any assessments that you need to complete will appear on your screen as soon as you select \xe2\x80\x9cApply to this position\xe2\x80\x9d. Once you begin an assessment, it must be completed at that time; if you do not complete the assessment you will be prompted to do so the next time you access your \xe2\x80\x9cMy Jobs\xe2\x80\x9d page. If you select to take it later, it will appear on your "My Jobs" page to take when you are ready. Please note that your application will not be reviewed, and you will not be considered for this position until all required assessments have been completed.


Applicants considered for this position will be required to disclose if they are the subject of any substantiated findings or current investigations related to sexual misconduct at their current employment and past employment. Disclosure is required under Washington state law.

Committed to attracting and retaining a diverse staff, the University of Washington will honor your experiences, perspectives and unique identity. Together, our community strives to create and maintain working and learning environments that are inclusive, equitable and welcoming.
The University of Washington is a leader in environmental stewardship & sustainability, and committed to becoming climate neutral.
The University of Washington is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.
To request disability accommodation in the application process, contact the Disability Services Office at 206-543-6450 or dso@uw.edu.'

Title: b'Production Engineer Intern/Co-Op'
Summary: b'Intent to return to full-time degree program after completion of the internship.\nProduction Engineers (PEs) at Facebook are a hybrid between software and\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"Production Engineers (PEs) at Facebook are a hybrid between software and systems engineers and are core to every significant engineering effort that keeps Facebook running smoothly and scaling efficiently. PEs work within Facebook's product and infrastructure teams to make sure our products and services are reliable and scalable. This means writing code and debugging hard problems in live production that impacts over 2 billion people around the world. Our PEs are embedded in teams that work on products like Instagram, WhatsApp, Oculus and Videos to backend services like Storage, Cache and Network. Our team is comprised of varying levels of experience and backgrounds, from university grads to industry veterans. Relevant industry experience is important, but ultimately less so than your demonstrated abilities and attitude. Partnered alongside the best engineers in the industry on the coolest stuff around, the code and systems you work on will be in production and used by millions of users all around the world. We sail into uncharted waters every day at Facebook in Production Engineering.
Own back-end services like our Hadoop data warehouses, front-end services like Chat and Newsfeed, infrastructure components like our Memcached infrastructure, and everything in between
Write and review code, develop documentation, and debug the hardest problems, live, on some of the largest and most complex systems in the world
Experience in *nix (Linux, BSDs, or another UNIX-like OS)
Experience coding in at least one language
1 or more years with new development languages (Python, PHP, C++, and Java)
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Understanding of TCP/IP networking fundamentals
Knowledge of internet service architectures (such as load balancing, LAMP, CDN's
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a BS/MS degree in CS, Engineering, or a related technical discipline
Intent to return to full-time degree program after completion of the internship
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com."

Title: b'Software Engineering Intern - Semantic Scholar'
Summary: b'Successful past internships (or full time employment) in a technical role.\nSemantic Scholar use artificial intelligence to extract the semantics, or meaning, of\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"Position Summary

Are you interested in honing your engineering skills while learning about cutting-edge developments in Artificial Intelligence? If so, an internship at AI2 may be the perfect opportunity. AI2 will be reviewing applications and scheduling interviews for 2021 internships in late October. Start dates will be between January and July. We are open to internships that are 3 months or longer.

At AI2, you'd be working not just with talented software engineers but also with world-class AI researchers. We have projects on understanding and answering real-world questions, learning from pictures and videos, and building the world's best academic search engine. As an intern at AI2, you would be paired with a mentor and embedded on a team. Over the course of your time at AI2, you would complete 2-3 substantial projects that would build your resume and leave an impact on AI2.

This job posting is for an internship with Semantic Scholar: a free, AI-powered research tool for scientific literature. Semantic Scholar use artificial intelligence to extract the semantics, or meaning, of scientific literature and surface it to our users through a discovery experience that helps them understand science more effectively. As an engineering intern at Semantic Scholar, you would have the opportunity to learn about and undertake projects in big data, ML, and web development. Projects previous interns have worked on at S2 include developing a public API for programmatic access to our corpus, and developing new types of recommendations for our website.

What we're looking for:

Students who are late in their program (juniors, seniors, or masters students) or recently graduated, and have a strong academic record.
Successful past internships (or full time employment) in a technical role.
About AI2

The Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence is a non-profit research institute in Seattle founded by Paul Allen and headed by Professor Oren Etzioni. The core mission of AI2 is to contribute to humanity through high-impact research in artificial intelligence.

Why AI2

In addition to AI2's core mission, we also aim to contribute to humanity through how we treat each member of the AI2 Team! Some highlights are:

We are a learning organization \xe2\x80\x93 because everything AI2 does is ground-breaking, we are learning every day. Similarly, through weekly AI2 Academy lectures, a wide variety of world-class AI experts as guest speakers, and our commitment to your personal on-going education, AI2 is place where you will have opportunities to continue learning right alongside us;
We value diversity - We seek to hire, support, and promote people from all genders, ethnicities, and all levels of experience regardless of age. We particularly encourage applications from women, non-binary individuals, people of color, members of the LGBTQA+ community, and people with disabilities of any kind.
We value inclusion - We understand the value that people's individual experiences and perspectives can bring to an organization, and we are building a culture in which all voices are heard, respected and considered.
We emphasize a healthy work/life balance \xe2\x80\x93 we believe our team members are happiest and most productive when their work/life balance is optimized. While we value powerful research results which drive our mission forward, we also value dinner with family, weekend time, and vacation time. We offer generous paid vacation and sick leave as well as family leave;
We are collaborative and transparent \xe2\x80\x93 we consider ourselves a team, all moving with a common purpose. We are quick to cheer our successes, and even quicker to share and jointly problem solve our failures;
We are in Seattle \xe2\x80\x93 and our office is on the water! We have mountains, we have lakes, we have four seasons, we bike to work, we have a vibrant theater scene, and we have so much else. We even have kayaks for you to paddle right outside our front door;
We welcome interest from applicants from outside of the United States;
We are friendly \xe2\x80\x93 chances are you will like every one of the 100+ (and growing!) people who work here. We do!

AI2 is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at hr@allenai.org or you may call us at 206-548-5600."

Details:

Location Seattle, Washington

The WarnerMedia Story
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Now, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

The Job
As a Technical Program Manager Intern, you will work with creative development teams and help drive ambiguous product requirements into a well thought out design. You will experience working cross-functionally with Product Management, Experience Design, Quality Assurance, Engineering, and Release Management to deliver features that provide value to HBO Max customers. You will have the opportunity to work with other Technical Program Managers to learn about feature definition and breakdown, execution planning, tracking, and communicating with teams & leaders. To this end, you must be passionate about developing strong negotiation and cross-functional communication skills.

Title: b'GT IMPACT - AUDIT INTERNSHIP 2022'
Summary: b'During the Summer Leadership Program you will be exposed to Grant Thornton\xe2\x80\x99s service lines which include audit, tax, and advisory.'
Details:
b'GT IMPACT - Audit Internship 2022(Job Number: 048504)

Description

Who is Grant Thornton?

Hi. We\xe2\x80\x99re Grant Thornton LLP, the U.S. member firm of Grant Thornton International Ltd (A.K.A. one of the world\xe2\x80\x99s leading organizations of independent audit, tax and advisory firms.) With us, business feels more personal \xe2\x80\x94 for our clients and for you. That makes us different. Better. And we\xe2\x80\x99re looking for applicants who are too.

Different how? It means working with numbers doesn\xe2\x80\x99t make you a number. Here, your voice matters. Our inclusive community and caring culture rejects limits and egos, which helps make our work stronger and you thrive. From our global clients and no-silos style, we empower you with opportunity from day one, then set you up for long-term success with flexibility, resources and connections. It\xe2\x80\x99s how we help you create a career you love \xe2\x80\x94 and more.

Interested? Get to know us better at gt.com/careers and read on to learn more how you\xe2\x80\x99ll help us become even bolder:

What is the "GT IMPACT" - Summer Leadership Program?

\xe2\x80\x98GT IMPACT\xe2\x80\x99 is Grant Thornton\xe2\x80\x99s Summer Leadership Program for sophomore and junior University candidates. Our Summer Leadership Program is a great opportunity for you to gain insight into Grant Thornton\xe2\x80\x99s professional service offerings and get exposure to several of our Business Leaders, Senior Executives, Associates, and peers. \xe2\x80\x98GT IMPACT\xe2\x80\x99 is an interactive program with both local and national components. During the Summer Leadership Program you will be exposed to Grant Thornton\xe2\x80\x99s service lines which include audit, tax, and advisory. You will also have an opportunity to interact with Grant Thornton team members and peers. The program is designed to continue building your leadership skills and help you identify your own abilities and goals as you prepare for a successful transition from college into your career. Students who participate in the GT IMPACT Summer Leadership Program will have the opportunity to be considered for an internship in the office of their choice.

Qualifications

Qualifications:

Pursuing Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s or Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree
Major and overall minimum GPA of 3.0/4.0

Skill Requirements:

Excellent analytical, communication (written and verbal), and interpersonal skills
Strong technical aptitude and skillset
Ability to work efficiently and effectively in a complex team environment

It is Grant Thornton\xe2\x80\x99s policy to promote equal employment opportunities. All personnel decisions, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, compensation, benefits and termination, are made without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

Title: b'Provider Contracting \xe2\x80\x93 Graduate Intern'
Summary: b'The working hours for the internship are Monday through Friday, 9:00 AM until 5:00 PM or as otherwise arranged.\nProven track record of delivering results.'
Details:
b"The Pacific Northwest Summer Internship, located in Cigna's Seattle office, will provide the student intern with an opportunity to experience provider contracting, engage in project work, and provide general support to the market. The intern will integrate into a Total Health and Network team which works to improve Cigna's market position and the Total Medical Cost trends of Cigna's customers.

Summer Experience

The intern will have opportunities to be exposed to leadership in all market sales segments, provider relations, wellness, medical economics, and provider contracting with a focus on provider networks. There will be opportunities for the intern to meet with network providers. The preceptor for the intern position is the Market Vice President for Provider Networks.

Projects will include network and discount analytic support, strategic planning, and review of total medical costs trends including both utilization and unit cost.

The working hours for the internship are Monday through Friday, 9:00 AM until 5:00 PM or as otherwise arranged.

The Ideal Candidate
Pursuing a Masters in Health Administration or Business Administration
Evidence of strong analytic problem-solving abilities, application of technical accounting or financial concepts
Strong communication skills, and business acumen
Strong abilities with Microsoft Office products, including MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Access.
Proven track record of delivering results

About Cigna
Cigna Corporation (NYSE: CI) is a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, well-being and peace of mind of those we serve. We offer an integrated suite of health services through Cigna, Express Scripts, and our affiliates including medical, dental, behavioral health, pharmacy, vision, supplemental benefits, and other related products. Together, with our 74,000 employees worldwide, we aspire to transform health services, making them more affordable and accessible to millions. Through our unmatched expertise, bold action, fresh ideas and an unwavering commitment to patient-centered care, we are a force of health services innovation.

When you work with Cigna, you\xe2\x80\x99ll enjoy meaningful career experiences that enrich people\xe2\x80\x99s lives while working together to make the world a healthier place. What difference will you make? To see our culture in action, search #TeamCigna on Instagram.

Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, age, disability, sex, childbirth (including pregnancy) or related medical conditions including but not limited to lactation, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital or familial status, genetic information, status with regard to public assistance, citizenship status or any other characteristic protected by applicable equal employment opportunity laws.

If you require reasonable accommodation in completing the online application process, please email: SeeYourself@cigna.com for support. Do not email SeeYourself@cigna.com for an update on your application or to provide your resume as you will not receive a response."

Title: b'Mechanical Engineer I'
Summary: b'As a Mechanical Engineer I, you will have the responsibility of assisting on various technical projects consisting of the design, fabrication, modification, and\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Overview:

Mechanical Engineer I - Bothell, WA

FUJIFILM, Sonosite, Inc . We are an innovative and high performance culture with tremendous opportunities. People who work here are given the unique opportunity to contribute to the advancement of healthcare throughout the world. Headquartered in Bothell, WA USA, FUJIFILM Sonosite is represented by a global distribution network in over 100 countries. Since its inception, FUJIFILM Sonosite\xe2\x80\x99s lightweight, robust products have created and led the point-of-care ultrasound market. From sophisticated urban hospital emergency rooms to clinics in austere, remote villages, FUJIFILM Sonosite systems are used by over 21 medical specialties and provide clinicians around the world with a cost-effective tool for improving patient safety and workflow efficiency. FUJIFILM Sonosite holds a number of prestigious design awards and has in excess of 145 patents.
External US:

Job Summary:

As a Mechanical Engineer I, you will have the responsibility of assisting on various technical projects consisting of the design, fabrication, modification, and evaluation of components involving both mechanical and electro-mechanical devices culminating in high performance, innovative ultrasound systems and accessories. You will conduct technical investigations utilizing a wide variety of mechanical engineering principles in the origination or modification of material, component and/or process specifications and requirements. The role includes configuration control of the projects, both in NPI & Sustaining, using Agile PLM software. You will prepare design specifications, analyses and recommendations for presentation to include refinement of parts with SolidWorks and engineering analyses (stress, thermal, tolerance). Also, you will assist conducting engineering confidence testing and generating relevant technical reports.

Essential Job Functions:

Assist in implementing mechanical designs for ultrasound systems and accessories using SolidWorks tools
Support development and/or improvement of NPI processes through active participation in ongoing development in both new and Sustaining areas, identifying opportunities for improvements
Solve technical issues both as an individual and as a participant on cross-functional teams
Apply engineering principles to design products and prototypes
Conduct engineering confidence testing and generate technical reports
Coordinate with suppliers of outsourced components to clarify requirements, review drawings and assist with manufacturing input
Prioritize work and break down assignments into tasks that can be organized and executed to meet assignment performance and time goals
Create and maintain product Bill of Materials (BoM) for one or more projects

Knowledge and Experience:

BS mechanical engineering
Experience with SolidWorks software including surfacing tools
Internship experience in a related position a plus
Hands on machine shop experience a plus
Experience with injection molded plastic parts, rapid prototyping processes, sheet metal, and die castings strongly preferred
Experience in a medical device development environment or other regulated industry preferred

Skills and Abilities:

Excellent problem solving skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to communicate effectively both within other groups in Engineering and throughout the company
Ability to lift 25 pounds, with or without accommodations
Excellent organizational and time management skills

FUJIFILM Sonosite, Inc. offers a fantastic compensation package, including benefits, and a 401k program. Visit us today to learn more about our exciting technologies and how you can make a difference. To apply and obtain further details regarding key responsibilities and experience requirements, check out our careers page at www.Sonosite.com/careers.

FUJIFILM Sonosite, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

In compliance with the ADA Amendments Act, should you have a disability that requires assistance and / or reasonable accommodation with the job application process, please contact the Human Resources department via phone at 425-951-1200, or via e-mail at ffss-hr@fujifilm.com . Additionally, the affirmative program/plan is available for review upon formal request by employees and applicants for employment in the Human Resources office during regular office hours.

Previous interns have used their experiences as a springboard for career, graduate school and beyond.
