Title: b'Associate Director'
Summary: b'Collaborate with the Program Manager (II), Internships and Career services to integrate supported employment opportunities/internships in alignment/preparation\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"APPLICATION PROCESS - Please submit a cover letter and resume for this position when applying.

WORK SCHEDULE: This position is full time exempt and requires the ability to work a flexible schedule. The schedule will vary depending on program needs. Requires the ability and willingness to work nights, weekends, and holidays when needed, as well as being On-Call rotation and respond in the event of emergencies.

AT YOUTHCARE: YouthCare envisions a community where no young person experiences homelessness, all young people have the opportunity to thrive, and the systems that oppress them are dismantled. YouthCare serves young people of many racial and ethnic backgrounds, abilities, sexual orientations, gender identities, and religious beliefs, and we seek a workforce that reflects that diversity.

ABOUT YOUTHCARE: YouthCare works to end youth homelessness and to ensure that young people are valued for who they are and empowered to achieve their potential. Founded in 1974, YouthCare was one of the first programs to serve runaway and homeless youth on the West Coast. The goal was to help young people find safety today and build a future for tomorrow. Over four decades, we\xe2\x80\x99ve defined best practices and developed programs that are a national standard for excellence. Using a youth-centered approach, we ensure that young people experiencing homelessness ages 12-24 have the hope, skills, and confidence to gain long-term stability.

POSITION SUMMARY: Under the supervision of the Director of Employment & Education, the Associate Director of Workforce Development is responsible for overseeing YouthCare\xe2\x80\x99s programming focused on building youth\xe2\x80\x99s employment skills and supporting their transitions into employment. Currently, programming includes sector focused and job readiness training programs (ex. Barista), workforce development programming (ex. YouthBuild), internship programs, and a team of Career Coordinators Specialist across all of YouthCare\xe2\x80\x99s service model. This role is primarily responsible for the successful execution of each of these programs, contract management, maintaining and developing the external partnerships for each program, and providing expertise on employment and engagement tactics that will resonate with our youth. This includes reviewing and providing oversight of program policies and procedures in alignment with overall agency policies; monitoring contract compliance and ensuring full utilization of resources and successful stewardship of grant monies; developing, planning, and implementing strategies for program continuation and growth including outreach and training to community partners; working with program teams to develop and implement staff training; working with agency compliance and program quality team members to ensure readiness for internal and external audits; conducting case reviews; preparing department budgets; partnering with the Director of Education and Employment to ensure excellence in overall program service delivery and collaborating effectively across the organization to provide continuity of services and efficient person-centered programming.
This position will provide site-based leadership and management to two YouthCare Education & Employment Sites: Seattle City Light & South Seattle Community college, supporting the PMII\xe2\x80\x99s who directly manage the day-to-day operations of each space, and current and additional projects developed tied to YouthCare\xe2\x80\x99s Integrative Design and YouthCare Academy work. The position requires an individual who is a strategic thinker, a strong implementer, whose passion for this work is matched with decisiveness, outstanding communication skills, strong understanding of YouthCare\xe2\x80\x99s culture, and a keen ability to set high expectations for both staff and young people. The Associate Director \xe2\x80\x93 Workforce Development will foster a healing, nurturing environment, and culturally relevant real-world experiences that set participants along pathways to pursue and achieve YouthCare\xe2\x80\x99s 4 core outcomes \xe2\x80\x93 maintain housing, financial stability, wellness, and network of support. Essential Responsibilities include:
AGENCY OPERATIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

Collaborate with associate directors, managers, and direct service staff across YouthCare including our drop-in locations, emergency overnight shelters, transitional living programs, and our Rapid Rehousing programs to develop a culture of employment and education across the agency and to ensure your program staff are providing high quality employment and education services across the agency.
Provide direct supervision, oversight, and consultation for E&E programs and services at Climate Change Arena, Seattle Colleges, & Seattle City Light, in addition to contributing to key projects/relationships that support those service locations. Oversee and actively manage all program contracts, ensuring compliance and excellent outcomes.
Participate and/or lead strategic planning groups, support the development of new programming and strategies to support the continual growth and improvement of employment and education, and contribute to the design and implementation of a new Education and Employment center. Maintain dynamic collaboration with the entire E&E leadership team concerning program quality, cross program partnerships, and achieving agency goals/objectives.
Participate on internal agency, local, regional and state-wide boards, task forces, committees and projects, as assigned. Specific to workforce development, participate in YouthBuild USA committees, training opportunities and events as needed; ensure continuous improvement via YouthBuild USA certifications and affiliation. Ensure program participation with JAC, RPAC, JLAC, and other trade-based or social service network providers (especially for recruitment purposes)
Develop and provide presentations for internal and external audiences. Manage external relations including funders and other community resources, as assigned. Participate in the grant writing process \xe2\x80\x93 generate and draft content, narrative, data, and budget materials. Complete monthly, quarterly, and annual, internal and external programmatic and fiscal reporting.
Attend conferences as required and/or assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Hire, supervise, coach, and develop direct service and supervisory staff. Current direct reports include the Barista Program Supervisor, PMII YouthBuild, PMII Internships & Career Planning Services, an Employer Engagement Specialist, a team of Career Coordinators/Education & Employment Navigators, and other administrative staff.
Schedule and attend weekly supervision meetings for all direct reports; ensure regular team meetings occur for each program team. Ensure clear understanding of job requirements, facilitation of quality program services, and timely completion of deadlines.
Set clear and attainable goals for staff and programs; hold regular performance reviews against these goals, taking a strengths-based and data-informed approach, that encourages learning and educational opportunities, both professionally and personally; conduct and provide feedback on agency performance Evaluations on an annual and timely basis.
Ensure the development of professional development training/professional learning communities that support best practices in employment services and workforce development, including strategies for youth engagement, employment training/engagement, youth job retention, harm-reduction, strengths-based, and trauma-informed care; facilitate trainings internally/externally.
Provide consultation on education and employment strategies and services for all team members including Program Managers, Program Supervisors and Case Managers as needed and assigned. Provide program/instructional coverage as needed in the case of a staff absence or position vacancy.

SPECIFIC PROGRAM RESPONSIBILITIES:

Supervise the successful operations of sector focused and job readiness training (ex. Barista), workforce development (ex. YouthBuild), and internship programming, including the successful and timely coordination/completion of each client\xe2\x80\x99s education, sector focused skill development, and career goals, resulting in successful job placement and job retention of program graduates.
For each program, monitor compliance with agency/program regulations and contract expectations. Ensure that all funding source performance standards are met and reported on. Participate in the development and managing of program budgets. Ensure that program operates within budgetary guidelines.
Review employee case notes and case management documentation and file completion. Ensure all client-related data is both current and accurate in the YouthCare\xe2\x80\x99s Evaluation System (YES), WA State Pre-Apprenticeship Data Bases, City of Seattle Pre-Apprenticeship Data Bases, and DYB, and any other databases contractually required. Ensure that each program\xe2\x80\x99s files are ready for regular and random audits by contract monitors or accrediting bodies.
In collaboration with the Associate Director of E&E Development & Integration and program teams, redesign current job training and workforce development programming to create a seamless and diverse set of employment opportunities for youth that lead to a reliable wage; design and develop new job training and workforce development programming in construction, business, medical, and other career pathways. Collaborate with the Program Manager (II), Internships and Career services to integrate supported employment opportunities/internships in alignment/preparation for success in each pathway. In collaboration with the E&E Director, regularly identify new funding and program opportunities, develop program descriptions, and create program outcomes.
In collaboration and support of program staff and participants, develop and implement operational processes that improve efficiency and program/service quality in areas such as recruitment and eligibility, data design and utilization, and service flows/youth progressions. Review, revise, and implement program policies and procedures for each program on a regular basis.
Maintain relationships with South Seattle College and manage to ensure adequate training facilities and space for YouthBuild. Ensure that eligible youth participants are enrolled in the YouthBuild college classes and receive credit on a quarterly basis. Ensure that the program is on track to meet scheduled curriculum hours and topics.
Develop and maintain partnerships with funding and implementation partners including local and Washington State union leadership to ensure that the curriculum of workforce development programming is providing the training and skill attainment required to maintain the program\xe2\x80\x99s status as a direct feeder of pre- apprentices to union apprenticeship programs. Cultivate and maintain relationships with union apprenticeships and non-union construction jobs and apprenticeships that can lead to living wage jobs for YouthBuild and other workforce development graduates.
Perform other duties, as assigned by supervisor.

SAFETY MANAGEMENT AND CRISIS RESPONSE

Assess potential emergency situations and coordinate a team that supports participants with behaviors such as substance abuse and mental health diagnoses. Ensure each member of the E&E team is properly trained and effectively provides intensive support with participants.
Communicate effectively to teams across agency in times of crisis. Interact as needed with outside parties such as the police department, child protection, neighbors, and others in a professional manner. Lead staff and volunteer team debriefs of incidents. Attend to signs of secondary trauma of staff and volunteers.
In conjunction with team monitor participant behavior and make decisions regarding adherence to guidelines. This may include de-escalation or redirecting behaviors. Respond to crisis situations involving your service locations; understand what client related symptomatic behaviors might be expected and how to manage them.

This job description is not intended to cover every aspect of your job at YouthCare. We are a team that works together to meet the needs of our clients and every member of the team is expected to pitch in and help even beyond the specific responsibilities listed in this description.


QUALIFICATIONS \xe2\x80\x93

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor's Degree in Social Work or relevant field of study or an equivalent combination of education and relevant work experience (8+ years) serving young people experiencing homelessness, housing stability, poverty, and systemic oppression.
Possess five or more years of supervisory experience or strong history of effective leadership and management experience.
Demonstrated ability to efficiently and effectively manage a large volume of work, be organized and detailed, successfully multi-task and complete assignments on short notice with tight time constraints and meet deadlines; and provide responsive customer services to internal and external stakeholders at all levels.
Demonstrate professionalism through a positive and cooperative attitude and by maintaining the confidential and proprietary nature of client/staff relationships and related work products.
Ability to maintain stable performance under pressure or opposition (such as approaching deadlines or job ambiguity); handles stress in a manner that maintains teamwork and respect for others and to the organization.

PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS:

Master Level Degree in Social Work, Counseling, or Psychology

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT:
Must be able to provide I-9 supporting documentation for employment.
Must be able to obtain and maintain background clearance through the Department of Children, Youth & Families (DCYF) for the entirety of employment.
Current TB Test.
Food Handler\xe2\x80\x99s Card.
Successful completion of pre-service training as required by contracting agency. Training will include: New Employee Training, Cultural Proficiency training, CPR/First Aid and HIV/AIDS training, CSEC and Right Response training, Defensive Driving and 15-Passenger Van training.
Must possess a valid WA State Driver\xe2\x80\x99s License and have the ability to drive.
When driving YouthCare vehicles, you must possess a valid WA State Driver\xe2\x80\x99s License; meet minimum safe driver criteria established by the agency and our insurance company.
Computer software skills including Windows, Microsoft outlook, Microsoft Word.
Initiative, creativity, reliability, flexibility, thoroughness.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with good quality spelling, grammar and punctuation.
High integrity when dealing with a broad array of cultures and restricted and/or confidential information.
Ability to deal therapeutically with behavioral and emotional problems presented by young people and understanding of emotionally, physically and sexually abused young people.
Ability to coordinate overall program functioning.
Ability to accurately maintain and produce files, records, logs and reports.
Ability to maintain professional boundaries with clients while building trust and respect.
Ability and willingness to stay awake and alert during overnight shifts.
Ability to verbally and physically respond to an aggressive person in ways that de-escalate, establish and maintain staff and young peoples\xe2\x80\x99 safety.
May be required to assume responsibilities or duties within the agency not specifically delineated in this job description for short periods of time or on an infrequent basis.
Commitment to YouthCare\xe2\x80\x99s initiative to build cultural proficiency across the agency. Acceptance of a variety of lifestyles, behaviors, and cultural and spiritual practices.
May be required to assume responsibilities or duties within the agency not specifically delineated in this job description for short periods of time or on an infrequent basis.
Commitment to YouthCare\xe2\x80\x99s initiative to build cultural proficiency across the agency. Acceptance of a variety of lifestyles, behaviors, and cultural and spiritual practices.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

Ability to perform range of physical motions, exerting up to 50 pounds. Lifting and carrying up to 50 pounds; standing, walking, sitting for long periods of time, kneeling, squatting, and stooping; running for brief periods of time; and go up and down stairs.

BENEFITS: YouthCare provides a competitive benefits package to full time employees including medical, dental, vision, long-term disability, short-term disability, life insurance, 401(k), vacation, paid holidays, and sick leave after successful completion of the 90-day Introductory Period.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYMENT: YouthCare is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions are based on merit and business needs and YouthCare is committed to recruiting, hiring, training, and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, regardless of actual or perceived sex; race; color; religious creed; national origin; ancestry; age; marital status; pregnancy; nursing parent status; physical, mental or sensory disability; medical condition; genetic information; sexual orientation; gender (including gender identity or expression); military or veteran status; or any other basis protected by federal, state and/or local laws. People of Color and Members of the LGBTQ community are strongly encouraged to apply."

b'Title:

KBR maintains a highly qualified workforce to help care for service people and astronauts. We attract the best minds in the world because our expertise thrives on creativity, resourcefulness and collaboration. That is how we supply our clients with cutting-edge solutions and services.

Title: b'Research Intern - Azure Cognitive Services: Research'
Summary: b'Language, including Natural Language Understanding & Generation, Knowledge Graph, Pre-trained Language Models.\nInterns put inquiry and theory into practice.'
Details:
b'Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

The Azure Cognitive Services team is on a mission to advance the state of the art in AI and deliver towards our company vision for how intelligent cloud and intelligent edge will shape the next phase of innovation. The Azure Cognitive Services team includes top researchers from across Microsoft to create a center of excellence in speech, computer vision and natural language.

We are looking for exceptional interns to work on cutting edge research in various AI areas, including:

1. Language, including Natural Language Understanding & Generation, Knowledge Graph, Pre-trained Language Models

2. Speech/Audio, including Speech Recognition, Speech Enhancement/Separation, Speaker Recognition/Verification/Diarization, and Audio Visual Fusion.

3. Vision, including Image Classification, Object Detection, Segmentation, Tracking, Network Architecture Search, and Vision-Language Understanding.

The mission of our group is to make fundamental contributions to advancing the state-of-the-art in AI technology. To this end, we conduct research on forward-looking topics such as text summarization, end-to-end conversation transcription, audio-visual fusion, and large-scale visual recognition. Our research has contributed, and will continue contributing, to various Microsoft products, such as Microsoft Teams, Office, Bing, Cortana, and Xbox as well as third party applications through the Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services.

The interns are expected to utilize and design state-of-the-art results in deep learning in NLP, Speech and Vision, and implement models using frameworks such as PyTorch and Tensorflow.
Responsibilities
Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s best researchers, interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, students are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.
Qualifications
In addition to the qualifications below, you\xe2\x80\x99ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter

Required Qualifications
Currently enrolled in a PhD program in Computer Science or a related STEM field.
1+ year experience in Language, Speech, or Vision research with hands-on deep learning experience.
Experience with open source tools such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.

Preferred Qualifications
Track record of publications in related top conferences (e.g., ACL, EMNLP, NAACL, ICASSP, Interspeech, CVPR, ICCV, ICML, NIPS, ICLR).
Excellent communication and writing skills.

This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed within this position. The actual duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may vary based on assignment.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.'

Title: b'Production Engineer Intern/Co-Op'
Summary: b'Intent to return to full-time degree program after completion of the internship.\nProduction Engineers (PEs) at Facebook are a hybrid between software and\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"Production Engineers (PEs) at Facebook are a hybrid between software and systems engineers and are core to every significant engineering effort that keeps Facebook running smoothly and scaling efficiently. PEs work within Facebook's product and infrastructure teams to make sure our products and services are reliable and scalable. This means writing code and debugging hard problems in live production that impacts over 2 billion people around the world. Our PEs are embedded in teams that work on products like Instagram, WhatsApp, Oculus and Videos to backend services like Storage, Cache and Network. Our team is comprised of varying levels of experience and backgrounds, from university grads to industry veterans. Relevant industry experience is important, but ultimately less so than your demonstrated abilities and attitude. Partnered alongside the best engineers in the industry on the coolest stuff around, the code and systems you work on will be in production and used by millions of users all around the world. We sail into uncharted waters every day at Facebook in Production Engineering.
Own back-end services like our Hadoop data warehouses, front-end services like Chat and Newsfeed, infrastructure components like our Memcached infrastructure, and everything in between
Write and review code, develop documentation, and debug the hardest problems, live, on some of the largest and most complex systems in the world
Experience in *nix (Linux, BSDs, or another UNIX-like OS)
Experience coding in at least one language
1 or more years with new development languages (Python, PHP, C++, and Java)
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Understanding of TCP/IP networking fundamentals
Knowledge of internet service architectures (such as load balancing, LAMP, CDN's
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a BS/MS degree in CS, Engineering, or a related technical discipline
Intent to return to full-time degree program after completion of the internship
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com."

Title: b'Sr. Marketing Manager, Prime GTM'
Summary: b'6+ years of professional non-internship marketing experience.\nBachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in business, marketing, communications, or relevant field of study.'
Details:
b'6+ years of professional non-internship marketing experience
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in business, marketing, communications, or relevant field of study

Amazon Prime serves over 150 million members across 18 countries and is at the heart of Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s explosive growth. With a range of benefits across shipping, video, music, reading, gaming and more, Prime offers its members the best of shopping and entertainment. We are looking for a passionate marketing leader to help our members get the most out of Prime. You will be Customer Obsessed and use different tools (products, content, channels) to drive member retention. You will use your understanding of marketing tools and systems to invent and simplify the ever-expanding complexity of our marketing processes to maximize results. You will use data to drive decisions, but you will also search for customer insights and anecdotes to discover new ways to engage Prime members. You will have a willingness to move fast and experiment often, continually testing, measuring and evolving marketing to engage new and existing members. You will own high-profile goals and influence other teams to embrace the value of engaging and retaining Prime members. Most importantly, you will bring an enthusiasm for marketing and a desire to make an impact on the business.

The ideal candidate is an independent, creative problem solver with great business acumen, who prioritizes effectively in a fast-moving environment and communicates clearly and persuasively with key stakeholders. This person is able to drive excellence not only in the programs they own, but with their colleagues in marketing, product management, and other Amazon teams in Retail, Digital, and Advertising as well. They are passionate about their customers and their ongoing interaction with Prime and have successfully demonstrated increasing customer engagement while working in a crowded and noisy environment.

Primary responsibilities include:

Develop and launch new marketing programs that maximize engagement and retention for Prime members
Partner with other Prime Marketing teams to create a cohesive and integrated customer experience across all touchpoints
Develop and execute content prioritization frameworks on owned channels
Track and analyze performance data and optimize programs for results
Use analytical insights to create actionable strategies that will help increase team\xe2\x80\x99s effectiveness against marketing goals
Collaborate with product management to launch new Prime engagement products
Influence product roadmaps by developing use cases for new and existing marketing tools
Influence global Prime teams to build marketing programs and adopt best practices
Proven ability managing the full lifecycle of complex marketing initiatives for which you define the strategy and measurement with limited guidance
Ability to analyze data from multiple sources to back up assumptions, identify opportunities\xe2\x80\x99, and measure impact of marketing campaigns against business outcomes
Experience presenting metrics and progress to goal to c-suite stakeholders
Proven ability to influence and communicate effectively in a fast-paced and highly cross-functional organization
Experience with A/B multivariate testing
MBA or equivalent
Ability to work on a diverse team or with a diverse range of coworkers

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Title: b'Research Intern - Neural Architecture Search'
Summary: b'We are building a highly performant open-source scalable platform (Archai) which allows new NAS algorithms to be written with a few lines of python code.'
Details:
b'Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

We are looking for research interns to work with us to invent the next generation of neural architecture search (NAS) algorithms. While deep learning has had tremendous impact in recent years, coming up with new architectures for new tasks/datasets is still a game of trial and error especially under constraints of latency/memory/flops. Increasingly state-of-the-art is being held by NAS-based methods. Help us discover the next cornerstone architecture for language modeling and vision via NAS! We are building a highly performant open-source scalable platform (Archai) which allows new NAS algorithms to be written with a few lines of python code. Archai also acts as delivery vehicle for our research. For example Archai has a highly performant implementation of Petridish which grows models from small to big and produces a gallery of models on the trade-off curve of flops/latency/memory vs. accuracy.
Responsibilities
Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s best researchers, interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, students are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.
Qualifications
In addition to the qualifications below, you\xe2\x80\x99ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.

Required Qualifications
Must be currently enrolled in a PhD program in Computer Science, Machine Learning or a related STEM field.
At least one NAS/AutoML related publication in top tier venues like NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, CVPR, ECCV, ICCV, NAACL, ACL etc.
At least one year of experience in PyTorch and distributed training of deep learning models.
Preferred Qualifications
Comfortable with recent advances in language modeling.
Demonstrated ability to develop original research agendas.
Must be able to collaborate effectively with other researchers and product development teams.
Excellent interpersonal skills, cross-group, and cross-culture collaboration.
Ability to think unconventionally to derive creative and innovative solutions.

Title: b'Recreational Therapist - Per Diem'
Summary: b'Supervise and train RT students during internship at hospital.\nREQUIRED EXPERIENCE: Completion of coursework and clinical internships.'
Details:
b'OBJECTIVE SUMMARY: Recreation Therapy (RT) contributes to the rehabilitation process by improving and maintaining physical, cognitive, emotional, and social functioning of the patients. Patients are able to maximize their independence in the home, community, and work through RT treatments to utilize leisure interests as treatment, provide leisure education, and adapt the leisure needs of patients.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

The Recreation Therapist is a member of the multidisciplinary Rehabilitation Team and works together with other therapies to best serve the needs of patients in the swing bed program and medical/surgery unit as determined by the physician. Primary responsibilities include:
Obtain Physician orders for recreation therapy services
Complete initial evaluation within 72 hours of admission
Develop patient-centered goals and care plan
Complete weekly progress summaries forms
Maintain documentation such as assessments, treatment, progress notes and care plans
Provide clinical services including 1:1 treatments, group treatments, co-treatments with other disciplines and community outings
Implement treatment interventions and frequency of visits based on patient\xe2\x80\x99s assessed needs, abilities and limitations
Provide community re-integration outings for patients when appropriate and in response to Physician order.
Attend care planning meetings as part of the interdisciplinary team
Develops and updates multidisciplinary treatment plans
Provides community resource packet for patients and caregivers as needed or requested
Provides/completes transportation applications as needed
Provide leisure and community education to patient and/or family when appropriate
Provide adapted leisure equipment as needed
Educates/trains CNA staff in assistance of RT activities
Supervise and coordinate activity staff and volunteers related to RT services
Supervise and train RT students during internship at hospital
Educate and advocate Recreation Therapy and Therapeutic Recreation services to patients, staff and community
Attend and participate in professional workshops, conferences, and/or seminars to keep abreast of recent research and techniques as part of continuing education

REQUIRED EDUCATION: Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Recreation Therapy or Therapeutic Recreation

PREFERRED EDUCATION: Same as above

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE: Completion of coursework and clinical internships

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE: 1-2 years of experience working with physical disabilities

ADDITIONAL ELIGIBILITY QUALIFICATIONS: Certification as a Certified Therapeutic Recreational Specialist (CTRS) by the National Council for Therapeutic Recreation Certification (NCTRC). Must be registered with the State as a CTRS.

SKILLS:


Ability to work well with others
Work in a collaborative effort with employees within the department and in other departments
Effective oral and written communication skills
Ability to problem solve independently when circumstances warrant such action
Must be flexible and have organizational skills
Provide quality customer service to patients, visitors, general public, media and fellow employees
Consistently treat patients with dignity and respect

WORK ENVIRONMENT: Hospital setting within temperature controlled environment.

Title: b'Senior Program Manager - Data Policies'
Summary: b'Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Computer Science or Engineering or Mathematics or Physics or IT technical discipline or in place of 3+ years of internship or 3+ years of\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Microsoft\xe2\x80\x99s Azure Data Governance builds products to simplify data management and governance of data estates spanning on-premises and cloud environments capable of processing data of all shapes and sizes. We\xe2\x80\x99re building a solution to empower enterprises to digitally transform while ensuring right use of data with centralized governance at scale through Azure.

Your work will make it simple for our enterprise customers to understand and control what data is collected and easily manage who has access to that data and for what purpose. The product you\xe2\x80\x99ll build will make data discovery, access and use \xe2\x80\x93 simple, compliant and trustworthy.

You\xe2\x80\x99ll be working with a variety of data and security technologies at the apex of scale in collaboration with technical product managers and engineers. You\xe2\x80\x99ll have an opportunity to learn from leaders in the field who\xe2\x80\x99ve created the foundations of modern analytics and database technologies.

Do you want to learn about different data technologies and how to make them secure and privacy compliant? Join this team!
Responsibilities
Senior Program Managers on this team are responsible for working with Customers, Program Managers, Designers and Engineers to ensure that product feature requirements are clearly defined, accepted by customers, actionable by engineering and progress is communicated to other members of the team. You\xe2\x80\x99ll be working to discover and validate scenarios and Jobs to be Done for users involved in managing data governance.

You\xe2\x80\x99ll be responsible for:
Gathering and grooming functional and non-functional requirements for policy-based enforcement of data access, retention and sharing entitlements
Working with customers and other PMs to validate the solutions targeted for development
Work with customers, partners, and the engineering team to define and deliver impactful User Experiences
Drive user research, telemetry, and A/B testing to provide best in class data-driven insights
Work with Customers and UX designers to design experiences that are both highly effective and aesthetically pleasing.
Unblocking engineering teams working on the policies platform by sourcing feedback and coordination with other PMs on the governance team and partner teams in Azure Data

This role requires working with various remote engineering and PM teams across Redmond, California, Shanghai and Bangalore.
Qualifications
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Computer Science or Engineering or Mathematics or Physics or IT technical discipline or in place of 3+ years of internship or 3+ years of industry engineering experience
5+ years professional experience in product design or product management
Outstanding spoken and written communication skills
Previous experience in data technology or security fields
Preferred Qualifications:
Great curiosity and willingness to question
High enthusiasm, integrity, ingenuity, results-orientation, self-motivation, and resourcefulness in a fast-paced competitive environment.
Love the next problem, the next experiment, the next partner
Have a deep desire to work collaboratively, solve problems with groups, find win/win solutions and celebrate successes
Get excited by the challenge of hard technical problems
Solve problems by always leading with deep passion and empathy for customers

Title: b'Marketing Manager, Prime Video International'
Summary: b'4+ years of professional non-internship marketing experience.\nExperience building, executing and scaling cross-functional marketing programs from concept to\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Experience building, executing and scaling cross-functional marketing programs from concept to completion
4+ years of professional non-internship marketing experience
Experience using data and metrics to measure impact and determine improvements
Experience using Microsoft Excel to manipulate and analyze data
BA/BS required
3+ years relevant work experience in roles requiring data analysis, process improvements, creative problem solving, and cross-functional collaboration
Intermediate to advanced Excel skills

Help shape the future of digital entertainment with Amazon! Our mission is to change the way customers around the world consume video entertainment, offering the broadest selection of premium video available within a single experience and accessible across devices.

As Marketing Manager for Prime Video Channels, you will be part of Prime Video\xe2\x80\x99s International Marketing team and responsible for driving a best in class customer experience by (1) executing campaigns that feature new movie and TV content from Prime Video Channels, (2) crafting plans for targeting and launching promotional campaigns, and (3) developing messaging, content segmentation, and customer segmentation strategies (across Prime and non-Prime customers) to increase customer acquisition, engagement and retention with Prime Video Channels.

You will also contribute to the development and testing of new product features, working closely with our Amazon Video International Expansion Marketing, Product and Tech teams.

You\xe2\x80\x99ll have an eye for compelling merchandising, an aptitude for data-analysis, and a passion for continuous content testing. You will hold a high bar for measurement of merchandising activities and will define success metrics, measurement methods and reporting processes for your efforts. You will learn from and share best practices across Amazon Video teams. A passion for movies and TV shows is a plus! Our environment is fast-paced and requires someone who is flexible, detail-oriented, and comfortable working effectively in a deadline-driven work environment.

Marketing Manager Duties & Responsibilities will include:

Owning O&O marketing channels (ex: storefront, X-site, outbound...) for the Prime Video Channels business line, defining the marketing strategy and the content calendar, leading the roadmap for this channel to increase viewer acquisition and engagement.
Creating and scheduling individual merchandising campaigns to the international Prime Video homepages across website, mobile apps, and living room devices including new content launch support and seasonal promotional campaigns.
Optimizing content campaigns, messaging and navigation through frequent testing and data analysis, documenting the results, sharing best practices, and forming recommendations for next steps.
Collaborating across business lines and with internal teams to manage calendar and share of voice allocation across high visibility placements and devices.
Working closely with product and tech teams to test and implement new features and influence product roadmap based on PV international requirements and priorities.
Partnering with our marketing and content acquisition teams to craft and execute promotional events and bespoke content launches.
Identifying opportunities for content scheduling and process efficiency and automation, working cross-functionally to implement them.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrated experience using data and metrics to measure performance and determine improvements
Ability to conceptualize and execute projects, with strong bias for action and ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
Comfortable operating with considerable autonomy and possess decision making skills when faced with ambiguity
Experience writing customer-facing content that is on-brand, relevant, and tailored to online customers
Experience managing large amounts of data
Ability to analyze data quantitatively and use customer research, data and metrics to back up assumptions, identify opportunities, and assess the efficacy of marketing programs
Understanding and use of web metrics to measure performance
XML/HTML skills: no need to hand-code, but you can troubleshoot
Comfortable with a varied set of software and editing tools. Ability to learn new tools quickly
Familiarity with databases and SQL

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us'

Administrative

Title: b'Research Intern - Maturing Responsible AI Practices'
Summary: b'Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship.'
Details:
b"Virtual Internship

Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship.

Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

Aether is a cross-company board that plays a key role in Microsoft's work to operationalize responsible AI at scale, with efforts on formulating and making recommendations on issues and processes\xe2\x80\x94and with hosting deep dives on technical challenges and tools around responsible AI. Aether working groups focus on important opportunity areas, including human-AI interaction and collaboration, bias and fairness, intelligibility and transparency, reliability and safety, privacy, and security of AI. Microsoft researchers actively lead and participate in the work of Aether, conducting research across disciplines and engaging with organizations and experts inside and outside of the company.
Responsibilities
Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s best researchers, interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, students are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer

Interns will be working with Aether to investigate and advance the professional practice of responsible AI in areas such as fairness, human-AI interaction, reliability & safety.
Qualifications
In addition to the qualifications below, you\xe2\x80\x99ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.

Required Qualifications
Must be currently enrolled in a PhD program in a relevant field.
Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship
Preferred Qualifications
Demonstrated experience conducting scholarly research in at least one of the following: advancing professional practice; organizational readiness; organizational psychology; maturity models; AND at least one of the following: AI fairness, human-AI interaction, AI reliability & safety.

Demonstrated experience in either qualitative or quantitative social science methods such as in-depth interviewing, focus groups, surveys.

Demonstrated experience planning, conducting, and reporting scholarly research
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Title: b'Research Intern - XR for Productivity Experiences'
Summary: b'Must have the capability to run face-2-face user studies during the internship (with necessary COVID precautions).\nInterns put inquiry and theory into practice.'
Details:
b'Virtual Internship

Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship.

Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

Augmented and Virtual Reality provide an opportunity to fundamentally change how many people work. XR allows us to remove the boundaries of physical displays and envision dramatically new customer experiences. Delivering on this promise requires deep integration between hardware, software and user experience, and many challenges remain in all three categories.

Microsoft Research is at the forefront of this innovation and is invested in many areas of research necessary for this vision to be achieved. In working towards this goal, it is imperative that we design experiences that meet the needs of a broad range of users with different background and accessibility levels. That requires us to build a team with diverse perspectives and open to the perspectives and needs of others. The research we do and resulting solutions hold the promise to directly impact hundreds of millions of users and enable a future of work which is currently unimaginable.
Responsibilities
Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s best researchers, interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, students are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.

Over the course of this internship, the intern will start with XR systems designed and built within MSR, augment them with new capabilities and run user studies on the resulting system. The primary area of investment for the intern will be in software and novel experience. It is our expectation that the subject matter is of broad interest to the XR community and that we will collaborate with the intern with an eye towards publishable results.
Qualifications
In addition to the qualifications below, you\xe2\x80\x99ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.

Required Qualifications
Must be currently enrolled in a PhD program in Computer Science or a related STEM field.
Must have at least one year of experience building virtual or augmented reality software in Unity.
Must have the capability to run face-2-face user studies during the internship (with necessary COVID precautions).
Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship
Preferred Qualifications
Should have at least one year of experience designing, running and analyzing user research studies.
Should have at least one year of experience in designing human perception studies.
Should have at least on year of familiarity with the HCI characteristics of large displays and multiple displays.
Should have experience authoring and publishing research in the fields of HCI and/or VR.

Title: b'Research Intern - Language & Intelligent Assistance'
Summary: b'Our research internships tackle challenging research problems with the aim of developing solutions for real-world, large-scale problems and publishing the\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

Researchers in the Language and Intelligent Assistance research area are making and harnessing advances in machine learning and natural language processing, to enable machines to understand natural language and build the next generation of intelligence assistance. Our research applies artificial intelligence (AI) to empower people to achieve more. We advance the state-of-the-art in AI while providing practical solutions to real-world problems and translating core technologies into practice.

We are seeking candidates for several internship positions with experience in natural language processing (e.g. question answering, semantic parsing, conversational modeling and dialog systems, cross-lingual models, grounded text generation, bias and offensiveness handling, etc.), deep learning (specifically generative models, transfer learning, weakly supervised learning, and privacy-preserving learning), or intelligent assistance (e.g. interactive systems, personalization, task completion assistance). Our research internships tackle challenging research problems with the aim of developing solutions for real-world, large-scale problems and publishing the results in top tier machine learning and natural language processing venues.

Title: b'Research Intern, Applied Research - Natural Language Process...'
Summary: b'Our research spans multiple areas across NLP and machine learning, including deep learning/neural networks, machine translation, natural language understanding\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Facebook is seeking Research Interns to join our Natural Language Processing teams in Menlo Park, California, Redmond, Washington, and Seattle, Washington. These teams are part of the Facebook AI Applied Research and Messenger Assistant organizations within Facebook, working to advance the state of the art in natural language understanding and generation, and deploys these systems at scale to break down language barriers, enable people to understand and communicate with anyone, and to provide a safe experience\xe2\x80\x94no matter what language they speak.The opportunities and challenges of this work are immense. Billions of people use our services to connect and communicate in their preferred language, but many of these languages lack traditional NLP resources and our systems need to be robust to the informal tone, slang and typos often found in daily communication.Our research spans multiple areas across NLP and machine learning, including deep learning/neural networks, machine translation, natural language understanding and generation, low-resource NLP, question answering, dialogue, and cross-lingual and cross-domain transfer learning.As a Research Intern, you will help us apply cutting-edge NLP algorithms to a wide range of media understanding challenges at Facebook. The duration of this internship is 16 weeks with Summer, Fall, and Winter start dates. Internships will be awarded on a rolling basis and candidates are encouraged to apply early. To learn more about our research visit https://ai.facebook.com/.

Perform research to advance the science and technology of intelligent machines.
Develop novel and accurate NLP algorithms and systems, leveraging deep learning and machine learning on big data resources.
Contribute research that can be applied to Facebook product development.
Analyze and improve efficiency, scalability, and stability of various deployed systems.

Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a PhD degree.
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.
experience in PyTorch, Python or C/C++.
Research and/or work experience in machine learning, deep learning, and/or Natural Language Processing.

Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.
Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com."

Title: b'Research Intern - Natural Language Processing'

Details:
b'Virtual Internship

Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship.

Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

Microsoft Research \xe2\x80\x93 Redmond seeks an outstanding intern in the area of developing new natural language processing models.
Responsibilities
Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s best researchers, interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, students are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.

Must be currently enrolled in a PhD program in Computer Science or a related STEM field.

Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship

Ability to develop original research agendas.

Knowledge of natural language processing.

Strong coding skills in Python and deep learning platforms.

Ability to collaborate effectively with other researchers and product development teams.

Excellent interpersonal skills, cross-group, and cross-culture collaboration.

Title: b'Project Engineer'
Summary: b'Experience: A previous internship with a construction-related firm or a minimum of two years of project management construction experience.'
Details:
b"Our global construction group is comprised of Orascom Construction subsidiaries, The Weitz Company, Contrack Watts Inc., and Watts Constructors. Collectively, we specialize in Commercial, Federal, and Industrial construction projects with a best-in-class Supply Chain segment. We have forged our reputation by constantly seeking new construction innovations and technology that provide our clients and employees with predictable, reliable, and collaborative services. Our commitment to delivering a top quality product has resulted in long-standing customer relationships and recognition by industry rankings as one of the top contractors in the United States.
We view employees as our most valuable asset, and the key to our success. That s why we provide team members a career (not just a job), supported by training and development opportunities, and a positive, collaborative work environment. We offer the resources of a large company, while preserving our small company feel. Employees are encouraged to work hard, have fun and build strong relationships along the way! Community involvement, diversity and inclusion, and employee empowerment are central to our Company s culture.

What We Offer:

Competitive Pay and Benefits
Strong Company and Safety Culture
Rewarding Bonus Program
Generous Paid Time Off Provisions
401K Retirement Savings Plan With Company Match
Training and Educational Assistance Opportunities

Contrack Watts, Inc. is seeking a Project Engineer to work on one of our projects in Whidbey Island, WA. This role must be committed to traveling to construction job sites around the United States. The Project Engineer may spend 6 to 24 months on one project before traveling to the next project, as business demands.
The Project Engineer assists the Assistant Project Manager or Project Manager and Project Superintendent in project planning, buyout, project management and close-out for one or more assigned projects. The Project Engineer actively gathers information on the status of his/her projects and keeps the Assistant Project Manager or Project Manager informed of issues that could affect schedule and budget. This position also assists in maintaining a focus on safety throughout project duration. The Project Engineer typically reports to the Project Manager or other assigned Manager.

What You'll Do:

Proceed with work only to the extent of an executed contract and executed change orders.
Review and enforce all prime contract terms and obligations.
Observe work in progress during field visits, question any procedures or end-products that don t appear appropriate and discuss with the Project Superintendent (PS) for resolution.
Assist with problem resolution with subs, vendors, architects and owners.
Assist with the implementation of project plan updates.
Review weekly construction progress to ensure the project plan is followed and schedule is maintained. Initiate recommendations to keep project on schedule.
Monitor, verify and expedite material and equipment deliveries, shipping commitments. Advise Project Manager of anticipated late deliveries or issues that could affect the project schedule.
Negotiate assigned contract changes, subcontracts and purchase orders within delegated authority.
Negotiate issues and execute subcontract and vendor change orders within delegated authority. Follow up to expedite pricing response.
Ensure sub/PO amendments and change orders are issued.
Respond effectively to RFI s and coordinate response in the field. Verify impact and pricing, if required.
Track and resolve subcontractor and materials supplier requests for change. Ensure the appropriate subcontract amendments are issued on a timely basis.
Assist with the project schedule updates, as requested.
Review submittals for accuracy and compliance with plans and specs. Coordinate from separate trades and check all dimensions at interfaces between trades.
Ensure that shop drawing and submittal review and approval process is effective and efficient.
Draft accurate subcontracts/PO Exhibit A for review with subs.
Maintain and update accurate buyout, closeout, submittal, change order, RFI and insurance logs. Distribute on the requested schedule.
Post RFI responses on drawings.
Assemble subcontract/PO agreement and distribute document to subs, vendors and the project team. Follow-up to assure the document is executed.
Distribute proposed contract changes for approvals. Follow up to assure document is executed.
Assemble approved change orders and distribute to appropriate parties. Maintain accurate subcontract change order materials and information. Distribute for pricing. Follow up on delinquent subs and pricing.
Ensure all contract documents are properly posted with all changes and clarifications. Maintain record set.
Assist QCM to ensure project closeout is completed promptly.
Work with the Project Superintendent to prepare as-built drawings from field record set and the project record documents.
Other duties as assigned.

What We're Looking For:

Education: Industry-related college degree is required; an equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
Experience: A previous internship with a construction-related firm or a minimum of two years of project management construction experience.
Skills: Good engineering and construction management skills are important. Individual must have good communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively with the owner, architect, and internal project team. A high level of integrity is required. Good time management and project organization skills are essential.
Technology: Must be proficient in basic computer software programs such as Microsoft Office products (Outlook, Work, PowerPoint, Excel), and must be able to learn project management software (JDE, Procore, Asta, Bluebeam, etc.). To perform the job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each previously stated duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and ability necessary to succeed.
Visa sponsorship is not available for this position at this time.
The Company does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or agencies. Any resume submitted to any employee of the Company without a prior written search agreement will be considered unsolicited and the property of The Company. Please, no phone calls or emails.
The Company is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment (minorities, females, and veterans, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other protected categories in accordance with state and federal laws). The Company is a drug and alcohol free workplace and background checks are required if applicable."

Title: b'Research Intern - Security of Machine Learning Systems'
Summary: b'Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship.'
Details:
b"Virtual Internship

Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship.

Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

Aether is a cross-company board that plays a key role in Microsoft's work to operationalize responsible AI at scale, with efforts on formulating and making recommendations on issues and processes\xe2\x80\x94and with hosting deep dives on technical challenges and tools around responsible AI. Aether working groups focus on important opportunity areas, including human-AI interaction and collaboration, bias and fairness, intelligibility and transparency, reliability and safety, privacy, and security of AI. Microsoft researchers actively lead and participate in the work of Aether, conducting research across disciplines and engaging with organizations and experts inside and outside of the company.

Aether and Microsoft Research seek exceptional interns working at the intersection of machine learning, systems and security. Our team brings together experts from the fields of artificial intelligence, machine learning theory, robust and adversarial learning methods, and computer systems security. We work collaboratively across these areas and across Microsoft to create new theoretical and practical advances towards identifying risks on AI systems from adversarial attacks and improving the security of AI-driven systems. Internship projects this summer will study the threat posed by malicious behavior in real-world contexts, and investigate new algorithmic advances and systems architectures for training and deployment that may help protect from these threats.

We are particularly interested in candidates with prior experience in machine learning, particularly in deep learning and adversarial/robust machine learning, and computer security (especially related to vulnerabilities and defenses for AI-driven systems).
Responsibilities
Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s best researchers, interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, students are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.
Qualifications
In addition to the qualifications below, you\xe2\x80\x99ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.
Required Qualifications
Must be accepted to or currently enrolled in a PhD program in CS, EE or a related STEM field.
Must have at least 1 year of experience in conducting research, writing peer-reviewed publications and software development.
Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship.

Preferred Qualifications
Ability to think unconventionally to derive creative and innovative solutions.
Actively conducting research in at least one of the following areas: machine learning, computer security.
Demonstrated ability to develop original research agendas.
Ability to collaborate effectively with your mentor and others in the lab on new research projects.
Excellent interpersonal skills, cross-group, and cross-culture collaboration.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work."

Details:

Dandelion Nutrition is a private nutrition group practice in Seattle, WA. We're seeking an experienced eating disorder Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN) to join our team!

Job Description

Provide nutrition counseling and medical nutrition therapy to clients struggling with food and body image issues.
Maintain thorough, accurate, and timely documentation of client care
Coordinate care with other care providers/ treatment team
Perform relevant administrative tasks
Create and maintain professional relationships with other providers to ensure referrals and an excellent reputation in the community

Have eagerness for ongoing learning and professional growth

Sea Mar proudly serves all persons without regard to race, ethnicity, immigration status, gender, or sexual orientation, and regardless of ability to pay for services. Sea Mar's network of services includes more than 90 medical, dental, and behavioral health clinics and a wide variety of nutritional, social, and educational services. We are recruiting for the following position(s):
Would you like weekends, holidays, and evenings free?
Would you like to be immersed in Spanish during your workday?
Would you like a supportive and caring team?
Would you like to work with pregnant moms and babies?
Would like to have the time to build relationships with patients to ensure the best care? Then try our Maternity Support Services in King County. You are welcome here.
Social Worker for MSS (Licensed Master's Degree or Bachelors with Counseling Certificate) - Posting #21163
Position Summary:
Great opportunity to work with expectant moms and babies in a community health setting. Full-time Social Worker position available for our Maternal Support Program Services in Seattle - White Center. Full-time employees may work up to five days per week (40 hours).
The Social Worker is to provide brief, culturally relevant counseling interventions, education, case management and crisis intervention to clients based on areas identified in screening/assessment and in keeping with the core services of the First Steps program. This is a great opportunity to work with pregnant moms and babies in the community.
Qualifications:

Working at Sea Mar Community Health Centers is more than just a job, it\xe2\x80\x99s a fulfilling career with opportunity for advancement. The fringe benefits surpass most companies.
