Title: b'Campaign Manager, Prime Video Business Development'
Summary: b'4+ years of professional non-internship marketing experience.\nExperience building, executing and scaling cross-functional marketing programs from concept to\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Experience building, executing and scaling cross-functional marketing programs from concept to completion
4+ years of professional non-internship marketing experience
Experience using data and metrics to measure impact and determine improvements
Experience using Microsoft Excel to manipulate and analyze data
4+ years partner marketing management experience working with external partners

Amazon is seeking a talented, highly motivated and experienced individual to join the Prime Video (PV) global Business Development (BD) team as Campaign Manager. This role is responsible for developing programmatic solutions that support the strategy and execution of global marketing initiatives across our third party distribution partnerships that drive promotion and awareness of Prime Video and Amazon Originals. The focus of this role will be on building scalable processes to tackle input pain points and streamline delivery of global marketing efforts and programs across the PV BD team. This role will be core to the team, supporting teammates by establishing tools that help execute both global and regional campaigns. Your goals will be to build efficient processes with Amazon Studios marketing teams, and establish efficient working relationships with Prime Video regional teams to drive effective engagement across key global partnerships.

As a Campaign Manager, you will support the execution of global marketing campaigns that increase overall market awareness of the brand, drive subscription growth, and grow customer engagement. A successful candidate will be expected to think and act both strategically and tactically - from the creation of plans, to the execution, and analysis of business impact. He or she will be will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, and able to think big while paying careful attention to detail. This is a highly visible position that will interact at all levels of the worldwide business development team. The ideal candidate is a passionate marketing leader who has a track record of achieving (and measuring) great results through third party partnerships and product launches. This marketing leader needs to be passionate about optimizing processes that allow stakeholders to move quickly and maximize third party distribution partnerships. He or she will be known for trying new things and identifying areas of scale. Our ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to be creative, to initiate and launch effective marketing partnerships and programs, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and support aggressive timelines.

Specific Responsibilities Include:

Project manage campaign execution by coordinating with Partner Marketing Managers, Studios Brand Managers, and Design Teams to secure assets and deliver to partners.
Own monthly, quarterly, and annual capacity planning exercises with design teams.
Partner with regional O&O Marketing and Merchandising teams to establish alignment on title prioritization for thematic and cultural campaigns (e.g. Awards, Halloween, Holiday, etc.).
Conduct post campaign analyses to contribute to PV-wide post-mortem reports for key title launches.
Serve as a PV BD Marketing Representative in Studios planning meetings.
Collaborate externally with Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) by building content calendars and executing on-device marketing campaigns.
Strong written skills
Lead cross-functional teams to deliver partnerships and projects on time.
Conduct business and financial analysis, including forecasting, monitoring, and reporting
You are a self-starter and can juggle multiple priorities and make things happen in a fast-paced, dynamic and often ambiguous environment
Superior communication and analytical skills, including strong ability to identify and solve ambiguous problems
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.
An entrepreneurial drive, prove ability to influence others
Strong analytic and quantitative skills - ability to use data to develop and measure marketing programs
Track record of performance excellence
Meets/exceeds Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s leadership principles requirements for this role
Meets/exceeds Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.'

Title: b'Fieldwork Placement - Washington'
Summary: b'Undergraduate Internships require a commitment of at least 10 hours a week with preferred length of internship to be 6 months or more.'
Details:
b'Overview:

Graduate Fieldwork Placements follow a standard school year schedule beginning in the fall and ending in the spring/early summer. First year students are required to work at least 16 hours per week and second year students are required to work at least 16 hours per week and second year students are required to work 20-24 hours per week. Exact schedules are decided on with the supervising clinician according to the students\xe2\x80\x99 availability and the program\xe2\x80\x99s needs. Undergraduate Internships require a commitment of at least 10 hours a week with preferred length of internship to be 6 months or more. Due to the sensitive needs of the kids and families we serve, we ask that students assist in providing a healthy transition into and out of our kids and families lives. Exact schedules are decided on with the supervising staff according to the students\xe2\x80\x99 availability and the program\xe2\x80\x99s needs.

Students are provided with the following opportunities:
An intensive orientation to Seneca\xe2\x80\x99s population served, values, philosophy, and practice at the beginning of their fieldwork placement.
An opportunity to conduct hands-on fieldwork.
Training and supervision focused on the Seneca treatment model.
Multiple and varying training opportunities presented on a wide range of topics applicable to working with children and their families.
Weekly supervision provided by a Seneca Clinician with an appropriate degree or license.
Weekly group supervision when applicable to the student\xe2\x80\x99s fieldwork agreement.
Be part of an agency dedicated to helping provide permanent families to allow the children to thrive.
Who should apply?
The training settings we offer are most appropriate for advanced students who already have some exposure to clinical populations and direct work with clients. You must be currently enrolled in a MSW graduate program with one of our partnering universities to qualify to apply. Please note: Fieldwork placements do not automatically lead to employment at Seneca.

To Apply: You will need to complete the Fieldwork Matching Form and attach it to your online application. To begin your online application, click the "Apply Now" button on this page.

Note for Post Graduate Clinical Interns:
After graduating from your master's program, you may qualify for any of the Clinician/Therapist positions at Seneca. As an employee, Seneca will assist you in gaining your hours, trainings, as well as supervision and support, as you move towards licensure. For more information about applying for a Clinical position with Seneca, please go to Employment Opportunities and browse our full-time employment openings.'

Title: b'Senior Program Manager - Data Policies'
Summary: b'Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Computer Science or Engineering or Mathematics or Physics or IT technical discipline or in place of 3+ years of internship or 3+ years of\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Microsoft\xe2\x80\x99s Azure Data Governance builds products to simplify data management and governance of data estates spanning on-premises and cloud environments capable of processing data of all shapes and sizes. We\xe2\x80\x99re building a solution to empower enterprises to digitally transform while ensuring right use of data with centralized governance at scale through Azure.

Your work will make it simple for our enterprise customers to understand and control what data is collected and easily manage who has access to that data and for what purpose. The product you\xe2\x80\x99ll build will make data discovery, access and use \xe2\x80\x93 simple, compliant and trustworthy.

You\xe2\x80\x99ll be working with a variety of data and security technologies at the apex of scale in collaboration with technical product managers and engineers. You\xe2\x80\x99ll have an opportunity to learn from leaders in the field who\xe2\x80\x99ve created the foundations of modern analytics and database technologies.

Do you want to learn about different data technologies and how to make them secure and privacy compliant? Join this team!
Responsibilities
Senior Program Managers on this team are responsible for working with Customers, Program Managers, Designers and Engineers to ensure that product feature requirements are clearly defined, accepted by customers, actionable by engineering and progress is communicated to other members of the team. You\xe2\x80\x99ll be working to discover and validate scenarios and Jobs to be Done for users involved in managing data governance.

You\xe2\x80\x99ll be responsible for:
Gathering and grooming functional and non-functional requirements for policy-based enforcement of data access, retention and sharing entitlements
Working with customers and other PMs to validate the solutions targeted for development
Work with customers, partners, and the engineering team to define and deliver impactful User Experiences
Drive user research, telemetry, and A/B testing to provide best in class data-driven insights
Work with Customers and UX designers to design experiences that are both highly effective and aesthetically pleasing.
Unblocking engineering teams working on the policies platform by sourcing feedback and coordination with other PMs on the governance team and partner teams in Azure Data

This role requires working with various remote engineering and PM teams across Redmond, California, Shanghai and Bangalore.
Qualifications
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Computer Science or Engineering or Mathematics or Physics or IT technical discipline or in place of 3+ years of internship or 3+ years of industry engineering experience
5+ years professional experience in product design or product management
Outstanding spoken and written communication skills
Previous experience in data technology or security fields
Preferred Qualifications:
Great curiosity and willingness to question
High enthusiasm, integrity, ingenuity, results-orientation, self-motivation, and resourcefulness in a fast-paced competitive environment.
Love the next problem, the next experiment, the next partner
Have a deep desire to work collaboratively, solve problems with groups, find win/win solutions and celebrate successes
Get excited by the challenge of hard technical problems
Solve problems by always leading with deep passion and empathy for customers

AZDAT #ENGGJOBS

Title: b'User Research, Data Prep, Tableau'
Summary: b'Experienced. Relevant academic or internship experience conducting User Research studies is a must , with a preference for 2+ years\xe2\x80\x99 experience as a UX\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Products and Technology
Job Details
What you\xe2\x80\x99ll be doing\xe2\x80\xa6
T ableau is looking for a User Researcher in the area of Data Preparation (Tableau Prep Builder and related features). As a member of the user research team, you will be a central figure in helping Tableau understand its current and future users. You will leverage your knowledge and skills to help people solve the world\xe2\x80\x99s problems with data. You will help individuals and organizations unlock the full potential of their data by removing barriers to finding, preparing, sharing, and maintaining data as it grows and changes. You will develop a deep knowledge of user workflows and motivations, while uncovering barriers to data preparation and self-service analytics within organizations. You will communicate insights to both management and feature teams to create experiences that customers need and love. Working with Design and Engineering, you will use your expertise in both qualitative and quantitative user research methods to build research plans that address their most pressing questions about our customers and products.
Some job responsibilities include\xe2\x80\xa6
Build and execute user research plans using appropriate quantitative and qualitative methods to produce tactical and reusable customer insights.
Develop and share expertise related to how people prepare, model, reuse, and integrate data for self-service analytics.
Lead the translation of research findings and user feedback into actionable insights and opportunities .
Communicate insights and opportunities to business and feature teams .
Contribute to the team\xe2\x80\x99s strategy for learning about user motivations and workflows .
Work with the User Research team to build the tools and practices necessary to support ongoing, iterative research for a large development team .
Find opportunities to help teams create software that users love .
Find and attract User Research talent .
Who you are\xe2\x80\xa6
Educated. Master\xe2\x80\x99s or Doctoral degree in Psychology, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), or related field.
Experienced. Relevant academic or internship experience conducting User Research studies is a must , with a preference for 2+ years\xe2\x80\x99 experience as a UX Researcher with a strong portfolio of shipping software products. Experience working in enterprise software, analytics, or cloud services is a plus.
Highly Technical. You are curious about technology and can dive deep into complex or unfamiliar topics. You have experience with relational database systems (Oracle, MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server, etc.). Experience with ETL, data preparation, or data management is a plus.
Knowledgeable. Deep knowledge of best practices for UX design principles and both qualitative and quantitative user research methodologies.
Highly Analytical. Experienced analyzing data hands-on and using analytic software products or relevant programming languages. You love understanding data, patterns and trends. Numbers are your friends. You can dig into the details but always see the big picture. Experience using one or more Tableau products (Desktop, Prep Builder and Conductor , Server, Online) is desirable.
Collaborative. Experience working in a collaborative and agile team .
Persuasive: You have great communication and interpersonal skills. You can clearly communicate ideas, effectively present research insights to a variety of audiences, and generate persuasive written and multimedia reports .
Accommodations - If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

Title: b'Lead Residential Youth Specialist (Full-Time)'
Summary: b'(2) Direct care staff may be between eighteen and twenty-one years of age if enrolled in an internship or practicum program with an accredited college or\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"Thank you for considering a career with Pioneer Human Services!
We are currently looking for a Full-Time LEAD Residential Youth Specialist for our Snohomish County Youth Programs.
These programs are comprised of the Cypress House in Lynnwood, the Sequoia House in South Everett and the Tamarack House in Marysville. Each program is located in a single family home and provides housing and support to boys between the ages of 13 to 18 who are facing emotional, behavioral and/or psychiatric challenges.
WHO WE ARE
Pioneer Human Services is a nationally recognized social enterprise with 50 facilities in operation across Washington State. We are proud to be a leading organization in the state that offers an array of treatment, housing and employment services to individuals who are overcoming the challenges of living with a criminal history, and/or struggling with substance abuse and mental health issues. Pioneer\xe2\x80\x99s goal is to provide a chance for change for people who want to turn their lives around.


You may learn more about our organization, mission, and vision here: About Us.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
The primary responsibilities of the LEAD Residential Youth Specialist is to supervise and support residents and to carry out the day-to-day operations of a Pioneer residential juvenile reentry program in ways that create a climate favorable to social and emotional development. The Lead Residential Youth Specialist is responsible for ensuring program and facility safety, monitoring resident movement, and supporting structured cognitive and behavioral-based programming designed to promote risk reduction and successful community reintegration.
WHAT YOU'LL BRING
Per WAC 388-145-1445
(1) Each direct care staff must:
(a) Be at least twenty-one years of age, unless they meet the requirements in subsection (2) of this section;
(b) Have a high school diploma or high school or equivalency course of study (GED/HSEC);
(c) Have one year of experience working directly with children. Two years of social services education may be substituted for the required experience;
(d) Have the skills and ability to work successfully with the special needs of children in care; and
(e) Have effective communication and problem solving skills.
(2) Direct care staff may be between eighteen and twenty-one years of age if enrolled in an internship or practicum program with an accredited college or university and can provide sufficient documentation.
Preferably you will bring
AA Degree or relevant college course work, continuing education and/or training in human services. OR
A bachelor's degree; or (a) At least two years of college and one year of work in a group residential program for adolescents; and (b) May substitute experience for education on a year-for-year basis in the human services or criminal justice and/or mental health system(s) including internships and/or volunteer placements
Familiarity with and understanding of \xe2\x80\x9cRight Response\xe2\x80\x9d preferred
SCHEDULE
This is a 24/7 facility, schedules could vary depending on facility need, this includes holidays and weekends.
TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS
Some travel is required, and is typically local or regional, to attend or provide training. Must have a valid driver's license and auto insurance if driving on company business, and when driving company vehicle must have driving record satisfactory to Pioneer\xe2\x80\x99s insurance carrier.
WHAT WE OFFER
Stability: We have over 50 years of success in Washington State.
Impact: Pioneer provides a chance for change to over 3,000 people on any given day.
Reputation: We are a nationally recognized non-profit with 50+ locations across Washington State.
Tuition Assistance program: Pioneer pays 100% of the tuition for a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree, and 50% for graduate programs.
Retirement Plan: Pioneer contributes 3.5% of an employees' annual compensation into retirement plans. An additional 3.5% match is offered to those who contribute 6% on their own.
Employee Recognition Programs: gift cards, additional time off, weekend getaways and other items.
Competitive industry compensation and a generous benefit plan.
Participation in the Life Assistance Program.
Public transportation reimbursement.
EEO
Pioneer Human Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities/Women/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans and does not unlawfully discriminate under federal, state, or local laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, or protected veteran status. EEO is the Law Poster EEO is the Law Poster Supplement
Pioneer Human Services is a drug-free company
In addition to pre-employment drug screening, Pioneer reserves the right to conduct random sample alcohol or drug testing of all employees. Please note that our drug-free policy includes marijuana and there are no exceptions for those with medical marijuana prescriptions.

To apply, please e-mail your resume to:
Jose.ninodeguzman@p-h-s.com"

Title: b'User Research Intern'
Summary: b'Likewise is seeking a talented and analytical UX / User Research intern to join the team and support ongoing Insights & Strategy work.'
Details:
b'Imagined and backed by Bill Gates\xe2\x80\x99 private office, Likewise is a rare early-stage startup that is thinking big, playing to win, and investing to continue its rapid growth trajectory. We provide personalized recommendations for TV, movies, books, and podcasts, based on your unique interests and tastes. Our unique combination of smart technology and real recommendations from an authentic community of real users, helps you uncover hidden gems that will become new favorites and easily stay on top of all the new entertainment options available. If you are passionate about what you do and want to be a core part of creating a household consumer name, then come talk to us about getting in on the fun!
Here are a few links to some recent coverage of Likewise (where usage is skyrocketing!):
https://bizj.us/1q2vmd
https://www.geekwire.com/2020/bill-gates-backed-st...
https://425business.com/entertainment-decision-mak...
Role
Likewise is seeking a talented and analytical UX / User Research intern to join the team and support ongoing Insights & Strategy work. This role will support both qualitative and quantitative initiatives focused on product strategy and design. This is a great opportunity to get hands on experience in an early stage and rapidly growing company.
In partnership with a small-but-fantastic team of marketers, creatives, engineers, and data geeks, you will have a great opportunity to contribute in meaningful ways and grow personally and professionally in the process. You need to have a strong bias-for-action and a passion for connecting user insights & behaviors to product strategy. If you are creative and solutions driven, and willing jump in and move fast, this internship is the perfect role for you!
Responsibilities
Work with a diverse team of product managers, UX designers and strategists to understand current and existing data needs, support initiatives, and develop and execute research plans.
Design and conduct primary research, focusing on both the current experience and potential future directions. This may include surveys, qualitative inquiry or other methods, including prototype testing and/or organizing and leading user research interviews.
Analyze data, both qualitative and quantitative analytics, to derive insights that improve the user experience, identify opportunities, and drive engagement.
Summarize and present findings in actionable ways, and share directly with stakeholders.
Assist with administrative and other tasks as required
Requirements
Experience or educational background in any of: Human Factors, Human-Computer Interaction, User Research, UX/UI Research, Design Innovation, or related fields
Background and/or interest in generating actionable user insights from both primary inquiry and/or data analysis
Bias for action and the ability to operate in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
Demonstrate innate curiosity, critical thinking, and a deep empathy for users
Excellent communications and visual storytelling skills
Experience with Survey Monkey, Validately or MixPanel a plus but not required
This internship will be hired for a duration of three months with potential for extension if mutual fit and continued work opportunities allow.
Hours can be flexible: 20-40/week
Pay: $15/hour

Title: b'Research Intern - Cloud Systems Reliability'
Summary: b'During this internship the intern will have the opportunities to work with top researchers and engineers at Microsoft Research as well as various Azure systems\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

Empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more. That\xe2\x80\x99s what inspires us, drives our work, and pushes us to challenge the status quo every day. At Microsoft, we also work to empower our employees, so they can achieve more. We believe we should each find meaning in our work and we ensure employees have the freedom and the reach to help make a difference in the world.

Microsoft Research provides a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

The cloud reliability research in Microsoft Research aims to develop practical tools and techniques that can help cloud developers adequately debug, test, configure, and monitor their systems. The research combines Distributed Systems, PL, Software Engineering, and Machine Learning techniques and spans all aspects of improving reliability and availability of large-scale cloud systems, including:
 Analyzing production data to understand how real cloud systems fail and what can be done to prevent them.
Developing practical static and dynamic analysis techniques to uncover hard-to-find bugs before production. The techniques can be evaluated and used with thousands with Microsoft software projects.
Developing practical and novel techniques for diagnosing failures, runtime monitoring, logging, & failure prevention, etc.

Over the last several years, technology arising from our research has significantly improved reliability of many Azure products and has led to publications in top systems conferences, including a Best Paper at ACM SOSP 2019.

During this internship the intern will have the opportunities to work with top researchers and engineers at Microsoft Research as well as various Azure systems to develop innovative solutions to challenging research problems in the above technical areas. You will also have the unique opportunity to evaluate your techniques on thousands of software projects in Microsoft.
Responsibilities
Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s best researchers, interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, students are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.
Qualifications
In addition to the qualifications below, you\xe2\x80\x99ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.

Required Qualification
Must be currently enrolled in a PhD program in Computer Science or a related STEM field.
Preferred Qualifications
Familiarity with common failures of cloud systems and techniques for debugging, testing, configuring, and monitoring large-scale cloud systems
Familiarity with existing distributed systems, software engineering, and machine learning techniques to improve software reliability
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.'

Details:
b"Company Description

Dandelion Nutrition is a private nutrition group practice in Seattle, WA. We're seeking an experienced eating disorder Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN) to join our team!

Job Description

Provide nutrition counseling and medical nutrition therapy to clients struggling with food and body image issues.
Maintain thorough, accurate, and timely documentation of client care
Coordinate care with other care providers/ treatment team
Perform relevant administrative tasks
Create and maintain professional relationships with other providers to ensure referrals and an excellent reputation in the community
The position will be exclusively remote for the time being d/t COVID, but will likely include in-office work when safe to resume in-office client sessions
Likely 3 days per week to start, though we would love for you to grow into full time

Qualifications

Fully Health at Every Size (HAES) aligned

The ideal candidate will...
Have strong clinical and counseling skills
Have a passion for helping clients achieve recovery from disordered eating
Have strong initiative and problem-solving skills
Have eagerness for ongoing learning and professional growth
Have strong interpersonal and written and verbal communication skills
Have high standards of personal and professional integrity and ethics, with the ability to practice a high level of confidentiality regarding clients and practice
Be knowledgeable and experienced in nutrition counseling approaches and modalities (i.e. motivational interviewing), intuitive eating, and MNT
Be self-motivated and self-directed
Have motivation in helping grow the business
Additional Information

Paid hourly based on workload (hours are not guaranteed)
Health insurance available to employees consistently working 32 hours/week
Paid sick and safe time
Employer matching company retirement plan
Flexible schedule and reasonable workload
Not your typical nursing home or hospital job!
Mentoring to help you grow as a dietitian
All the perks of private practice without having to manage a business or deal with insurance billing
Please upload a cover letter or a personalized video including why you think you are the best fit for this position at Dandelion Nutrition."

Title: b'Research Intern - Neural Architecture Search'
Summary: b'We are building a highly performant open-source scalable platform (Archai) which allows new NAS algorithms to be written with a few lines of python code.'
Details:
b'Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

We are looking for research interns to work with us to invent the next generation of neural architecture search (NAS) algorithms. While deep learning has had tremendous impact in recent years, coming up with new architectures for new tasks/datasets is still a game of trial and error especially under constraints of latency/memory/flops. Increasingly state-of-the-art is being held by NAS-based methods. Help us discover the next cornerstone architecture for language modeling and vision via NAS! We are building a highly performant open-source scalable platform (Archai) which allows new NAS algorithms to be written with a few lines of python code. Archai also acts as delivery vehicle for our research. For example Archai has a highly performant implementation of Petridish which grows models from small to big and produces a gallery of models on the trade-off curve of flops/latency/memory vs. accuracy.
Responsibilities
Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s best researchers, interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, students are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.
Qualifications
In addition to the qualifications below, you\xe2\x80\x99ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.

Required Qualifications
Must be currently enrolled in a PhD program in Computer Science, Machine Learning or a related STEM field.
At least one NAS/AutoML related publication in top tier venues like NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, CVPR, ECCV, ICCV, NAACL, ACL etc.
At least one year of experience in PyTorch and distributed training of deep learning models.
Preferred Qualifications
Comfortable with recent advances in language modeling.
Demonstrated ability to develop original research agendas.
Must be able to collaborate effectively with other researchers and product development teams.
Excellent interpersonal skills, cross-group, and cross-culture collaboration.
Ability to think unconventionally to derive creative and innovative solutions.

Title: b'Intern - Modeling & Theory, LFP Phase & High-Frequency Burst...'
Summary: b'Must be able to start on either June 7th or June 21st, 2021, and commit to the full 10-week internship time period.\nMust be 18 years of age or older.'
Details:
b'Intern \xe2\x80\x93 Modeling & Theory, LFP Phase & High-Frequency Bursts
The mission of the Allen Institute is to unlock the complexities of bioscience and advance our knowledge to improve human health. Using an open science, multi-scale, team-oriented approach, the Allen Institute focuses on accelerating foundational research, developing standards and models, and cultivating new ideas to make a broad, transformational impact on science.
The MindScope program seeks to understand the transformations, sometimes called computations, in coding and decoding that lead from photons to behavior and conscious experience by observing, perturbing and modeling the physical transformations of signals in the cortical-thalamic visual system within a few perception-action cycles.
We are seeking a summer intern to join the Modeling & Theory department for the summer of 2021. They will work on Real-time prediction of LFP phase and high-frequency bursts using recurrent neural networks.
Neuronal firing is entrained by specific features of the ongoing local field potential (LFP) oscillations, such as power and phase of certain frequency bands, as well as other events such as transient (<150ms) high frequency bursts. We are interested in exploring how the ongoing oscillations modulate evoked responses elicited by optical or electrical stimulation. Thus, the ability to estimate the phase (and other features) in the LFP signal just prior to the stimulus is an important aspect of response analysis. In two scenarios the phase estimation relies only on the signal prior to the stimulus onset: when the estimation is computed in real-time for closed-loop systems; and when the stimulus causes a large artifact (for e.g. optogenetic or electrical stimuli), rendering the signal close to or after the stimulus unusable. In these situations, the phase has been estimated using computational models in time and frequency domain, which both have certain limitations.
Recurrent neural networks (RNNs) have been shown to work well for predicting temporally evolving systems. In this internship, the student will develop and train an RNN to forward-predict the phase of LFP and compare this technique to existing techniques for phase estimation. The RNN based method may be applicable more generally to any type of feature prediction in field potentials (such as high frequency bursts), unlike existing methods, which are designed specifically for predicting the phase. As a second part of the project, the student will test the generalization of the method to other LFP features besides the phase of the oscillatory signal. Finally, the trained RNN parameters could be encoding more general information about the state of the animal, such as arousal, level of consciousness etc. This could be an interesting exploratory extension of the project if time permits.
The Allen Institute believes that team science significantly benefits from the participation of diverse voices, experiences and backgrounds. High-quality science can only be produced when it includes different perspectives. We are committed to increasing diversity across every team and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for this role.
Educational Objectives
Implement and train a recurrent neural network
Learn and implement basic signal processing used to extrapolate features of oscillatory signals (filtering, spectrogram, coherence, Hilbert transforms etc.)
Learn about measurements used to quantify evoked electroencephalographic (EEG) and Neuropixels LFP responses to stimulation (optogenetic and electrical) in mice

Applicant Requirements
Currently enrolled in an accredited associate, undergraduate, or master\xe2\x80\x99s program
2021 graduates of an accredited associate, undergraduate, or master\xe2\x80\x99s program will be considered
Must be able to start on either June 7th or June 21st, 2021, and commit to the full 10-week internship time period
Must be eligible to work in the U.S. for the program duration
Must be 18 years of age or older

Physical Demands
Fine motor movements in fingers/hands to operate computers and other office equipment; lab equipment

Note: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the expected functions. This description reflects management\xe2\x80\x99s expectations of the physical demands of this role; it does not proscribe or restrict the tasks that may be assigned.
Position Type/Expected Hours of Work
This is a limited-term position for no more than 10 weeks
The expected work schedule is 35 \xe2\x80\x93 40 hours a week over this period
This role is currently able to work remotely due to COVID-19 and our focus on employee safety. We are a Washington State employer, and remote work must be performed in Washington State. We continue to evaluate the safest options for our employees. As restrictions are lifted in relation to COVID-19, this role will return to work onsite.

Additional Comments
**Please note, this opportunity does not sponsor work visas and has no relocation assistance**

It is the policy of the Allen Institute to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, the Allen Institute will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities'

Title: b'Store Management Internship - South of Seattle (Current Stud...'
Summary: b'Actively participate in internship program training activities, developmental opportunities and events.\nCarry out principle duties and responsibilities by\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Description:
ALL ABOUT TARGET
As part of our collaborative and guest-obsessed team, you help us create an experience that makes guests say, \xe2\x80\x9cI love Target!\xe2\x80\x9d When you work at Target, you\xe2\x80\x99re helping every family discover the joy in everyday life. You\xe2\x80\x99re working alongside a dedicated team that brings their passion and pride to all that they do.

ALL ABOUT STORES LEADERSHIP
As a Stores Executive Intern, you will gain a valuable realistic job preview of the Executive Team Leader role over a defined period of time and in multiple areas of the business to drive guest experience and impact your store\xe2\x80\x99s financial, team and operational performance. During our 10-week summer program, you will work closely with a mentor while learning different business areas and functions within our stores. You will spend your days leading and motivating a team, driving sales results, merchandising products and providing an exceptional experience for our guests. It will be your leadership that guides your team to grow and achieve goals.

At Target, we believe in our leaders having meaningful experiences that help them build and develop skills for a career. The role of a Stores Executive Intern can provide you with the:
Knowledge of guest service fundamentals and experience building and managing a guest first team culture across the storeSkills in guest engagement; problem solving and resolutionKnowledge of retail business fundamentalsExperience setting and planning department(s) monthly/quarterly workload to support business priorities and managing a team to deliver service and sales goalsExperience managing a team of hourly team members, team leaders and creating business strategies and goalsSkills in recruiting, selecting and talent management of hourly team members and leaders
As a Stores Executive Intern, no two days are ever the same, but a typical day will most likely include the following responsibilities:
Deliver an exceptional guest experience by ensuring team members are knowledgeable and empowered to make it right for guestsProvide new ideas and recommend solutions to business or team opportunitiesTake initiative to learn how to be a Target leader by seeking out opportunities for growth and development; continuously learn throughout the internship experienceCommit to learning Target\xe2\x80\x99s expectations of leaders and use them to personally develop by asking questions and seeking feedbackActively participate in internship program training activities, developmental opportunities and events.Demonstrate willingness to take risks; step out of comfort zone and take on new assignmentsPartner with leaders regarding TM performance by teaching, coaching, training and delivering timely performance feedbackDemonstrate a culture of ethical conduct, safety, and compliance; lead the team to work in the same way and hold others accountable to this commitmentUnderstand business reporting and guest insights to understand, troubleshoot and follow-up on opportunity areas. Work with store leaders each day to set goals and expectationsGain understanding of all business areas to develop business acumenFoster an inclusive, diverse, safe and secure cultureCarry out principle duties and responsibilities by department through internship rotations as trained.All other duties based on business needs
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
We might be a great match if:
Working in a fun and energetic environment makes you excited\xe2\x80\xa6 We work efficiently and as a team to deliver for our guestsProviding service to our guests that makes them say \xe2\x80\x9cI LOVE TARGET!\xe2\x80\x9d excites you\xe2\x80\xa6 That\xe2\x80\x99s why we love working at TargetLeading teams who are stocking, setting and selling Target product sounds like your thing\xe2\x80\xa6 That\xe2\x80\x99s the core of what we doYou aren\xe2\x80\x99t looking for Monday thru Friday job where you are at a computer all day\xe2\x80\xa6 We are busy all day (especially on the weekends), making it easy for the guest to feel welcomed, inspired and rewarded
The good news is that we have some amazing training that will help teach you everything you need to know to be a Stores Executive Intern. But there are a few skills you should have from the get-go:
Junior or rising Senior class standing preferredPrevious retail experience preferred, but not requiredStrong interest in working in retailLeadership skills and team-oriented thinkingLearn and adapt to current technology needsWork independently and as part of a teamManage workload and prioritize tasks independentlyWelcoming and helpful attitudeEffective communication skills
We are an awesome place to work and care about our teams, so we want to make sure we are clear on a few more basics that we expect:
Access all areas of the building to respond to guest or team member issuesInterpret instructions, reports and informationAccurately handle cash register operationsClimb up and down laddersScan, handle and move merchandise efficiently and safely, including frequently lifting or moving merchandise up to 15 pounds and occasionally or moving merchandise up to 40 poundsFlexible work schedule (e.g., nights, weekends and holidays) and regular work attendance necessary
Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)
Target will provide reasonable accommodations (such as a qualified sign language interpreter or other personal assistance) with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process, please visit your nearest Target store or Distribution Center or reach out to Guest Services at 1-800-440-0680 for additional information.

Title: b'Research Intern - Office of the Chief Scientific Officer'
Summary: b'Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship.'
Details:
b'Virtual Internship

Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship.

Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

The Office of the Chief Scientific Officer is seeking outstanding intern applications for spring, summer, or fall of 2021. Areas of interest include, but are not limited to, challenges and opportunities in the areas of artificial intelligence, biology, and biomedicine.
Responsibilities
Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s best researchers, interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, students are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.
Qualifications
In addition to the qualifications below, you\xe2\x80\x99ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.

Required Qualifications
Must be currently enrolled in an MS or PhD program in CS, EE, biology, biomedical informatics, or a related STEM field or similar level programs in ethics, law, or policy-related fields.
Must have at least 1 year of experience in conducting research, writing peer-reviewed publications.
Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship
Preferred Qualifications
Demonstrated ability to develop original research agendas.
Excellent interpersonal skills, cross-group, and cross-culture collaboration.
History of effective collaborations with researchers and other colleagues.
Passion about embarking on creative, out-of-the-box, unconventional efforts in pursuit of new results and directions.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.'

Title: b'Talent Acquisition Manager (Sales)'
Summary: b'Establish and build a campus recruiting strategy/program to build community relationships, establish Outreach as an internship of choice, and build a long-term\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b"Outreach is a Seattle-based, high-growth pre-IPO start-up with a $1.3B valuation. We are the number one sales engagement platform that helps companies dramatically increase productivity and drive smarter engagement with their customers. More than 4,000 companies such as Adobe, ADT, Tableau, Okta, DocuSign, SAP, and Cisco depend on Outreach\xe2\x80\x99s enterprise-scale, unparalleled customer adoption, and robust AI-powered Innovation.

The Manager of Talent Acquisition will play a critical role in the Outreach growth story. You will build and lead a highly motivated talent acquisition team supporting our Go to Market organization to deliver on aggressive hiring plans while driving process improvements and impactful TA programs that produce results. You will be the strategic TA partner to the executive staff and the operationally excellent leader who inspires our TA team to do their best work.

Your daily adventures will include
Lead a highly motivated TA team to deliver against aggressive hiring plans while evolving best practices across the TA operation.
Champion data-driven sourcing strategies that measurably increase the volume, diversity, engagement, and conversion of our candidate pipelines into an exceptional talent for near-term and future positions at Outreach.
Develop TA enablement capability to equip Outreach with the right information (analytics, BI), tools (tech stack, training, templates), and process innovation across the recruiting cycle to add value and optimize the experience in every candidate and hiring manager interaction.
Simplify and streamline processes to ensure efficiency and economies of scale.
Drive the adoption of recruiting data and KPI's as the baseline for communicating status, developing strategy, instituting change, and developing the team.
Create a diversity hiring strategy and implement programs to support our efforts and increase diversity in our organization.
Establish and build a campus recruiting strategy/program to build community relationships, establish Outreach as an internship of choice, and build a long-term talent pipeline.
Focus our branding efforts to achieve measurable hiring and brand outcomes to establish Outreach as the destination employer for exceptional talent across key disciplines.
Establish effective relationships with business leaders and cross-functional teams as a trusted advisor, SME, partner, coach, and one who gets it done.
Lead example by demonstrating our core values of always having each other\xe2\x80\x99s back, taking ownership, being one with our customers, being hungry craftspeople, finding strength in diversity and inclusion, demonstrating grit and perseverance, and always being honest with ourselves, our colleagues, and our community.
Basic Qualifications
5+ years of experience building and leading high-performance recruiting teams in high-growth environments.
Proven experience scaling recruiting operations, preferably within the SaaS tech industry.
Demonstrated skill in building organizational capabilities around talent acquisition - aligning hiring strategy, institutionalizing data-driven best practices, coaching/influencing leaders, building employer brand.

Title: b'Senior Manager, Campus Recruiting - Tableau'
Summary: b'Develop the strategy for Tableau\xe2\x80\x99s campus recruiting program enabling the company to hire key talent for permanent and internship opportunities.'
Details:
b"To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Recruiting
Job Details
What you\xe2\x80\x99ll be doing\xe2\x80\xa6
The Senior Manager, Campus Recruiting for Tableau is responsible for strategy, planning, coordination, development and execution of Tableau\xe2\x80\x99s global campus program. This will include the overall strategy of the campus program, planning career fairs and campus events, development of university partnerships, working with Tableau leadership and finance to align on hiring demand, and creating and executing the campus D&I strategy. This role will own the growth of Tableau\xe2\x80\x99s internship and campus hiring for permanent roles.
Some of the things you'll be doing include...
Develop the strategy for Tableau\xe2\x80\x99s campus recruiting program enabling the company to hire key talent for permanent and internship opportunities.
Plan and manage all campus activity including career fairs, tech talks, onsite visits, etc.
Manage and scale Tableau\xe2\x80\x99s internship program: working with hiring managers and business leaders to ensure interns are working on meaningful, challenging projects.
Plan and staff all campus activity details and logistics, including working with Tableau Recruiters regarding event follow up.
Partner with Tableau\xe2\x80\x99s marketing team to develop campus branding campaigns and nurturing journeys for candidates pre and post offer acceptance. Execute on ordering materials as needed for all campus activities.
Build and track against a budget for all campus activity.
Track ROI on campus activity to help with future decision-making in growth and direction of Tableau\xe2\x80\x99s campus program.
Provide regular data driven updates to business partners on hiring progress.
Ensure alignment with Salesforce partners on programs and best practices
Who you are\xe2\x80\xa6
Leader. Ability to develop strategy and create programs from scratch. A willingness to jump in and seek solutions.
Innovative. Ability to think outside the box and provide new ideas.
Flexible & Nimble. Ability to work quickly and go the extra mile. Thrive in a fast-paced environment. Pride oneself on a strong work ethic. Self-directed and resourceful.
Technically Savvy. Experience working with an applicant tracking system, such as Workday is preferred.
Customer-focused . Take pride in providing the best possible experience for your customers: candidates and hiring managers alike.
Strong Communicator. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Driver. Highly driven with an execution focus and a strong sense of urgency. Possess a strong belief in Tableau and Salesforce missions.
Team Player. Team player with a positive attitude.
Educated. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree or equivalent experience.
Experienced. 7 + years of experience working on a recruiting team for a fast-paced, growing technology company. 5+ years campus recruiting experience
You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world

Title: b'Lab Assistant'
Summary: b'Completion of a phlebotomy course at a vocational college or equivalent technical school, including completion of a 4-week internship in Phlebotomy in a\xe2\x80\xa6'
Details:
b'Overview:

CommonSpirit Health was formed by the alignment of Catholic Health Initiatives (CHI) and Dignity Health. With more than 700 care sites across the U.S., from clinics and hospitals to home-based care and virtual care services, CommonSpirit is accessible to nearly one out of every four U.S. residents. Our world needs compassion like never before. Our communities need caring and our families need protection. With our combined resources, CommonSpirit is committed to building healthy communities, advocating for those who are poor and vulnerable, and innovating how and where healing can happen, both inside our hospitals and out in the community.

Your time at work should be fulfilling. Rewarding. Inspiring. That\xe2\x80\x99s what you\xe2\x80\x99ll find when you join one of our non-profit CHI facilities across the nation. You\xe2\x80\x99ll find challenging, rewarding work every day alongside people who have as much compassion as you. Join us and together we\xe2\x80\x99ll create healthier stronger communities. Imagine your career at Catholic Health Initiatives!
Responsibilities:

Job Summary
Collects appropriate samples for testing, including phlebotomy procedures, venous and capillary punctures, and urine collections for medical and legal testing procedures.
Work also includes:
1) computer inquiry and entry to maintain patient demographic as well as test ordering details in multiple computer systems in accordance with compliance guidelines;
2) processing and preparing samples for testing at FHS laboratories; and
3) processing, preparing and packaging samples for delivery to testing labs. An incumbent may also provide guidance to new employees/students on department procedures and policies.
Work is conducted in accordance with all regulatory accreditation agency requirements.

Work requires:
1) ability to communicate effectively,
2) exemplify customer service and
3) knowledge of laboratory procedures and equipment, accessioning, verifying specimens and specimen requirements, and skills in using a laboratory information system.

Some assignments may require out-of-office travel.

Essential Job Duties
Performs collections to include venipuncture, capillary procedures, and special collections on pediatric and adult inpatient and outpatient populations using safety devices and tools appropriate for the situation. If applicable, performs urine drug screen collection and Breath Alcohol Testing.
Perform the urine drug collection and testing according to DOT standards.
Provides communications support using established customer service standards.
Accesses hospital and lab information system programs to perform ordering, sample labeling, log-in, test cancellation, test add-on, etc. and final disposition into the sample inventory system/storage program.
Performs processing duties and prepares samples for testing to include: validating patient identity, labeling, centrifugation, aliquoting, and preserving sample integrity. Test ready samples are delivered for testing or packaged for dispatch following specific guidelines.
Completes follow up protocol and maintains audit trail for ambiguous orders or issues to bring resolution to concerns in accordance with department procedures.
Qualifications:

Education/Work Experience Requirements
Completion of a phlebotomy course at a vocational college or equivalent technical school, including completion of a 4-week internship in Phlebotomy in a clinical lab setting; OR equivalent on-the-job training with recent lab experience that demonstrates attainment of the requisite job knowledge/skills/abilities required.
Two years of recent related work experience in a clinical laboratory setting, phlebotomy clinic or other Patient Service Center and one year of insurance collection/data entry work experience that demonstrates attainment of the requisite job knowledge and skills/abilities preferred.

Licensure/Certification
Current Washington State certification as a Medical Assistant-Phlebotomist, OR
Current Washington State certification as a Medical Assistant
National registration with ASCP in Phlebotomy preferred.'

Title: b'Tax Season Accounting Internship (Kenmore)'
Summary: b'Upon successful completion of the internship you may be eligible for a full time staff level position at a later date.'
Details:
b'We are a Seattle Area CPA firm seeking an intern immediately. Our firm focuses on the tax and accounting needs of small businesses in the greater Seattle and Bellevue area. We offer our clients a variety of services in addition to tax preparation, such as tax consulting, business valuation, Quickbooks training, bookkeeping, and IRS guidance.
The position would include working with senior level CPA\xe2\x80\x99s to prepare tax returns (1040, 1120, 1120S, and 1065). This position will allow the intern to see the entire tax return process from when the client drops off their documents to when the return is e-filed with the IRS. The position may also include bookkeeping work, B&O preparation, payroll preparation, and accounting technical writing. Upon successful completion of the internship you may be eligible for a full time staff level position at a later date.
Requirements:
At least Junior standing in credits at your university or college
Completion of at least one 300 or 400 level tax class
Must be available to work through the next tax season
Full or Part-time opportunities are available but must be able to work at least 20 hours per week
Lacerte tax software and QuickBooks software knowledge is a plus, but not required.
If you wish to get college credits for the internship you are responsible for knowing all the requirements for your school and completing all required paperwork.
To Apply: Please submit your resume with a cover letter that includes your GPA to john@huddlestontax.com using the email subject of \xe2\x80\x9cInternship Position.\xe2\x80\x9d
For more information about our firm please visit our website at huddlestontaxcpas.com.'

Title: b'Registered Dietitian - Eating Disorder, Residential'
Summary: b'Center for Discovery\xe2\x80\x99s Dietary Program integrates an All Foods Fit approach, with Intuitive Eating and Health at Every Size (HAES) \xc2\xae principles.'
Details:
b'Job Details
Job Location
1008 Bellevue (NE33) - Bellevue, WA
Position Type
On-Call
Job Shift
On-Call
Job Category
Center For Discovery
Center for Discovery is excitedly searching for a dynamic on-call Registered Dietitian to join our team. If you are looking for an opportunity where you can do the best work of your career, you are in the right place.
Your Impact
Center for Discovery\xe2\x80\x99s Dietary Program integrates an All Foods Fit approach, with Intuitive Eating and Health at Every Size (HAES) \xc2\xae principles. This program is weight inclusive to support our diverse group of clients in healing their relationship with food and body image. The dietary program integrates evidence-based practices to treat all eating disorder diagnoses and co-occurring disorders in collaboration with medical professionals to promote medical stability and nutrition rehabilitation.
In alignment with our integration of Exposure and Response Prevention, clients participate in various food exposures while in treatment to reduce anxiety associated with certain foods or food-related situations.
This integrative and transformative approach empowers clients to find what recovery means for them, through aiding them on the path to improving their relationships with food, mind, and body.

How We Help
At Center for Discovery, we\xe2\x80\x99re passionate about providing compassionate care that utilizes the very best evidence-based treatment options. For more than two decades we\xe2\x80\x99ve helped thousands of clients with eating disorders discover their path to the full and rewarding lives they deserve.
We offer intimate estate-style homes or small outpatient centers that promote healing and personalized attention.

Responsibilities
Conducts two dietary sessions per week with each client.
Facilitates all required groups: Dietary Exposure Group, Menu Planning Group, Restaurant Exposure Group, and in some cases Group Cook Night.
Determines weight goal in collaboration with a medical doctor according to protocol and implements meal plans to support the weight goal.
Manages the dietary budget each month by completing the Dietary Budget Report.
Participates in the weekly treatment team and communicates weekly treatment goals with all team members.
Meets with the client 2 times/week to assess progress and continuation of dietary treatment

Hours

Qualifications
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in an Accreditation Council for Education in Nutrition and Dietetics (ACEND) approved Didactic Programs in Dietetics (DPD).
One year of experience preferred in dietary services.
Must have thorough knowledge of nutrition and dietary interventions in the mental health/eating disorder field
Completion of Dietetic Internship
The Registered Dietitian must also have state registration (if applicable), Commission for Dietetic Registration (CDR) License and ServSafe certification'
